Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a truck

loans.name: Linna

texts.en:
Linna C. is 21 years old, and she is a grocery seller. In fact, she has been in this line of business since 2006, earning approximately US$2.50 per day. Moreover, she is married to Mr. Mei Phanna, 26, a farmer who grows rice (he is pictured). Linna has one daughter, who is small and young.

To generate another source of income, she is seeking a loan in the amount of US$800 to purchase piglets to breed for resale. Importantly, any remaining loan proceeds would be used to purchase chairs for her grocery-selling business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to breed for resale and to purchase chairs for her grocery-selling business

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a member of the Chiara Village Bank. She is 27 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. Marina and her husband chop and sell firewood. Marina buys eucalyptus trees, which workers chop into firewood. The firewood is then brought to the city of Ayacucho and sold to bakeries that use wood-fired ovens. Marina also raises small animals, which she sells in her own district.  Marina needs a loan of 600 soles to buy eucalyptus trees.  Marina’s dreams are for her children to finish school, to have her own investment capital, and to expand her business. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Chiara. 
Marina es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 3 hijos, Marina junto a su esposo se dedican a hacer leña, Marina compra árboles de eucalipto que luego con la ayuda de peones realiza leña que transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho y lo reparte a los hornos de panes. Además Marina se dedica a la crianza de animales menores que vende en su mismo distrito. 
Marina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de árboles de eucalipto. 
Los sueños de Marina son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, tener capital propio y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy eucalyptus trees

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa Q. H. is a member of the Confianza (“Trust”) Village Bank. Ninfa is 48 years old and married with six children, of whom three live with her. Ninfa travels to regional markets three times per week to sell fruits, vegetables and fish. At the markets, she buys animals and cheese; she slaughters the animals herself and sells the meat and cheese from house to house. Ninfa also runs a store from her home, where she sells dry goods, vegetables and meat.  Ninfa needs a loan of $275 to buy sugar and rice.  Ninfa dreams of fixing her home, of opening a large restaurant to sell meals, and of saving enough to provide for her children.
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To buy sugar and rice

loans.name: Nguyen Thi Minh Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Minh sinh năm 1955 ( Mã số: 010107050021 ).. Hiện gia đình cô nuôi 10 con lợn thịt và một đàn lợn con. Chị là giáo viên mầm non nhưng vẫn tăng gia sản xuất. Chồng và hai con chị hang ngày đều đi làm thuê có thu nhập. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Cùng vay vốn với chị còn có:
 Nguyễn Thị Hoà sinh năm 1957( Mã số: 010107050025).  , tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà.
 Hoàng Thị Xuyên sinh năm 1960 ( Mã số: 010107050023).. Chị có cửa hang tạp hoá phục vụ bà con trong thôn. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 200.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư vào cửa hàng 
 Hoàng Thị D. sinh năm 1967( Mã số: 010107050022).  . Gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp. Hàng ngày chị đi chợ bán hang rau có thu nhập. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đi chợ.
 Nguyễn Thị Ánh Tuyết sinh năm 1980( Mã số: 010107050024 ).  . Chị làm nông nghiệp và đi chợ rau. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đi chợ.

loans.use: raising animals, farming

loans.name: Carmen Francisca

texts.es:
CARMEN FRANCISCA E. SANCHEZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” ubicado en el Jr. Trujillo N° 250 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 48 años de edad, 03 hijos, su esposo trabaja en la extracción de madera.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, a condicionó unos cuartos y los puso al alquiler.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,800.00 Nuevos Soles, arregló los ambientes de sus habitaciones, pinto la fachada, arreglo las ventanas y el techo para que sus inquilinos se sientan cómodos.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por apoyarle en el momento que más necesitaba, gracias Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Carmen Francisca E. Sanchez is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Valientes" located at Jr. Trujillo N° 250 in the district of Callería. Carmen is 48 years old and has three children. Her husband works in the removal of wood. The first loan Carmen received was in the amount of $100 which she used to prepare some rooms for rent. She will use this loan in the amount of $575 to improve the conditions of the rooms, paint the facade, repair the windows and the roof so that her renters will be comfortable. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for this support which she was granted right at the moment when she most needed it.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix the conditions of rooms, paint the facade, fix windows and roof.

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru: Исматов Хикматулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 28 лет , женат и имеет одного ребенка. Уже восемь лет занимается торговлей. Торгует продуктами питания на центральном рынке. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы уевличить товарооборот. Это даст возможность привлечь новых клиентов и увеличить доходы. Таким образом жизнь улучшиться. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hikmatullo I. lives in Gissar. He is 28 years old and is married with one child. He has worked ini sales for the past eight years. He sells groceries at the central market. Hikmatullo would like to obtain a loan in order to increase cash flow. This would allow attracting new customers, bring more profit and improve his family's life. Hikmatullo plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Ahmadboy

texts.en: M. Ahmadboy first applied to MicroInvest in 2006 when he decided to purchase a pedigreed bull. He heard from his brother about the MicroInvest loan procedure and decided to take a business development loan. Today he has a good flock of two cows and nine rams. He dreams of having a big flock because he is the father of two boys and he has to think about the future when his sons marry. Ahmadboy also works on the collective farm but his general income depends on the livestock business. Ahmadboy has worked in the livestock business for 10 years so he has good skills. He is applying to KIVA for a loan of 3000 TJS for 9 months to purchase a pedigreed bull. He invites you to visit his home and he wishes all the best in the future.

loans.use: Purchase a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita.
Ana es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Ana tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza hace 6 meses y sus ventas están mejorando poco a poco, antes Ana vendía ropa en ferias y viajaba constantemente es por ello que dejo de realizar este negocio.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, huevo.
Los sueños de Ana es surtir su negocio, ahorrar para comprar un terreno y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Morenita Communal Bank. She is 28 years old, has two children and lives with her domestic partner. Ana has a store in a rented space where she sells groceries, vegetables and fruit. She started this six months ago and her sales have been increasing little by little. Previously, she was selling clothing in markets and was traveling constantly which she gave up to start her current business. Ana needs a loan of 600 Sols that she will use to buy rice, sugar and eggs. Her dreams are to establish her business, save up to buy some land and to build herself a house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa N. est une dame de 67 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle vend du poisson et fait en même temps de l’élevage. Elle souhaiterait développer son commerce afin d’augmenter ses capacités financières. Cette activité lui permet de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Awa N. is 67 years old; she is married and has one child. She sells fish and at the same time raises animals. She wants to develop her business more in order to increase her revenues. Her business allows her to better care for her family's needs.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell fish

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorna B. is a resident of Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Determination and hard work are what Mrs. B. believes in. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative recently, having faith in true service and assistance to needy people. Abject poverty is inevitable for them. It urges her to do her part in increasing their livelihood.

She requested a credit loan from Paglaum MPC after having been a member in order to have additional capital to buy coconuts. The couple’s aspiration is to send their child to school to obtain a degree, and provide a good quality of life.

loans.use: To buy coconuts for resale

loans.name: Women Of The Lighthouse Group

texts.es:
catorce mujeres conforman la asociación “Señoras del Faro” , hace mas de tres años  se reúnen cada dos semanas en el centro focal Villa Tejada ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto. La mayoría están casadas y con familias numerosas, afirman que necesitan ayudar a sus parejas a cubrir los gastos en sus hogares.
Diversas son las actividades de este grupo, María que es la presidenta tiene un puesto en una escuela donde vende dulces y meriendas, Julieta se dedica a la zapatería, otras elaboran tortas y masitas, también venden ropa en la feria de las mañaneras de la C. Tumusla.
La asociación Señoras del Faro, necesita de mayor capital para comprar mercadería al por mayor, de este modo sus ventas aumentaran y obtendrán mayores ingresos, esto les permitirá sostener económicamente a sus hogares.
texts.en:
Fourteen women make up the "Women of the Lighthouse" association. For more than three years they have met every two weeks in the Villa Tejada meeting center located in the city of El Alto. Most are married with numerous family members, and agree that they need to help their partners cover the household expenses. The activities of this group are diverse. Maria, who is the president, has a stand in a school where she sells sweets and snacks. Julieta works in shoe repair and others make cakes and pastries. They also sell clothing in the morning market of Tumusla street. The "Women of the Lighthouse" association needs more capital to buy merchandise at wholesale. This way their sales will increase and they will obtain more income which will permit them to financially sustain their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise at wholesale

loans.name: Mrs. Phary Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group has 24 members, all of whom live in Krapeu Troum village in Kandal province. They will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Phary S., 37, is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to support the field and make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Oau Neat, is a construction worker. They have two children who attend the local school. 

Fourteen members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthL. payment loans. Those who have end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial for Cambodia’s poor. End-of-term loans allow clients to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men S., 39, is a good homemaker. She stays at home to care for the kids and cooks delicious meals for the family as well. The family’s daily expenses are contributed to by her husband, who works driving a trailer motorbike taxi (tuk tuk). He generates an income of $6 each day to sustain his family's expenses more stably. This humble couple has two children who are of school age. Men S. is applying for a loan for her husband to replace his old taxi that has not attracted the customers.

loans.use: To replace her husband's old taxi

loans.name: Anara's Group

texts.en:
The group’s leader, Anara, is a 41-year-old widow, who works as a saleswoman in her own store. Some friends of hers suggested opening a store and thus she entered the challenging world of business. Now, she successfully provides for her family by selling day-to-day goods. Her eldest daughter is married and two other sons still study at school. After school, her sons eagerly help their mother to substitute for the absence of their father. During four years of running a store, she has helped her daughter get married and has bought a flat. Investing a little more than $300, she now has a monthly income of about $700! Anara is seeking a loan to purchase large quantities of sugar, rice and cereal. With the money gained from selling these, she plans to pay her daughter’s dowry. In the near future, she is keen to start building  a new café “Bistro” next to her store. She also wants to buy a new kitchen dresser. 

Erkinbek, Ryskul and Atyrkul are members of Anara’s group. Erkinbek is 39. To provide for his family, he sells strawberries from his own vegetable garden and also resells clover.  He is able to deliver the clover thanks to a friend, who has a truck to transport it. Erbinek has to work hard, since his wife is expecting another baby! Erkinbek is in need of a loan to purchase more clover. 

Ryskul is forty. She owns a shop, where she sells a wide range of convenience goods such as stationery, foodstuffs, detergent and vegetables. She needs a loan to purchase more goods for her store to enrich the assortment. With the profits she expects, she would like to buy a new bedroom suite. 

Atyrkul, 43, is married. She has two daughters. Once, her relatives suggested opening a pavilion for selling foodstuffs. Within three years, Atyrkul has increased her profits and has bought lots of domestic goods for her house. Now, Atyrkul needs a loan to purchase sugar, cereal and macaroni. After reselling these items, she hopes to earn enough to pay for her daughter’s college education. 


======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase large quantity of sugar, rice and cereals

loans.name: Unidos Triunfaremos Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL
UNIDOS TRIUNFAREMOS 

L. Alcancia Comunal “Unidos Triunfaremos” conformado por 10 integrantes, viene trabajando  con EDAPROSPO hace  cuatro años, en L. cual demuestran puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.

Tienen diferentes actividades cotidianas por ejemplo:  Martín, presidente del grupo, compra y venD. artículos usados; L. Sra. Nancy, tesorera del grupo,  se dedica a L. confección y venta D. prendas D. vestir hace muchos años, elL. estudió desD. muy pequeña y poco a poco pudo sobresalir en este campo, ahora tiene sus propias máquinas que le facilitan el trabajo. Esta muy contenta D. pertenecer al grupo.

Jenny se dedica a L. venta D. cosas descartables, tales como platos, vasos, cubiertos, bolsas etc. en el mercado central.
Raúl confecciona todo tipo D. lencería juntamente con su hermano  Yac que además es cantante.

Dina se dedica a L. venta D. dulces tales como pasteles, y mazamorras que son los más pedidos. Las otras socias se dedican a L. venta D. cosméticos por catalogo.

Todos los socios afirman que desean aumentar el capital para sus negocios, y así poder comprar más productos e insumos que le ayudaran a aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The Unidos Triunfaremos Community Bank is maD. up of ten members who have been working with EDAPROSPO for four years. They demonstrate punctuality and responsibility in their payments. They have different daily activities. For example, Martin, president of the group, buys and sells used things. Nancy, the group treasurer, has been making and selling clothes for many years. She studied since she was very small. Little by little she has been able to exceed in this field. Now she has her own machines that facilitate her work. She is very happy to belong to the group. Jenny sells disposable products like plates, glasses, cutlery, and bags, etc. in the central market. Raúl makes all types of lingerie with his brother, Yac, who is also a singer. Dina sells sweets like cakes and pudding, which are the most requested items. The other members sell cosmetics by catalog. All of the members want to increase the capital for their businesses and be able to buy more products and supplies, which will help to increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products and supplies

loans.name: Ngara

texts.fr: Ngara D. est une dame de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de pâte d’arachide. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille
texts.en:
Ngara D. is a 51-year-old lady who is married and the mother of four. She is active in selling peanut butter. Her goal is to improve her family's situation in terms of life, health, and schooling.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For selling peanut butter

loans.name: Maura Inés

texts.es: Maura Inés P. reside en el municipio de Ciudad Delgado del departamento de San Salvador. Maura de 66 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien trabaja como comerciante. Dese hace cuatro décadas, Maura maneja un puesto en el mercado donde vende zapatos y otros productos. Cada año el negocio crece un poco más, lo que llena de alegría y satisfacción a Maura, es por eso que decidida a continuar creciendo, solicita un préstamo para surtir su negocio con Nuevo inventario que le ayude a vender más.
texts.en:
Maura Inés P. resides in Delgado City, which is located in the San Salvador metropolitan area. Maura is 66 years old, and lives with her husband who works as a merchant. For four decades, Maura has managed a stall in the market where she sells shoes and other products. Every year her business grows a little more, which fills Maura with happiness and satisfaction. For this reason, she is determined to continue to grow her business, requesting a loan in order to stock her business with new inventory, which will help her to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock her business with merchandise

loans.name: Casimero

texts.en:
Casimero M. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin. He is 30 years old and single. To make a living, Casimero owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Casimero is just starting this business.

In 2009, Casimero joined HSPFI to access financial services, improve his living situation and ability to engage in business. Casimero is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. ------------------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita R. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntual mete, ahora está solicitando un préstamo a Kiva para los acabados del interior y remodelar el baño de su casa.
Ya que en esté momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Quien se encarga de los ingresos de la familia es su esposo el señor Samuel Mendoza, quien trabaja en una compañía de trasportes en el departamento de chofer de carga, con una parte del ingreso planean pagar esté crédito, ya que desean que su hijo tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita R. has already had two loans with FVP, which she has paid punctually. Now she is requesting a loan from Kiva to finish her home's exterior and remodel her home's bathroom.

Right now, she does not have the capital she needs to buy materials and pay the person who will be in charge of making these improvements. Her husband, Samuel Mendoza, is in charge of the family's income. He works for a transportation company as a load driver. They plan to repay this loan with part of his income, since they want their son to have a higher quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing their home's exterior and remodeling their bathroom

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en:
Rafiq is a Palestinian man living in Gaza city. He is married with one child, 14 years old, who is in ninth grade.

Rafiq has had a grocery store since 2005 and the store is the main source of income for his family. In addition to that, he is an employee in the PNA (Palestinian National Authority). He started this store to help him to cover his family’s expenses as his salary is not enough.

Rafiq needs this loan to buy new products, since buying in larger quantities will save him a lot of money. He appears in the photo at his store

loans.use: To buy new products for his grocery store

loans.name: Etna Azucena

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio está ubicado en el cantón Montecristi en la bella y productiva provincia de Manabí en la región costa del Ecuador,  ésta región se caracteriza por su artesanos que elaboran los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla muy conocidos en el mundo entero, por sus platos típicos, la belleza natural y la amabilidad de la gente. Este banco lo formaron mujeres emprendedoras en busca de una mejor calidad de vida junto a sus familias.

La señora  Etna Azucena P. es una socia activa del banco Comunal Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio, ella es  una profesora  jubilada, vive con su hija y cuatro nietos, a sus 80 años de edad se dedica a las manualidades hace flores en tela, borda con hilo y lana, y lo más interesante que aún le queda tiempo para vender mercadería y participar en  el coro del magisterio que ya  han grabado un disco.

Etna Azucena es muy trabajadora  su hermana que vive en los Estados Unidos  le incursionó en las ventas de  batas de dormir elaboradas en seda y con finos bordados a sus amigas y ex  compañeras de su localidad, cada bata cuesta 28 dólares a crédito (dos pagos)
 
Nuestra socia está solicitando un nuevo préstamo que lo invertirá en la  compra   de pantalones jeans, blusas, camisas, sacos, interiores, calcetines, carteras zapatos  para damas, caballeros y niños para tener un surtido completo  para la época navideña.
texts.en:
The Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio Communal Bank is located in the Montecristi district of the pretty and productive province on Manabí in the coastal region of Ecuador. This region is characterized by craftsmen who make the famous straw hats known throughout the whole world, its typical dishes, the natural beauty, and the kindness of the people. The bank was formed by enterprising women looking for a better quality of life with their families. Etna Azucena P. is an active member of the Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio Communal Bank. She is a retired teacher. She lives with her daughter and her four grandchildren. At her 80 years of age, she makes handicrafts like flowers in material, and she embroiders with thread and wool. It is so interesting that she still has time to sell her merchandise and participate in the teachers’ chorus, which has already recorded a record. Etna Azucena is very hard-working. Her sister, who lives in the United States, got her involved in selling silk bathrobes with fine embroidery to her friends and former colleagues from the area. Each robe costs two payments of $28 each. Our member is asking for a new loan to buy jeans, blouses, shirts, jackets, underwear, socks, purses, and shoes for women, men, and children. She wants to be completely stocked for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes, jeans, blouses, shirts, socks, underwear, and purses

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio C. M. tiene la edad de 26 años, es soltero, no tiene  hijos y vive con su familia. El quiere comprar terneras para la produción de leche y crías así generar mas ingresos. Tiene 6 años que se dedica a ganadería y quiere crecer. Su familia no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. Es el segundo préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades. Él también tiene el deseo de invertirlo lo mejor posible y así hacer que crezca el negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Mauricio C. M. is 26 years old. He is single with no children, and he lives with his family. He wants to buy cows for milk production and to birth calves to increase his income. He has worked as a dairy farmer for six years and wants to grow his operation. His family does not have any problems on their property, but he wants it to be a more productive farm. This is the second loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms. He hopes to make the best investment possible and thus grow the business and improve his family's quality of life. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Bunmi

texts.en:
Bunmi is married with three children, and she is 40 years old. Her husband is a transporter in Lagos. She says her husband has been trying to do his best to improve the family’s standard of living but she needed to play her own part in providing the children with the basic necessities of life.

Bunmi is a trader, well known for selling dry yam (yam tubers peeled or sliced, parboiled and sun-dried) and yam flour (milled dry yam). She has been running this business for over nineteen years now.

Bunmi needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more dry yam and yam flour to sell. She hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more dry yam and yam flour to sell

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo, en el departamento de Chinandega, el señor Cesar S. con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a su actividad de torno elaborando todo tipo de piezas metalicas las que son trabajadas por él mismo en su propia casa de habitación donde es visitado por sus clientes a diario.
Actualmente, el señor Cesar S. atraviesa la necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de su casa de habitación y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de que le sea otorgado un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo esta obra ya que su casa requiere de un mejoramiento para así brindarle a sus tres hijos en edad escolar las condiciones necesarias de vida para que estos se desarrollen y lleguen a tener un techo digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
Mr. Cesar makes a great effort to make metal products on his lathe in his home in the town of Somotillo in the department of Chinandega. His customers visit him there daily. Cesar needs to improve the conditions in his home, so he has approached Ceprodel, hoping that he would be able to obtain a loan so that he can buy building materials so that he can improve his home and give his three school-aged children all that they need and so that they have a good roof over their heads.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy building materials

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia.
DesD. hace 7 años tiene una bodega que implementó en L. casa D. su tía. Trabaja todos los días, y por L. tarD. cuenta con L. ayuda D. una D. sus hijas mayores.
Esther está siempre pendiente D. surtir su tienda con los diversos productos comestibles que más le solicitan sus clientes y  vecinos. D. esta manera, garantiza las ventas en su negocio, elL. desea tener una tienda más amplia y mejor surtida, por lo que seguirá luchando e invirtiendo en su negocio.

Esta es L. tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, además está muy contenta D. ser parte D. un banco comunal, por lo que se compromete – nuevamente - a ser puntual en todos sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en L. compra D. más mercadería para su tienda, productos tales como leche y panetones.
texts.en:
Esther, 36, lives with her husband and 4 children in her own house. For the last 7 years she has run a grocery store that she set up in her aunt's house. She works every day and can count on help from one of her older daughters in the afternoons. Esther is always careful to stock her store with the food items that her customers and neighbors most want. This way, she insures sales. She hopes to have a larger, better-stocked store so, she continues to work and invest in her business. This is her third loan with MFP. She is happy to be part of a communal bank and pledges, once again, to be very punctual with her payments. The funds requested on this occasion will be used to buy stock items, like milk and panetones (a festive Italian yeast cake flavored with candied fruit peels and raisins), for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items, like milk and panetones, for her store.

loans.name: Meteur

texts.en:
Meteur is 48 years old, married to Nemama ene Meteur, and they have six school-going children.  He has been in the motorcycle business for the last two years, operating on the outskirts of Naivasha town.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be his first loan, which he plans to use to buy a new motorcycle to continue operating his taxi business.

He hopes to grow in the transport industry in the future by owning a mini bus and a lorry.

loans.use: Buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Sipola

texts.en: Sipola is a 58-year-old married lady with five children, two of whom are still in school.   She has been selling kales and spinach in Kawangware open air market for three years.  She feels her standard of living has improved since she joined Faulu Kenya.  She wants to take her first loan of KES 20,000 to buy more spinach and kales. She hopes to succeed as a business-lady in the future.   She sees her business expanding and generating a huge profit.  She describes herself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: Purchase of spinach and kales

loans.name: Mr. Morn Meun Village Bank Group

texts.en: In the village of Kork Romiet in the Kandal province, a group of fifteen people have requested a village bank loan. All of the members selected Mr. Morn M. to be the village bank president. The members will use the loan for different purposes. Mr. Morn M. is an electrician, and his wife, Mrs. Nary Korn, is a tailor in the local village. Mr. Morn M. and his wife work hard at their businesses, but they do not earn enough money because their sewI. machine does not have the electricity it needs to run. Thus in order to improve the family's livI. conditions, Mr. Morn M. decided to ask for a loan to buy electrical supplies for his sewI. machine. He is a father of a child who is too small to work or go to school. All of the members of the village bank loan are shown in the picture, but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy electrical supplies.

loans.name: Luz Gaby

texts.es:
Luz tiene 42 años D. edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, D. los cuales su 
hija mayor se encuentra en la Universidad y los otros 2 en edad escolar. Ella inicio 
el negocio hace 3 años con capital lo adquirio  a través D. un crédito obtenido en forma 
grupal y D. allí ha ido incrementando el negocio, hace 2 años inicio el negocio D. 
venta D. golosinas en el paradero D. los ómnibus que trasladan a las personas que 
trabajan en los fundos. Ella atienD. el negocio D. manera muy calida y amable ya que 
la gran mayoría D. sus clientes son sus vecinos D. la zona, el sueño D. Luz es 
incrementar poco a poco su negocio ya que con los ingresos obtenidos esta educando a 
sus hijos, y que D. esta manera ellos puedan tener un mejor futuro. Solicita el 
crédito para la compra D. mercadería y para gastos escolares.
texts.en:
Luz is 42 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and 3 children. Her oldest daughter is in University and her other children are school-aged. She began her business three years ago, having gotten her starting capital through a group loan and she has since been growing the business. Two years ago she began selling snacks at the bus stop to people who work nearby. She attends to her business in a very friendly and loving way, as most of her customers are also her neighbors. Luz hopes to grow her business little by little, now that she is able to pay for her children's education with her income. She wants them to have a better future. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy more snacks and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ghulam Rasool Group

texts.en: Afghan Gul is a member of the G. Rasool group. She lives in the 1st district of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is 40 years old and married with five children. She is a hard-working woman who has a quilt-sewing business with which she supports her family. She sews different kinds of quilts — especially ones she makes for Afghan brides. She hopes to grow her business and will use the loan to purchase cloth and different kinds of thread. She is grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To grow her quilt-sewing business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a LAPO client. She is 51 years old, married with 8 children. Her children are doing well at school. Her husband works as a security guard to support their home. She is a hard working woman. She cooks and sells cassava dough popularly known as Santana or akpu. She has been in this business for long. She is very determined and wants to expand the size of her business in order to make more profits to support her home. She is requesting for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more cassava to cook more cassava dough to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to cook more cassava dough to sell

loans.name: Hector Neiton

texts.es: El Sr. Hector tiene 36 años de edad es conviviente tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, cuenta con casa propia de material noble de un piso en contruccion, ubicado en el Distrito de parcona. El se dedica como operario de construccion hace 10 años, se inicio desde muy joven dejo por un tiempo de laborar por motivos de salud. Cuenta adicionalmente con el ingreso de alquiler de un  automovil tico. Su objetivo es poder terminar de construir su casa, que actualmente esta realizando los acabados de una parte  contruida, con el dinero que solicita invertira en la culminacion de los acabados de su casa.
texts.en:
Hector, 36, lives with his life partner and their 5-year-old son; he owns his one-storey house, located in Parcona district, which is still being built out of substantial materials. He has been a construction worker for 10 years; he began at a very early age but stopped working for a time due to health problems. He also earns extra money leasing a Tico automobile. His goal is to finish building his house. Currently, he’s doing the finishing touches on the part of the house that’s complete and will use the requested funds to finish them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete the finishing touches on his house.

loans.name: Rositas  De Final Castillo Group

texts.es:
“Rositas de Final Castillo”  es un grupo de 9 señoras que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Juan Pablo II”,  se agruparon hace poco por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo. Todas tienen diversos negocios de producción, servicio y comercio. Una de las integras es Florencia Amalia H. de 48 años, ella vende ropa  hace 10 años en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, de 7 de la mañana a 12 del medio día.
Florencia con los ingresos de este negocio ha podido sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos de los cuales 3 son casados y 3 dependen de ella.

Florencia necesita el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, sobre todo en ésta época de invierno las prendas abrigadas tienen mayor demanda.
texts.en:
“Rositas de Final Castillo” (Final Castillo Roses) is a group of nine women who meet at Juan Pablo II focus center. They got together recently in order to access a loan since they all need to increase their working capital. Each has a different production, service or commercial business. One of the members is Florencia Amalia H., 48. She has sold clothing in various markets in El Alto for the last 10 years. She works from 7am until noon. Income from this business has made it possible for Florencia to raise her 6 children, three of whom are married and 3 who still are dependent on her. Florencia needs the funds to buy merchandise, especially during this winter season when warm clothing is in great demand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy warm winter clothing.

loans.name: Otgontenger

texts.en: Otgontenger V. is 23 years old and lives with her husband in Arhangai province, western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. She and her husband work as drivers in their town. The couple started their transportation business in 2009. During the last year, she has saved money to improve her family's quality of life. Otgontenger is an open-minded, hard working and tidy woman. She is requesting a 650,000 MNT loan in order to buy newer, more comfortable furniture for their home.

loans.use: To purchase furniture.

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran is the wife of M. A.. They are citizens of the city of Pakpattan in Pakistan. Pakpattan is famous for its sugar and shrines to the saints.

Manzooran and her family are very simple persons. They spend their life with simplicity. They have a dairy business. They get milk from their cows and sell it to the milk shops and in the neighborhood.

Manzooran has applied for a loan from Asasah for the dairy business. With the loan amount they will buy another dairy cow and expand their dairy business.

loans.use: To purchase another dairy cow for the dairy business

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George N. N. is twenty-five years old, is single, and does not have any children yet.

George’s business is located at Ruiru in Thika town. Thika is the region in Kenya known for its production of pineapples. He sells sweets (candies), batteries, paper bags, steel wire, lotions, detergents and other items. He hawks his items (goes door-to-door) and has been doing this business for two years now.

George says that this business is profitable and the major challenges he has are financial constraints. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well.

George is using his Kes 70,000 loan to buy a motorcycle to enable him to hawk his goods more easily. He hopes to own his own shop some day. He is very hardworking and innovative.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to help him hawk his goods

loans.name: Mauricio Jose

texts.es: El señor Mauricio Rodríguez González, es casado y  tiene una hija ya mayor de edad que vive aparte. Su esposa trabaja como despachadora en una Ferretería. El señor Mauricio es dueño de un Cyber llamado Multinet, el cual está localizado en su casa de habitación. El señor inicio con este negocio desde hace 4 años, el posee bastante clientela, ya que está localizado en una zona bastante recurrente. El señor está solicitando este crédito con el propósito de realizar inversiones principalmente en maquinas para el cyber. Algo que el aduce, es que al tener más maquinas puede ofertar mas su producto y así obtiene mayores ganancias. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a establecer un cyber en el centro de la ciudad, ya que allí la oferta seria bastante grande.
texts.en:
Mauricio Rodríguez González is married and has a daughter who is older and now lives away from home. His wife works attending to customers in a hardware store. Mauricio owns and internet café called Multinet which is located in his home. He opened this business four years ago and has many customers as it is located in a well-traveled area. He is requesting this loan with the purpose of making an investment in computers for the internet café. The reason he gives for this is that if he has more computers he can offer more of his product and thus obtain better profits. His dream has always been to be able to establish an internet café in the center of the city as there is more business there.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Huamaní Espinoza

texts.es:
El Sr. Huamaní Espinoza B. se dedica a realizar servicio de cerrajería y estructuras metálicas en general. También es maestro en construcción y tiene experiencia mas de 10 años.
Vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos.
Solicita el préstamo para construir un cuarto en su casa y asi brindar maor comodidad a su familia.
Le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza y aspira a formar una empresa.
texts.en:
Mr. Huamaní Espinoza B. works in locksmith services and general hardware. He is also a master constructor and has more than 10 years of experience.

He lives with his wife and three children.

He is requesting this loan to build another room in his house so that he can provide his family with greater comfort.

He likes very much the work that he does and hopes to form a company.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Javzanjav

texts.en:
Javzanjav D. is 54 years old and lives with her family in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic housing dwelling. Her husband is retired and her son is disabled, therefore both stay at home. 

Javzanjav operates a small canteen in her town with the help of her husband. They began their business in 2000 in their yard, where they cooked a variety of meals for the local community. 

She hopes to use her business earnings to provide for her family and to build a winter house in the future. She is a modest, helpful and hardworking woman and is requesting a 500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to both purchase a variety of inventory for her cooking as well as to repair her house and fence.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of inventory

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly C. is 37 years old, married to Henry Sirimo Komen.  They have four children age fourteen years, seven years, five years and three years respectively. They live in Kapsoya an outcast of Eldoret town. Selly has dairy farm where she earn her income. She has been in this business for the past four years with an income of Kshs.30,000 per month.

Selly was introduced to KADET LTD by Credit officer.  She is applying for a loan of Kshs 25,000 with KADET LTD with which she plans to purchase two more dairy cattle for milk production. 

She hopes to operate a large scale dairy farm, so she is able to supply milk to hotels.

loans.use: To purchase two more dairy cattle

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el anexo La Curva, una comunidad pequeña situada en la zona rural del distrito agrícola de Cayalti, lugar ubicado a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros) ella alquila su vehículo a un chofer particular para que brinde el servicio de transporte publico en el Cayalti y en sus anexos. Esta actividad le viene proveyendo de ingresos desde hace mas de 3 años.

Martina desea brindar mantenimiento y algunas reparaciones a su unidad movil ya que esta ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas producto del excesivo uso y del mal estado de las carreteras de la zona. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Martina es una mujer entregada a su familia y que se vale de esta actividad para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poder mejorar su calidad de vida y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Martina, 47, is married and has two children.  She lives with her family in La Curva Annex, a small community located in a rural area of Cayalti, a farming district, located over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

She owns a mototaxi (motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with a cabin attached to provide passenger and cargo transport).  She leases her vehicle to a driver who provides public transportation services in Cayalti and surrounding areas.  This activity has been generating income for over three years.

Martina wants to provide some needed maintenance and repair to her vehicle because it’s starting to show some mechanical problems due to excessive use and the poor state of roads in the area.  She is, therefore, asking for her first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

Martina is a woman who is dedicated to her family and who relies on this activity to help her husband support the family.  Her greatest wish is to be able to improve her quality of life and to succeed in life.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a widowed woman with nine children, five girls and four boys. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are clothing, electricity and water bills. 

She operates a Kikoi-selling (cloth used as traditional African clothing) business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanamkuu hopes to renovate her house in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase Kikoi's and building materials to repair her stall. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase Kikoi's and building materials to repair her stall

loans.name: Adelma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Adelma; ella tiene 66 años de edad, separada  y tiene 2  hijos.  La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa en forma independiente , la socia quiere ampliar su negocio y mejorar.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como chompa , blusas, pantalones.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Adelma belongs to the “Amauta” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Adelma is 66 years old.  She is separated and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling clothes, an activity which she does independently.  She would like to expand and improve her business.

She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as sweaters, blouses and pants.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sweaters, blouses and pants

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas al Progreso”  ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 03 hijos. Solo pudo estudiar hasta 4to de educación primaria.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 02 años, su   primer préstamo  fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizará para comprar carnes para hacer chicharrón (comida típica)

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar el negocio e incrementar sus ganancias.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y lo que ganan sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a member of the community bank "Azangarinas al Progreso," which is located in the Azángaro district, in the Azángaro province and the department of Puno. She is 25 years old, is married, and has 3 children. She was only able to complete the fourth year of primary education.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 2 years. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, and she used the money to increase the working capital of her business. She sells fast food.

She is now applying for a new loan for 600 PEN, which she will use to buy meat to make chicharrón, a typical food.

Her dream for the future is to improve her business and increase her earnings. What she likes most about her community bank are the meetings and the earnings from her savings.

loans.use: Buy meat to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia de 57 años,   ha sido una madre soltera desde hace muchos años atrás por eso  ha mantenido el hogar hasta que sus hijos crecieran.  Para dales una mejor vida a sus hijos y asegurar su futura vejez ella readecuo su casa ubicando una pequeña tienda en la entrada de su casa. 

Ella tiene la tienda desde que se separo de su esposo para poder conseguir sus propios ingresos, comenzó comprando enlatados, granos, dulces a un precio económico. Por vivir en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso y conocido porque es una de las zona marginales de Guayaquil pudo valerse de esa oportunidad y comenzar a vender con un mayor volumen su mercadería. 

Para poder incrementar su mercadería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo bebidas, lácteos, enlatados. En el futuro quiere ampliar y surtir más su tienda para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Natalia, age 57, has been a single mother for many years.  Therefore, she has maintained her home until her children are grown.  In order to give her children a better life and to insure her old age in the future, she fixed up her house by placing a small store at the entrance.

She has had the store since she separated from her husband.  She has the store in order to get her own income.  She started by purchasing canned goods, grains, and sweets at an economical price.  She lives in a periurban zone called Paraíso.  It is known as one of the marginal zones in Guayaquil.  She was able to make use of this opportunity, and she started selling her merchandise in greater quantities.

In order to be able to increase her merchandise, she wants to use the loan to buy drinks, dairy products, and canned goods.  In the future she wants to expand and stock her store more.  She wants to do this in order to give her children a better future.

loans.use: Canned goods and grains

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng S., 28, sells bread, earning an income of USD 10 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat Temple. The family spends $30 on food, $10 on electricity supply, and $35 on other necessary expenses every month. Her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of USD 5 per day. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase a sugar cane squeezer to expand her business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

his is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a sugar cane squeezer to expand her food business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: He wants to make a good super market

loans.name: Adeles

texts.en:
Adeles H. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. Adeles has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

 In 2009, Adeles joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is an individual member of PMPC. Adeles is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This  will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.use: For additional capital

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en:
Joselyne is a hairdresser and runs her own salon. She is 31, single, and has two children who are 4 and 8 years old.  She also cares for four dependents.  She manages a clean and well-organized salon which she has had for eight years.  Currently she has six people who work for her.

Joselyne will use this loan to purchase a new hair dryer, new heat tongs, some chairs, hair mesh and other necessary supplies.  She is also interested in employing some new staff.  Any profits she makes will go directly back into expanding and purchasing more goods for her business.

loans.use: to buy new hair tongs, a hair dryer, chairs and hair mesh

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca R. is from the town of Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 61 years old. Rebecca is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Rebecca owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling personal products such as glasses and watches in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rebecca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Rebecca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, tiene 68 años, es una mujer jovial y optimista. Es separada, vive en su casa propia con su hijo mayor de nombre José, de los 6 que tiene, y su nieto Jeremy de 13 años, quien es su engreído. Esta emprendedora madre de familia, con mucho esfuerzo forjó su bodega y la hizo prospera, asimismo compró su carro, herramienta que le sirvió para sacar adelante a sus hijos, que ahora son  personas de bien y trabajadoras. Sin embargo enfermó por mucho tiempo, por lo que poco a poco su tienda fracasó manteniendo sólo el carro, en donde su hijo lo utilizó. Desde entonces, y alrededor de 7 años, ella administra las ganancias que recibe al ofrecer el servicio de transporte, actualmente logró darle mantenimiento técnico a su vehículo. Está  convencida que de seguir trabajando y cuidando de su salud,  mas adelante podrá tener nuevamente  su bodega que tanto le gusta y anhela, “a pesar de ser muy esclavizada”, acotó. Pero, por el momento su mayor prioridad  es llevar al taller de mecánica a su carro, para que su hijo continúe  trabajando sin dificultad. Es su 13avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y dice “que confíen en ella, ya que pagará todas sus cuotas como ejemplo de la líder de todo este tiempo de su grupo comunal, a quienes les estima mucho por su apoyo”. Con el crédito que solicita, realizará mantenimiento mecánico a su carro, para que continúe trabajando y generando buenas utilidades.
texts.en:
68 year-old Jesús is a jovial and optimistic woman.  She is separated and lives in her own home with her eldest son called José (she has 6 children in all).  She also lives with her 13 year-old grandson Jeremy who is her treasure.  This enterprising mother, through a lot of hard work, set up a small grocery store and made it prosper.  She also bought a car, a tool with which she has managed to get her children ahead in life.  Her children are now good, hard-working people.  However, Jesús was sick for a long time and, as a result, her store gradually failed.  She only had her car left and her son used it.

For approximately 7 years, Jesús has been managing the profits that she receives from offering a transport service.  She recently managed to renew her car.  She is convinced that if she continues to work and look after her health, in the future she will be able to re-open her store which she likes so much and she wishes for this "in spite of the fact that it is very enslaving".

At the moment, Jesús' main priority is to have her car serviced so that her son can continue to work without difficulty. She has set an example as the leader of her community bank during this time.  Her fellow members like her a lot for the support she has provided.

Jesús will use the loan she is requesting to have her car serviced so that her son can continue working and making good profits.

loans.use: to have her car serviced

loans.name: Lindi Group

texts.en:
Mwanaid A., who is married with three children, has been a food vendor for 9 years. She works from 6.00 pm  to 11.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mwanaid's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the food stock and pay school fees. She has paid back her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase food stock, and pay for school fees and household expenses.

Mwanaid will share this loan with her loan group, Lindi, which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Mwanaid is 1st on the right with a red scarf on her head.

loans.use: to increase business, and pay for school fees and household expenses.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
El grupo Sonia del Carmen R. R. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 47 años. Ella inicio su negocio hace 14 años vendiendo paca (ropa usada) y desde hace un año puso una pequeña venta la cual poco a poco fue surtiendo.
Ella tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo la menor es depende de ella que es una niña de 6 años.
texts.en: Sonia del Carmen R. R. is a hardworking, determined, and enterprising woman who is 47 years of age.  She started a business fourteen years ago selling bales of used clothing.  Within the past year, she also opened a small store that she is gradually stocking with merchandise.  Sonia has five children, but only one is a dependent, a six year old daughter.

loans.use: To purchase bales of used clothing and dry goods for her store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: L. Sra. Yolanda es una persona que  actualmente vive soL., L. visitan sus hijos los fines D. semana, actualmente  su esposo trabaja en estados unidos y  le envía dinero  por semana para sus gastos solo que este  dinero  no le es suficiente para hacerle algunos arreglos a su casa ya  que  actualmente L. pintura D. su hogar esta ya algo deteriorada  y  necesita pintura   del  interior  y exterior D.  su vivienda, L. Sra. Yolanda esta  muy   agradecida  por  el apoyo  brindado para poder  hacer  realidad   su proyecto.
texts.en: Yolanda currently lives on her own.  Her children visit her on weekends.  Yolanda's husband is currently working in the United States and sends her money every week to cover her expenses.  However, this money isn't enough to make some repairs to her home.  The paintwork is somewhat worn and she needs to re-paint both insiD. and outsiD..  Yolanda is very grateful for the support she has been offered which will enable her to carry out her project.

loans.use: to paint the inside and outside of her home

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert S. is 28 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Robert has a restaurant business, which he has run for three years.
To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for cooking in his restaurant. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Robert hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase more food for cooking in his restaurant.

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
Ana Maria  es la recien electa presidenta D. la Alcom “ Las Hormiguitas” conformada por siete  socios cada uno dedicado a diferentes rubros D. actividades economicas. Ana Maria actualmente administra una pequena fuente D. soda; en donD. venD. bebidas., helados y golosinas. Ana Maria nos comenta que el negocio era D. sus suegros pero se lo entregaron para ayudar a su familia. Actualmente le va muy bien por lo cual desea ampliarlo y llegara  convertirlo en una bodega completa. El credito obtenido sera invertido en la compra D. diferentes marcas D. bebidas gaseosas y golosinas para diversificar su stock. Ana Maria desea ahorrar para construir un cuarto mas granD. en la casa D. sus suegros y asi vivir mas comodamente  con sus dos hijos menores y su conviviente.
Ana Maria esta agradecida y juntos a sus socios emprenden este sistema responsablemente.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is the recently elected president of the “Las Hormiguitas” (The Ants) Communal Bank.  The bank is comprised of seven members, and each one of them in engaged in different economic activities.

Ana Maria currently runs a small soda fountain where she sells drinks, ice cream, and sweets.  Ana Maria tells us that the business was her mother and father-in-laws, but they gave it to her to help her family.   It is currently going very well, and that is why she wants to expand it and convert it into a complete grocery store. 

The loan will be used to buy different brands of soft drinks and sweets in order to diversify her stock.  Ana Maria wishes to save in order to build a larger room in her mother and father-in-law’s house.  That way she will live more comfortably with her two minor children and her life partner.  Ana Maria is grateful, and together with the other members she responsibly undertakes this arrangement.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and sweets for her store.

loans.name: C 7967 Abatarutinya Group

texts.en:
Charlotte is 30 years old and married, with five children aged between 4 and 11 years old. She sells rice from her field and her business is well known and well organized. Business hours are from 7 a.m. until 1 p.m. on weekdays. Charlotte is the leader of this group called "ABATARUTINYA". She is the second person on the right in the first row, wearing a white t-shirt.  

Charlotte has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by purchasing more rice to cultivate. She will use the profit generated from this loan to reinvest in her business, to save for the future and to pay her children`s school fees.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more rice to cultivate.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is divorced and has 2 children. She sells kenkey and fish at Abura, and has done so for five years. Ama uses her income to pay for her children's school fees and utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase maize to prepare kenkey and fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to invest in her children's education. In this picture she is standing close to the oven she uses to smoke the fish.

loans.use: to purchase maize to prepare kenkey and fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline has been selling clothes for the last four years. She is a hardworking 36-year-old businesswoman who supplements her income from selling mobile-phone credit cards. In the next five years, she hopes to expand her business and to reach more customers. Her dream is to have a better future. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become self independent.

She wants to start dairy farming; hence she has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 45-year-old married man with six children, all living in a residential permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Charged with the responsibility of looking after the family, Christopher's major dream is to get a business that can sustain his family. He is a company accountant and a farmer, which has facilitated him in providing for the family. He has a challenge of limited land to farm on and his desire is to own at least 20 acres of land. Christopher needs this loan to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, es una mujer luchadora de 49 años, que vive junto a su esposo Antonio, con el que educó y sacó adelante a sus 3 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Su esfuerzo y dedicación, hicieron que su familia sea su mayor orgullo.  “La agricultura”, su principal actividad económica desde hace 20 años, hizo posible que pagará los estudios superiores de sus hijos, los cuales le visitan constantemente y se siente feliz de tener el amor de sus nietos, a los que consiente mucho. Sus principales cultivos, son  flor de gladiolo, arveja y papa, los que tenazmente cuida y fertiliza; pues sabe que de eso depende la buena venta en cada cosecha, ya que vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, y dependiendo de la calidad, los lleva a la capital del país, donde le pagan mayor precio. Ella tiene sembrado gladiolo y arveja que pronto cosechará y para lo cual se está preparando. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y esté es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de ser responsable y honesta con el desarrollo de su banco comunal. Yolanda de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 7 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para nutrir sus sembríos de arveja y flor de gladiolo que dentro de unos meses cosechará.
texts.en:
Yolanda, age 49, is a hardworking woman who lives with her husband Antonio. Together they have been able to succeed on behalf of their children and provide them an education. At the moment, only one child lives with them in their home in the village of Patay. Through effort and dedication, Yolanda and her husband formed a family that gives them great pride. Farming has been her main business activity for the past 20 years and has made it possible for her to pay for her children’s higher education. Her children visit her frequently and she is happy to have the love of her grandchildren who she spoils. Yolanda’s main crops are gladiola flowers, peas, and potatoes. She provides her crops frequent care and fertilization because she knows this attention will result in good sales at the end of each harvest. Yolanda sells her crops at the wholesale market in Tarma. Depending on the quality of her crops, she will even take them to Lima where she can get a better price. She planted gladiolas and peas early and they will soon be ready to harvest.

Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank “Picaflores de Patay” and is receiving her fifth loan from MFP. She hopes to receive everyone’s support so that she can continue with her goals. In addition, she wants to be responsible and honest with the development of her Communal Bank. With the support she received, Yolanda will invest the money she requested in the purchase of seven sacks of natural fertilizers for her pea and gladiola crops that will be harvested in a few months.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Solidario Luchadoras De Sacatepequez Group

texts.es:
Solidario lUCHADORAS DE SACATEPEQUEZ.
Este grupo quien está integrada por 3 mujeres originarias de San Juan Sacatepéquez,  quienes se dedican a la venta de ropa en el caso de  doña Hermenegilda Quien es la lider del grupo ella vende flores y tortillas,nos cuenta que  gracias a Dios le ha ido bien en su negocio, realiza la venta de tortillas desde hace 25 años con lo que ella ha logrado apoyar y ver crecer a sus hijos,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz para la elavoracion de tortillas, las otras dos socias estan solcitando este credito porque nececitan capital para trabajar. el sueño de ellas es tener un local mas grande y darles un mejor futuros a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Solidarity group "Luchadoras de Sacatepéquez" ("Fighters from Sacatepéquez") is made up of three women from San Juan Sacatepéquez. They sell clothing and, in the case of group leader Hermenegilda, flowers and tortillas. She says that, thanks to God, her business has been doing well. She has been selling tortillas for 25 years, which is how she has been able to support and raise her children. 

She is requesting this loan so she can purchase corn to make tortillas. The other two members are requesting this loan because they need working capital. Their dream is to own a larger store and give their children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Jane Rose

texts.en:
Jane Rose lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of an additional family member (a sister). 

Jane Rose has a beauty salon. She has been in this business for three years, and she works six days out of every week. Jane Rose sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. 

The main business challenges for Jane Rose include seasonality and the increasing prices of braids and cream relaxers. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon. 

Jane Rose lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and Braids

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Josefina tiene ya más 16 años dedicándose a la venta de artículos escolares (papelería).
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en compra de mercancía que son cuadernos, lápices, plumas, colores, tijeras, pegamento y hojas para copiadora, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la inversión ya que le están venden estos productos a muy buen precio, quiere aprovechar esta oferta y así poder realizar paquetes de útiles escolares y tener a la venta, y ayudar también a su clientes en el ahorro escolar. 
Desea mejorar su negocio y la calidad de vida de su familia.
Entre Doña Maria Josefina y su esposo el señor Victor Manuel son los que atiende el papelería  y cuidan de sus dos hijos. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Josefina  has been selling school supplies (paper products) for more than 16 years.

She is asking for the loan to invest in buying merchandise, such as notebooks, pencils, pens, colors, scissors, glue and copying paper. She doesn't have enough money to make the investment and they are selling these products to her at a good price. She wants to take advantage of this and be able to make packages of school supplies to sell, thus also helping her customers save some money on school expenses.

She wants to improve her business and her family's quality of life. Between Maria Josefina and her husband Victor Manuel, they run the paper store and raise their two children. With a part of her earnings from her business, she plans on paying off the loan since this is her family's main source of income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her paper business.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es: La Sra. Sara es la presidenta D. la alcancía “MARIA AUXILIADORA” tiene 6 hijos los cuales son mayores D. edad, la cualidades que resaltan en Sara son el respeto, puntualidad y cooperación, se dedica al negocio D. la venta D. productos D. belleza ya hace mas D. 2 años, el sueño que quiere cumplir es tener una bodega para así poder tener un sustento en el futuro, el préstamo que adquirió lo utilizara en la compra D. mas productos.
texts.en: Senora Sara is the president of the communal bank “MARIA AUXILIADORA”. She has 6 children who are all adults. The personal qualities exemplified by Senora Sara are respect, punctuality and cooperation. She has been selling beauty products for more than 2 years. The dream she wants to realize is to have a store in order to have a livelihood in the future. The loan she has taken will be used to buy more products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

borrowers.first_name: Ramos Pelayo De Varela Gloria Olinda
Velasquez Torres De Mendoza Paula Maria

loans.name: Ulanbayar

texts.en: Ulanbayar is 25 years old and lives with her parents and sisters in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her sisters are high school and university students. Her parents sell food and snacks. She graduated from a hairdresser's training course in 2005 and started her business in 2006. Now she provides hair care service at the local market. She has many years of business and work experience. She plans to expand her business, buy necessary equipment and tools, and decorate her commercial space to attract more customers. She is a diligent, hardworking, and energetic woman who says, "I want to have customers and provide the best service I can give. To do this, I need to have equipment and tools and attractive commercial space." She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to buy necessary tools and to decorate her commercial space.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools and to decorate her commercial space

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 24 years old and married to Philip who does "bodaboda" (motorcycle transport) business to produce additional income for the family. She has two children  ages three and two years old.

She runs a retail shop and she has been in business for two years. Right now her monthly income from the business is 3,000. She is taking out a loan of KES 5,000 to add more stock of tea leaves, salt, and detergents for sale.

Margaret  plans to expand her business with the anticipated profit from the business.This is her first loan and her hope and dream is to continue with her retail shop and to educate her children.

loans.use: To  buy more stock of tea leaves, salt, and  washing detergent  for sale.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 53 years old and married with 6 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Isabelita is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Isabelita has been raising pigs for 36 years and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for raising pigs

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana, age 26 (shown holding the Asasah Passbook), is a homemaker. She is very active and has many household duties. She and her husband have a six-year-old son who is enrolled in the first grade.

Her husband sells wheat at the local market. He is very fair with his clients in his dealings and sells high-quality wheat. Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan funds, he will buy wheat in larger quantities, which will allow him to provide better-quality wheat in larger quantities, thus allowing him to earn more profits.
