Rukhsana is confident that her husband will become more successful in his business after the loan investment. He has been operating his business for many years and Rukhsana has full confidence in him.

She is a new loan applicant through Asasah.

loans.use: to buy wheat to offer for sale

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. 

Manilyn has a shop that sells canned goods, noodles, shampoo and detergents. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, shampoo and soaps.

Manilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Manilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, shampoo and soaps

loans.name: Gnen

texts.en: Mrs. Gnen is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of 4 single children. She lives and works as a local primary teacher in Kompong Cham province. She is an experienced and skillful teacher. Mrs. Gnen has been engaged in this business since 2000 and typically gets her monthly salary of 80 USD. She doesn’t have any difficulties in her teaching performance, she said, but it’s hard for her to get to work by walking or cycling. So she decided to request a loan from Kiva for the purchase of a motorcycle. She hopes that she will be able to have a comfortable living through using this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah, 41, is the mother of five children who are already in school. The children are aged between 16 and 7 years. She lives with her family in Kitale, Western Kenya, where she has practiced farming for the last twenty years. Her farm currently produces milk, maize, and poultry for the local market.

Veronicah has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the loan will improve her farming income and enable her to boost her tailoring business, which she runs besides farming. She hopes to increase her farm size and buy more dairy cows as well.

However, she laments the high cost of feed and the poultry diseases which result in the death of chicks.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Satta

texts.en:
Satta is 23 years old and lives in Barnersville. She is single and a college student. For a year Satta has been involved in selling fashion slippers. 
 
She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion slippers for her business. She has more customers and makes a lot of profit. Her plan is to build a house and get married, since she is in a relationship.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion slippers for her business.

loans.name: Siama

texts.en: Siama is a 40-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan, for seven years. Siama is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Union Trabajo Y Desarrollo (Rocafuerte) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unión Trabajo y Desarrollo se reúne cada quince días en un la ciudad de  Rocafuerte perteneciente a la Provincia de Manabí, lugar  conocido por la gran variedad de dulces que se preparan en este lugar y que son reconocidos  a nivel nacional por su delicioso sabor.
Este es un grupo de 14 socias y 1 socio que decidieron unirse hace tiempo atrás  y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han mejorado  sus pequeños negocios y su vida en general. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio, servicios, entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Carolina, tiene 28 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 7 y 1 años, el mayor estudian en escuela. El marido es operador de una máquina retroexcavadora.

Ella en sociedad con su mamá tienen un restaurante en la localidad, trabajan todos los días desde las 5h00 y hasta las 19h00,  preparan desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas, nos cuenta que hasta su local día a día llegan muchos clientes a servirse sus deliciosos platos, nos dice que el plato que más le piden sus clientes es el viche de camarón y pescado que es un plato típico de nuestra provincia y muy apetecido, llevan en este negocio por más de 5 años y les va muy bien ya que tienen muchos clientes que las prefieren por su sazón.
 
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta la rapidez para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Unión Trabajo y Desarrollo" meets every two weeks in the city of Rocafuerte which belongs to the province of Manabí.  This place is known for its wide variety of sweets that are famous nationally for their delicious flavor.  The group is comprised of 14 women and one man who decided to get together to set up the communal bank.  It has been of great help to them since their loans have improved their small businesses and lives in general.  They are involved in different business activities such as agriculture, commerce, services and other activities.

One of the members of the group is Mrs. Carolina, 28, who has a common-law husband and two children, ages 7 and 1.  The eldest is in school.  Her husband is a retro-excavating machine operator.

Together with her mother she runs a restaurant in the city and works every day from 5:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  She serves breakfast, lunch and afternoon snacks.  She says she has many customers wanting to taste her delicious dishes every day, the most popular of which is her shrimp and fish viche which is the typical dish of the province and very appetizing.  She has been in business for over five years and it is going very well because of the many customers who prefer her cuisine.

This loan will be used to buy food ingredients.  She has been in the communal bank since its inception and is the president.  She likes how quick it is to obtain a loan.

Her goals are to continue getting ahead in her business and to give her children the best she can.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en: Duncan is a married man. He describes himself as being optimistic. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. He hopes that in the future he will own a big business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Silberio

texts.es:
Silberio con 48 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y sus cuatro menores hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 7 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Silberio es socio reactivado para Edpyme Alternativa. Firma con cónyuge.
texts.en:
Silberio is 48 years old and lives in a rustic style house with his wife and four young children in the Cajamarca region of Peru. He has great references, both of a personal and professional nature, from other residents who live in the area. Most of the locals from this region make a living from agricultural work, running a shop, or from the cattle industry.

Silberio makes a living from agricultural work, in particular coffee cultivation, and has around 7 years experience in this field. The loan that he will be given will be used for agricultural tasks, the application and incorporation of plant sanitation products, fertilisers, and also labour during the harvest season. In this way the loan will help him to improve physiological, morphological and productive aspects of his cultivation, as well as having a well timed harvest and therefore have a better output. This will also help ensure a better quality product so that he will not have any problems in selling his product.

Silberio is a revived member of Edpyme Alternativa. He will sign with his wife.

loans.use: to be used to agricultural jobs, application and incorporation of plant sanitation products, fertilisers, and labour during the harvest season.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo for many years was working at a meat store, but he had to quit from this activity for health reasons. He always had to stay in very cold rooms and he was sick almost once a month. While he recovered, he was thinking about how he could provide for his family and a friend invited him to a fishing practice. He did not have any resources to practice this sport, so he started to manufacture his own nets. First he learned to fish and when he saw that his work was excellent and much stronger, his friends began to become interested and they wanted to buy from him. Through this, he found that he could do it as a business. At this moment he has 8 years of experience in this business and he sells his products to both friends, and also any sports stores that are interested in buying from him. Marcelo is requesting a loan of US$ 275 because the shrimp season is coming up and he needs to be prepared with enough merchandise.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Marcelo mucho tiempo trabajo en el área de carnicería, tuvo que retirarse de esta actividad pues su salud se vio afectada por el contacto directo de los cuartos fríos, se enfermaba constantemente. Mientras se recuperaba y pensaba como poder sacar adelante a su familia, un amigo lo invito a practicar la pesca deportiva. Escaso de recursos para poder practicar comenzó a elaborar sus propias redes, primero para poder pescar. Al ver lo bien hechas y resistentes que le quedaban, sus amigos comenzaron a encargarle redes, fue así como decidió que ese podría ser su negocio. Cuenta ya con 8 años de experiencia en este ramo y además de venderlo a particulares también ofrece su mercancía en las tiendas de deportes. A la fecha el Sr. Marcelo necesita invertir en cordel y avios para fabricar las redes por lo que esta solicitando un crédito por la cantidad de US$275 a 4 meses, pues se avecina la temporada de pesca de camarón y necesita estas preparado con mercancía suficiente.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Balashirin

texts.en: Balashirin is originally from Lerik region of Azerbaijan. He now lives in Sumgayit city and has been working for the past eight years as a taxi driver. He is married, but has no children. Balashirin is asking for a loan to repair his taxi.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Thy P. and her husband live with their child and two nephews in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Both P., who is 26 years old, and her husband work as blacksmiths and can make about $10 on an average day.  She hopes to use this loan to purchase iron tools for her business.  In the future, the couple hopes to expand their business and hire another worker.  They also would like to eventually build a new house and send their child to university.

loans.use: To purchase tools for her job as a blacksmith

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: "I am delighted to be working in sales of foodstuffs and clothes," says Mrs. Kate O.. A competent business woman, Kate is optimistic that her turnover will improve if she receives a loan of US$ 750 which will allow her to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To add to the inventory of her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her movie business.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana R. is a woman who likes to advocate for her children’s welfare. Her children needed school supplies, so she decided to open a small business, even though it didn’t seem likely that her business would prosper since the area in which it is located is not very good. Mariana succeeded in arranging a room in her house for the sale of grocery items. Little by little, with the help of Mariana’s husband, the business has been growing.

Today Mariana is asking for a loan of $550 in order to buy a cooler and thus be able to sell more merchandise that requires refrigeration. This will give her grocery store greater variety. Mariana is prepared to repay the loan in 6 months. With your help, Mariana will be able to sell more products that require refrigeration.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariana R., es una mujer que le gusta luchar por sus dos hijos que necesitaban de utensilios para la escuela, por lo tanto decidió poner un pequeño establecimiento, a pesar de que las esperanzas de que su negocio prosperara, puesto que en la zona donde se ubica no es muy buena, y logró arreglar un cuarto de su casa con un poco de mercancía de abarrotes hace siete años, que poco a poco y con la ayuda de su esposo ha ido creciendo.

Hoy está solicitando un crédito de US $550 para poder comprar un enfriador y así poder vender más mercancía de la que necesite conservarse en un lugar fresco, para tener más surtido en tu abarrotería. Mariana R. está dispuesta a pagar en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Mariana podrá vender más productos que necesiten refrigerador.

loans.use: To purchase a cooler in order to supply more refrigerated products.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.es:
Tourists who come to Ayda's community always leave with happy memories and many also buy handicrafts as souvenirs to share with people back home as a reminder of their visit to the Peruvian jungle. Ayda has been making handicrafts since she was a small girl and her traditionally-themed crafts are very popular. Some of the materials she uses have to be brought in from Lima and at times this presents a bottleneck. Ayda is asking for a loan to buy materials in greater bulk so that she can meet the demand for her goods. She hopes to invest the income in improving her small home so she can live in comfort and happiness.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Todos los turistas que llegan a la comunidad de doña Ayda siempre se llevan gratos recuerdos al poder compartir múltiples experiencias entre ellos, pero además de esto, las artesanías de Ayda son una excelente muestra del arte de la selva peruana que compran en gran cantidad para regalarlos en su país natal como muestra de su presencia en esta parte del mundo. Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde muy pequeña y ahora ha sabido plasmar muy bien las tradiciones y costumbres de su tierra en sus trabajos, que son muy reconocidos y admirados por las personas que visitan su comunidad. Algunos de los materiales que ella necesita para un buen desarrollo de esta actividad tienen que ser traídas desde Lima, por lo que a veces no puede producir la cantidad suficiente de productos que le demandan. Es por ello que solicita de nuestra ayuda para que así pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materiales de dicha ciudad. Al lograr esto lo beneficios económicos serán invertidos en el mejoramiento de su casita, en el que compartirá momentos llenos de alegría con mayor comodidad.

loans.use: To buy craft materials.

loans.name: Eider

texts.es:
A long time ago Eider started a business selling scrap iron, and his daily routine of collecting, buying, and selling this material makes him keep in mind each of his goals. He is 52 years old, father of three loving children, and together with his beloved wife, Anita, their main purpose is to offer education and well-being to their children. Don Eider has always wanted to add two extra rooms for rent to his small home, but he needs capital to invest in construction material and purchase of more scrap iron in order to become an important wholesaler to factories that recycle this kind of waste. Let us support this father, who is working arduously with effort and dedication, to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Eider, se constituyó en el negocio de la venta de chatarra desde hace mucho tiempo, su rutina diaria de acopio, compra y venta de estos materiales de desecho, hacen que él siga concibiendo en su memoria cada uno de sus propósitos. Tiene 52 años de edad es padre de tres hijos súper cariñosos, en compañía de su amada esposa, Anita, tiene la finalidad de educar y otorgarles bienestar.Desde siempre el señor Eider ha deseado construir dos cuartos adicionales en su pequeña vivienda para darlas en alquiler, sin embargo para la realización del mismo, necesita de un capital de dinero, para invertirlos en materiales de construcción, y también para la compra de mayor cantidad de chatarra a fin de convertirse con el tiempo en un importante exportador de estos desechos útiles al sin número de empresas que elaboran materiales en base a estos materiales.Apoyemos a este padre que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente por prosperar.

loans.use: Purchase of construction material and increase of capital to make a small business grow.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia, a thirty-five year old single mother, sells men’s and women’s clothing in the Hortaliza community of Yamasá.  Cecilia says that she is very careful in selecting the clothes for her inventory; she adds the items of clothing to her stock in accordance with customer demand and according to the season.  Cecilia will use her loan to buy suitable garments to refill her stock. The entrepreneur has three school-age children and her small business supports the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio and Eulalia are married with four older children. Three of them are independent and one still lives at home. Together the two have a farm which they work on, and they sell the food that they cultivate. With the money they made from selling their simple fruits and vegetables, the pair was able to invest in a truck in which to transport their goods door-to-door.

Now the couple is looking to expand their business even more and have a larger variety of fruits and vegetables than what they grow and sell. The loan they are asking for will be used for that purpose, to help them increase their sales and thus their income.

loans.use: To buy various fruits and vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Tchéfiou Akiloyé

texts.fr:
Mr. Tchéfiou Akiloyé O. was born on November 26, 1978 in Lomé. He is married and the father of two children. He has been selling cloth and dressmaking supplies, electrical products, and daily necessities since 2001 in Adidogomé in Lomé. This first loan in the amount of US$ 500 which he is presently requesting will permit him to purchase sewing supplies, among others, 25 bags of buttons, 12 rolls of hooks and eyes, and thirty meters of lining material. Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteerMonsieur O. Tchéfiou Akiloyé est née le 26 novembre 1978 à Lomé. Il est marié et père de deux enfants. Il est revendeur des produits de mercerie, d’électricité et des produits de première nécessité depuis 2001 à Adidogomé à Lomé. 
Le premier crédit d’un montant de 200.000 FCFA qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des articles pour la mercerie notamment  vingt cinq sachets de boutons, douze rouleaux de grippures et trente mètres de doublures.

loans.use: Expand his stock of sewing suppliesAugmenter son stock de mercerie

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Mrs. Maritza Rodríguez T. belongs to the Communal Bank “Ayaymaman”. She lives in the San Martín region and province of Moyobamba, in the Moyabamba district. Maritza sells candy made out of peanuts and sugarcane that she makes herself. She started the candy business in her house, and sells the candies in the main streets and markets of Moyabamba. Maritza has wanted to work this business since she was a child, because her whole family makes and sells sweets. Because of this, it was an easy business for her to start.

With a loan of 1,700.00 soles, she’ll buy the supplies necessary to make the peanut candies, marzipan, and chocolates. These include 50 kilo bags of peanuts and plastic bags to wrap the sweets in. Maritza will repay the loan in six months.

Maritza is 38 years old, and has two older children and two young children. Her husband supports her candy business and she’s very well known. She has a good clientele because her products are high quality and she’s always friendly.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Marizta R. T. pertenece al Banco Comunal. “Ayaymaman”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Moyobamba y distrito de Moyabamba, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de dulces confitados a base de maní y chancaca (azúcar natural de de caña) negocio que lo desarrolla en su propia casa, para luego venderlos por las principales calles y paraderos de carros de la ciudad de Moyabamba. Desde muy pequeña estuvo ligada a este tipo de negocio ya que toda su familia se dicha a la elaboración y venta de estos dulces, por lo que a ella no le fue difícil desarrollar este trabajo. Con el crédito de S/. 1700.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses comprará los insumos necesarios para la preparación de confinados de maní, alfeñiques y turrones como: chancaca en atados, maní en quintales (bolsas de 50 kilos) y bolsas plásticas para el embasado de estos productos. Tiene 38 años, 2 hijos mayores y 2 dos pequeños, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, es muy conocida y tiene una buena clientela por la calidad de sus productos y la amabilidad que brinda al vender.

loans.use: With a loan she'll buy more inputs to make her products

loans.name: Levida

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Levida B.. She is single and has no children. In 2008, Levida established a business selling crops in bulk. She is applying for a loan to buy additional stocks of maize, and thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of maize in bulk.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Mrs. Salimata T., 26, is married and the mother of 4 children (1 son and 3 daughters). She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her co-spouse, and their children in Hamdallaye neighborhood in Koutiala Prefecture.

Salimata is a trained nurse with 4 years of experience. Obliged for societal reasons to abandon this work, she began dyeing and selling damask three years ago. She learned this business from her mother at a young age and presently works out of her own home. Mrs. Salimata T. received a share of 8 group loans through Soro Yiriwaso, all of which were reimbursed correctly. She does her buying in Koutiala and she is intending to buy 1 bale of bazin (damask cloth), 20 kg of dye, and 1 barrel of potash. She sells what she makes in the towns of Koutiala and Niono to a clientele made up of women and men, on credit or on a cash basis. She expects to make a profit of US$ 180 per month which she intends to use to make the payments on the loan and to participate in family living expenses.

Mrs. Salimata T. hopes to open a shop selling hand-dyed basin in Koutiala.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame Salimata T. a 26 ans, est mariée, mère de 4 enfants (1 garçon et 3 filles), vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari sa coepouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier hamdallaye de la prefecture de koutiala.

Salimata est infirmière de profession avec une expérience de 4 ans. Obliger d’abandonner cette activité professionnelle pour des raisons sociales, elle entama l’activité de teintutre et vente de bazin dépuis trois ans. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de sa maman dépuis son jeune age et l’exerce actuellement dans son domicile. Madame Salimata T. a obtenu 8 prêts solidaires (prets de groupe) auprès de Soro Yiriwaso tous remboursés correctement. Elle s’approvisionne à Koutiala et compte acheter 1 balle de bazin, 20 kg de teinture et 1 barrique de potasse. Elle vend sa production dans la ville de koutiala et celle de Niono à une clientèle de femmes et hommes à crédit ou au comptant. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 75.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage d’utiliser pour rembourser les intérets du prêt et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

Madame Salimata T. compte ouvrir une boutique de vente de bazin teinté à Koutiala

loans.use:
Purchase of bales of damask (very popular cloth in West Africa)

Achat de balles de bazin (Tissus très prisé en afrique de l’ouest).

loans.name: Marciana

texts.es:
Marciana, 42, has a fifth-grade education. She has 6 children, with five of them still at home. Their home is in the Porteno neighborhood in the Zepita district, Chucuito Province.

Marciana has been raising sheep to sell for the last seven years. She belongs to the Zepita District Communal Bank "Primero de Agosto". As member of the communal bank, she was able to increase her capital by borrowing 300 soles to purchase 5 sheep to raise. Her income improved and this motivated her to take advantage of increasing loans from the communal bank.

Marciana is now requesting 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of 4 blackface sheep. With these sheep she will spend less in fodder and she will make a higher profit. She will pay back the loan in 4 installments.

Marciana is happy because her income is increasing and she is saving money for her children's support and education.

Her dream is to open a small grocery store across from the Andrés Avelino Cáceres school in Zepita, and that her children have a college education.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

La señora Marciana tiene 42 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, es casada, madre de seis hijos, cinco dependen de ella, su domicilio queda en el barrio Porteño, del distrito de Zepita, Provincia de Chucuito – Juli y Región de Puno. La actividad que realiza es engorde de ovejas para la venta, que viene desarrollando hace siete años. Ella es parte de Banco Comunal Primero de Agosto del distrito de Zepita, con el fin de incrementar más su capital y su crédito inicial que recibió es de S/. 300.00, este dinero invirtió en la compara de 5 ovinos para el engorde y cuando obtuvo un poco más de ingreso económico, la cual siguió motivando para seguir escalando con los créditos del banquito. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará 4 ovejas cara negras, ya que con ello tiene mayor ganancia y además para el engorde gastará menos forraje. Este su crédito serà cancelado en 4 cuotas. Marciana, esta contenta, por que está incrementando su capital y esta asegurando dinero para los gastos de estudios de sus hijos y alimentación. Su sueño mayor es poner una tienda de abarrotes al frente del colegio de Andrés Avelino Cáceres de Zepita y algún día sean profesionales sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of sheep

loans.name: Tatu's Tuvumiliane Group

texts.en:
Tatu, married with five children between the ages of 11 and 28, has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2003. She works daily from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Tatu now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her three subgroup members, who have businesses in fish, snack, and clothing sales respectively.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Lutfiya

texts.en:
Lutfiya A. is 47 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Lutfiya started her business in order to help her husband with the household expenses, especially because her mother-in-law lives with them and is an elderly woman who requires special care and medications. Lutfiya also wants to provide a good education for her son.

She got started in May 2002 after a neighbor told her that the sale of women's clothing was a good business. Lutfiya sells her goods in the central local market. She shows very good taste in choosing the clothing she buys and amazing marketing skills in convincing her clients which clothing they should buy.

Today she is requesting a loan for 2000 Somoni ($600), which she will repay in six months. She will use it to purchase more seasonal clothes because she has a lot of clients during this time. Lutfiya is thankful for your generosity and help.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to increasing her range of goods.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Mrs. Suong S. is a villager in Kampong Chrey Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who now faces a small problem, because her field is infertile. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Suong S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Hin Pros, is a motorbike taxi driver who can make a small income to support his family. Mrs. Suong S. is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study at the age of four years. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hoà năm nay 61 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành. Tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1994 đến nay qua 15 năm sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả kinh tế gia đình chị Hoà đã có sự thay đổi rõ rệt. Hiện tại với mức thu nhập từ chăn nuôi 3.000.000đ/ tháng và sự hỗ trợ của các con đã đi làm kinh tế gia đình chị Hoà đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong  muốn 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm bò, lợn, gà về chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms, N. Thi Hoa is 61 years old; her family has 3 grown children. She joined TYM fund in 1994 and for the past 15 years, she has seen visible improvement in her family's income from utilizing the loan program. Presently, with income of 180 USD per month from raising farm animals and assistance from her children who are employed, her family's income is getting more and more stable every day. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 900 USD to purchase additional cows, pigs and chickens to raise

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising farm animals

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a 48-year-old married man with four children. Living in Baalback, Khalil has been trading used cars since 2000 in Zahleh area. Working on a very small scale, Khalil can only afford to trade one car at a time. He recently purchased a car with good selling potential; however, it needs maintenance. He is therefore requesting a loan of $1000 to buy the spare parts he needs to repair the vehicle.

loans.use: Buy spare parts to repair a car for resale

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne K. lives in the Rongo District of Kenya. She is 34 years old, married to a police officer, and has 3 children. 

Evelyne wants to start her own business – a grocery and cereals stall in her community. As she lives near the border to Tanzania, Evelyne will buy the supplies for her stall from Tanzania and from the Kenyan town of Migori. 

In order to start her business, Evelyne has applied for a loan of $150. With the loan money, she will purchase the initial inventory of groceries and cereals for the new stall.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and cereals

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
FELICITA RODRIGUEZ S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sol Naciente” ubicado en el Jr. Augusto B. Leguia N° 1098 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 59 años de edad, 06 hijos, su esposo es carpintero.

El primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró harina por sacos e implementó su panadería, poco a poco creció la venta, los clientes no dejaban de llegar, sus panes hasta el día domingo, trabaja mucho.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00 construyó un techito, compró madera, calaminas, clavos, pues ahora vende comidas, en el patio de su casa, los domingos vende pollos a la parrilla.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el gran apoyo que le brinda
texts.en:
Felicita Rodriguez S. belongs to the Rising Sun Community Bank, located in Jr. Augusto B. Leguia N° 1098 in the district of Callería. She is 59 years old, has 6 children, and her husband is a carpenter. Her first loan was for 300 soles. She bought sacks of flour, stocked her bakery, and little by little grew her sales. She always has clients for her bread until Sunday. She works very hard. With this loan of 2000 soles, she will build a roof and buy wood, corrugated iron, and nails, since she sells food on the patio of her house. On Sundays, she sells grilled chicken. She is thankful for Manuela Ramos for the great support they offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, corrugated iron, and nails to fix her roof, since she sells food on her patio

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom K. lives in Doem Roes village in Kandal province. She is a pig breeder. However, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to build a piggery for her breeding. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers and cement to build the piggery. Mrs. Mom K. is 52 years old and a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the other is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy timbers and cement to build a piggery

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.en:
Dilovar has sixteen years of experience in producing wheat, watermelon and onions in his community, which has a favorable climate and where the cultivation of these crops is an established tradition. He works the fields with the support of his wife, who is also dedicated to the production. This couple has been perfecting and modernizing their production processes. The maintenance of the land has a high cost, due to the attention that must be given to the plants in each phase of the process, such as manually weeding and using organic fertilizer and natural supplements for the control of diseases. These give better yields to their crops, since they prevent the soil from deteriorating so much, provide better conditions for cultivation at planting time and improve the quality of the crop, increasing its value. Organic products currently obtain better prices in the market. Dilovar requests a loan for the purchase of supplies for his crops, such as seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. He will use part of the loan to pay wages to the hired workers. The loan will greatly improve Dilovar’s income and his family's living conditions.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 49 years old and manages a sari-sari store (a community based store) in their village. She sells different commodities and vegetables in front of her store. Her business is already ten years old and it has been their alternative source of income when they run out of budget from the income of her husband who works as a seaman.  Her business has been a great help in sending her children to school. To maintain her business, Sonia would like to request a loan of PHP5,000 for the development of her business. She really hopes that her loan request will be granted so she can support her family and the educational needs of her children.  

She is married to Dante and they have two children who are: Patrick Lenard - 17 years old, 3rd year high school; and Sarah Mae - 16 years old, college freshman.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Savza

texts.ru: Савза и ее муж (на фото) продают детскую одежду на центральном рынке города Исфары. Для этого арендуют маленький магазин размерами 3 на 4,5 метра. Савза и ее муж не имеют постоянной работы и занятие предпринимательством основной источник дохода. За товаром ездят по очереди раз в неделю, при этом один из них остается троговать. Савзе 49 лет, имеет 3 детей. Она  сотрудничает с МикроИнвест уже 2 года и собирается и дальше получать займы для расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Savza and her husband (on the photo) sell children's clothing on the central market of the town of Isfara. They rent out a small store of a size of three by four and a half meters. Savza and her husband do not have permanent jobs and their business is the only source of income. One of them travels to bring the merchandise once a week, while the other stays to do the sales. Savza is 49 years old, she has three children. She has been collaborating with MicroInvest for two years now and plans to take out loans again to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Delgermoron

texts.en:
Delgermoron N. is a 33-year-old single mother living with her only son in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son is a seventh grade student at a local high school. She has a small retail business selling shoes, especially slippers and flip flops. She rents a stall in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar.

Delgermoron frequently travels to Ereen, a Chinese border town, where many products are imported from, and buys inventory for her stall in the Narantuul market. When she runs out of a specific size of slippers or flip flops, she can buy them from a wholesale market in Ulaanbaatar. With her profit, she was able to buy her own ger, a traditional felt tent that many Mongolians still use. Next, she would like to set aside some money for her son's education. She hopes to ensure that her only son receives a good education and pursues his dreams.

She requests a loan to purchase more slippers and flip flops for her business.

loans.use: to purchase slippers and flip flops for her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn J. owns and operates a business making and selling charcoal. She is 50 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. She is from the town of Santa Maria, Tangub city. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase coconut shells for manufacturing charcoal. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for family needs and for the support of her children's education.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase coconut shells to manufacture charcoal

loans.name: Sharf-Un-Nisa Muhammad Naseem Group

texts.en:
Sharf-un-nisa baji is the leader of this group of women. She is married to M. N. who runs a bookshop. M. N. has a variety of books in his shop, although he specializes in “religious and syllabus books”. Sharf baji operates a business sewing clothes. She works to save money to buy an electric sewing machine. She is applying for a loan to buy books for her husband’s bookshop.

Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Rukhsana shaheen baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (cooking oil, spices and lentils) for her food-selling business.

Kosar K. baji and Khalida parveen baji want a loan to buy sewing machines for their tailoring center.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy books for bookshop

loans.name: Jcille Gia

texts.en:
Jcille Gia E. is from the village of Purok 4A, Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. She is 24 years old. Jcille Gia is single and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Jcille Gia owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food like banana cue. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling and making snacks like banana cue and mango in the local community. Jcille Gia has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In June 2009, Jcille Gia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jcille Gia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jcille Gia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

location.town: Purok 4A, Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Husniobod

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Husniobod began her work as an entrepreneur in the markets of Spitamen, Tajikistan. Her hope was to improve the standard of living for her family and to provide education to her two children. Over the past decade, Husniobod has successfully developed her own clothing business with the support of microfinance loans through IMON International. A committed and hardworking businesswoman, Husniobod has successfully repaid each loan. With the profits from her business, Husniobod has supported not only the education of her daughters, but also her aging parents. Currently, Husniobod is seeking a loan of 8000 Somoni to expand her inventory and increase the variety of products for sale. With the additional profits, Husniobod plans to continue expanding her business and supporting her family. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand her inventory and increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Gloria Angelica

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 101969&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Gloria  es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Gloria esta en el negocio de  venta de ropa, de segunda importada, tiene un puesto alquilado con su hermano. 
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles,  de dos  sacos de ropa de invierno.
El préstamo  es de gran ayuda  por que puede tener su puesto surtido.
El sueño de Gloria es tener una tienda para vender su ropa y seguir prosperando.
texts.en:
Previous loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 101969&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Gloria is a member of the cooperative bank El Triunfo. Gloria sells second-hand, imported clothing; she and her brother rent a site. She needs a loan of $350 to buy two sacks of winter clothing. The loan is a great help because she can keep her site well-stocked. Gloria's dream is to have a clothes store and continued prosperity.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: two sacks of winter clothing

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a 49-year-old father of five children. Formerly an employee, he has operated a carpentry business in Nairobi for the past four years. He has requested his first loan of 20,000 KES in order to increase his stock of timber. He hopes to own a furniture shop in Nairobi one day, buy a home for his family, and educate his children to the highest level. Alexander describes himself as jovial and determined.

About Faulu Kenya
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To increase his stock of timber

loans.name: Ukakamavu Group

texts.en:
J. Mandwi, age 55, is married with eight children.  He has a secretarial bureau,  sells VC, DVD, and video cassettes.  He started this business 2years ago and works daily from 8am until 6pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $100. 

This will be J.’s 1st loans from Tujijenge Tanzania. He hopes to increase on his business and to buy a second hand computer.
	
J. will share this loan with his loan group, Ukakamavu, which totals 21 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, J. is 1st on the left front row in white.

loans.use: To buy a second hand and increase on his business

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad S. is 65 years old but still tilling her rice field for income. Currently  she manages a 1 -hectare farm where she gets money for food, clothing and other basic needs. She would like to grow her business more and by purchasing the farming neccesities, she knows that she will somehow improve the usual size of her harvest. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 11,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She is hoping that by her loan in CEVI she will be able to buy the farming neccesities that will help support the growth of her rice plant.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Sakoaka

texts.fr: Cet homme est marié et a un enfant à sa charge. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il s’est lancé l’année dernière dans la vente de chaussures. Il exerce cette activité devant sa maison dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Il s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé ou dans le marché de Hédzranawoé. Parallèlement à cette nouvelle activité, il a acheté un appareil servant de cabine cellulaire à côté la vente de chaussures. Ces deux activités lui permettent de gagner sa vie et de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. Il sollicite en ce moment un crédit de WAGES pour renouveler son stock épuisé, pour acheter des cartons de chaussures de différents modèles et des cartes de recharge cellulaires Togocel et Moov.

loans.use: Achat de cartons de chaussures et de cartes de recharge cellulaires

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 27 years old and married. He sells phones, phone accessories, laptops, and rechargeable phone cards. He has been in this business for three years. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more items to sell. He thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Sonia Hermelinda

texts.es: La señora Sonia Hermelinda R. es soltera y solamente vive con un hijo pequeño, ya que sus demás hijos ya están casados y viven fuera de la ciudad, ella tiene un negocio establecido desde hace 2 años de venta de tacos, gorditas etc;en la salida de nuestra ciudad.Ella esta solicitando este crédito para la inversión en la compra de mas mercancía para la elaboración y venta de comida en su negocio.
texts.en:
Hermelinda Sonia R. is single and lives with one of her sons since the other ones are married and living outside the city. She started a business 2 years ago, selling meals as tacos, gorditas, etc., in the entrance to the city.

She is asking for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of ingredients to prepare meals for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La Sra. Celia tiene 40 años de edad, se casó a los 25 años de edad, es madre de 04 hijos menores de edad, el mayor tiene 13 años y el menor 02 años de edad, estudió hasta 2do. de secundaria, vive en el Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno.

Hace 01 año integra el Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazaret”, con su primer crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles compró productos de la región (papa, haba, chuño), negocio al que se dedicó por 01 año, actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno conjuntamente con su esposo.

Con este crédito de 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará 01 ganado vacuno.

Su sueño es comprar más ganado vacuno mejorado, para obtener más ganancias y poder ayudar a sus hijos para que ellos estudien y sean profesionales.

Doña Celia nos indica le gusta participar en las reuniones del Banco Comunal, porque no necesita hacer mucho trámite para obtener crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Celia is 40 years old and got married when she was 25. She is the mother of four dependent children, ranging in age from 2 to 13. Celia completed her education through the second year of high school. She lives in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno.

Celia joined the Jesus of Nazareth Communal Bank one year ago. Her first loan of 500 soles was used to buy regional products such as potatoes, broad beans, and chuño. She has been in business for one year. Celia currently buys and sells cattle with her husband.

She is requesting a new loan of 1500 soles to buy one head of cattle. Her dream is to buy more well-bred cattle so that she can obtain better earnings. This will enable her to support her children’s studies in hopes that they will become professionals.

Doña Celia says she enjoys participating in her Communal Bank meetings because they are required in order to obtain future loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 1 head of cattle

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 39-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Ahmad has owned a bakery for six years, selling “mankoucheh”. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Ahmad also sells Lebanese sweets. Ahmad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials for his bakery. He decided on doing his work because of his experience. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Ahmad has been a micro credit client for five years now and has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his work. Ahmad is special in his work because he is known for his tasty mankoucheh and sweets. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his business to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his bakery.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La Sra. gloria tiene como actividad la comercializacion de ajies, ella  viaja al Desaguadero para traer mercaderia, esta actividad la realiza con su Mamá, quien a la ves trae mercaderia de temporada.
Cuenta tambien en su casa con una pequeña tienda de barrio, en la cual vende distintos produtos de la canasta familiar,  ella vive en casa de su mamá la Sra Antonia a quien le ayuda en el mantenimiento de su hogar que esta compuesta por ella y sus tres hijas que son pequeñas, encontrandose actualmente separda de su esposo.
texts.en:
Senora Gloria earns a living selling chili peppers. She travels to Desaguadero to bring her merchandise, and this activity was begun by her mother, who at the time brought seasonal produce. She also has a small store in her neighborhood in which she sells different products for weekly shopping needs. She liveds en a house with her mother, Senora Antonia, who she helps by keeping house/ She shares the house also with her three little daughters, which she had to do when she separated from her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Misty McNally, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de Capital de Trabajo

loans.name: G.s. El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario El Esfuerzo lo conforman Ninosca Mercedes y Andrea Maritza esta no es la primera vez que solicitan financiamiento, ya que han logrado mantener su record crediticio para mejorar con sus negocios. Estas Señoras son muy trabajadoras, por lo que cada día se interesan en mejorar en sus negocio, tienen diferentes actividades económicas pero a pesar de esto ambas se unen para mantener a sus familias y además para seguir manteniendo activos sus negocios que son la base más importante para sus negocios ya que tienen a sus clientes y no quieren perderlos por no ofrecerles lo que le solicitan. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima que es necesaria para cada uno de sus productos. Los deseos de ellas es mantener sus negocio y mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The solidarity group El Esfuerzo (The Effort) is made up of Ninosca Mercedes and Andrea Martiza. This is not the first time they are requesting financing, since they have succeeded in maintaining their credit record in order to improve their businesses. These women are very hard-working and therefore every day they are interested in improving their business. They have different businesses, but in spite of this, they both stick together in order to maintain their families, as well as to continue maintaining the assets of their businesses, which are the most important base for their businesses, since they have customers and they don't want to lose them by not offering what their customers are requesting. The loan is for the purchase of the raw materials that are necessary for each of their products. Their wish is to maintain their business and improve every day.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Chhay's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members who are located in Chrouy Poun village in Takeo province. They each will use the loan for a different purpose. Mr. Chhay B. is the group leader who has selected by the members.

Mr. Chhay B. is 29 years old. He and his wife, Mrs. Saroeun Choy, are farmers who own 1.3-hectarE. (3.25-acrE.) of land they use to cultivate rice to support their family living.

In their rice field, they have some problems because it is far from the irrigation system but they do not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mr. Chhay B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fuel for the water pump. The rest of the loan he will use to buy rice to support their family living in this period until he obtains his rice crop.

This couple has three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local public school while the other is too young to go to school or work.

loans.use: To buy fuel for the irrigation pump and rice for family consumption

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 37-year-old married father of two.  He sells sweet potatoes, potatoes, carrots and cabbage among other foodstuff in Kangemi open air market.  He has been in the business for five years and Faulu Kenya has really helped him plan his business.   He has requested Kes. 20,000 to buy potatoes, carrots, tomatoes and cabbage. He hopes to have a big business and have a wholesale stall for his products in the future.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Rosana's Group

texts.en: Rosana M. is from the city of Sta. Rosa, Santiago. She is 42 years old and is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosana M.'s group. Rosana is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosana is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena T. is from the village of Dicayo. She is 57 years old and married with 3 adult-aged children. To make a living Lucena bakes and sells a variety of staple products including bread in the local community. Lucena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lucena joined PMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucena successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC which she used to purchase cooking ingredients.

Lucena is requesting her third loan from PMPC, for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase baking equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baking equipment.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda A. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 45 years old and single. Hilda owns and operates a business selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Hilda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Hilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Hilda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Hilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Kamathor Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Kamathor” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. These women are small-scale local entrepreneurs who want to develop their businesses, but lack sufficient capital. Therefore, they formed a group to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they can attract more customers, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions.

Their leader, Magret C., is pictured in the middle, receiving the loan from loan officer Zainab Bangura. The 45-year-old was born in Makeni, is married to an architect, and they have six children, one of whom still attends primary school. For twenty years, Magret has been selling rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and firewood. With her share of the loan, she will buy bags of rice, gallons of palm-oil, and piles of firewood to add to her current ones.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice, gallons of palm-oil, and piles of firewood

loans.name: Yesu Amala Group, Kampala

texts.en:
She is a graceful 38-year-old woman with four children, but being divorced led her into a reality check. N. Topy had to quickly come to terms with the fact that she had to take care of her four children and two orphans without the assistance of a man.

Thirteen years ago Topy began with a charcoal-selling business in Kamwokya. She knew the only way she could quickly establish herself a niche in such a fledgling competitive business was through good interactions with her clients and to increase her charcoal stock.

After she built on her knowledge of the business, Topy quickly started getting a reputation for herself. Her clientele grew as a result of her hard work and up to now her business is still gaining ground.

Many factors have played into Topy’s favor, outstanding of which is her affable customer care skills. In a month, Topy says she makes profits to the tune of 300,000 shillings and she is anticipating even more once she gets this loan.

Topy’s future plans are based around the expansion of her business through buying more bags of charcoal and also trying her hand at selling fish.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal and fish to sell

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: La Sra. Felicita  tiene 53 años  D. edad es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos ya mayores D. edad.Su conyugue se dedica como operario D. construccion. La Sra. Felicita se dedica a la venta D. chanfainitas como ambulante en la calle  Grau D. la Ciudad D. Ica, ella se dedica a este negocio hace 11 años. Cuenta con casa propia D. material noble D. un piso ubicado en el AA.HH las flores. Su unico objetivo  D. la Sra. Felicita es poder terminar D. construir su casa, con el dinero que solicita invertira en continuar contruyendo su casa.
texts.en:
Felicita is 53 years old, and she is in a common law marriage. She has two grown children. Her life partner is a construction worker. Felicita sells “chanfainitas” (beef lung stew) as a street vendor on Grau Street in the city of Ica. She has been working in this business for 11 years. She has her own one story house, which is maD. of sturdy material. It is in the AA.HH Las Flores. Her only objective is to be able to finish building her house. She will use the money from the loan to continue building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Jair Amado

texts.es:
En un barrio de Cartagena de Indias, ciudad Caribe de Colombia,  Jair Amado González Mebarack, un joven propietario del negocio de comidas Rápidas Rapiclub, alegremente prepara los más deliciosas comidas rápidas, como perros calientes, hamburguesas, salchipapas y combinaciones especiales de embutidos y carnes a los que agrega  salsas y aderezos que él  mismo prepara al gusto de sus clientes.
 
Él inició este negocio hace 5 años, desde que estaba en la edad de 21, cuando incipientemente  con un horno casero y un carro de perro, ambos muy pequeños y en un garaje de casa, preparaba y vendía los mas sencillos productos; con su trabajo y disciplina vio crecer rápidamente su negocio, por eso  tuvo que trasladarse a  una tienda grande y reconocida en otro sector; pero como sus expectativas eran mayores, consiguió un horno  y un carro de perro caliente mas grande y logró estabilizarse donde se encuentra actualmente y es muy reconocido. Lo que mas destaca Jair es el gran apoyo  que ha recibido de su familia y espera que siga siendo así, pues con él  trabaja un hermano  y su meta es seguir ayudando a sus padres y conformar su propia  familia.

Este es el primer crédito con Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, será invertido en la compra de insumos y de activos fijos tales como un horno de pollo, un carro de perro con carpa y vitrina de pollo. El sueño del joven Jair es lograr el posicionamiento de su negocio en la ciudad de Cartagena y proyectarlo como uno de los establecimientos de comidas rápidas mas grandes y de mejor servicio al cliente por la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
In a neighborhood of Cartagena de Indias, Colombia’s Caribbean city, Jair Amado González Mebarack is the young owner of a fast food business called “Rapi Club”. He happily prepares the most delicious fast food such as hot dogs, hamburgers, “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes), and combination specials of sausages and meats served with sauces and seasonings he makes himself based on the taste of his customers. Jair started his business five years ago when he turned 21. He received a portable oven and a hot dog cart, both of which were small enough to store in the garage of his house. Jair prepared and sold simple products, but through hard work and discipline, his business grew rapidly. For this reason, he had to move to a large location in a recognized area. He had great expectations, so he acquired an oven and a larger hot dog cart so that he could become established and now he is well-known. What stands out most about Jair is the great support he has received from his family and he expects it will remain that way. He works with his brother and his goal is to continue supporting his parents and one day start his own family. This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest the proceeds in supplies and fixed assets such as a chicken roaster, a hot dog cart with a canopy, and a chicken warming compartment. Young Jair dreams of positioning his business in the city of Cartagena, becoming one of the largest fast food establishments, and providing better service to his customers by offering them quality products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies & equipment for his business

loans.name: Fidéle

texts.fr:
M. Fidèle est née à Gatsibo ex-province de Kibuye, le district actuel est Karongi, province de l’ouest, il a trente cinq ans, il est marié avec deux enfants, le premier a 5.5 ans et le deuxième a 3.5an. 
Concernant son activité, il a commencé par une boucherie qu’il a abandonnée pour le transport de taxi moto, avec expérience de 3 ans dans ce domaine d transport. Grâce aux épargnes faites du reste des dépenses des versements, il est devenu propriétaire de cette moto emprunté. Client d’ACB depuis juin 2008 il a déjà soldé un prêt. Il a sollicité un prêt pour le minerval de sa femme qui étudie en deuxième d’université. Dans l’avenir il pense passer l’examen pour l’obtention du permis de conduire catégorie D de taxi minibus,  puis contracter un prêt d’un montant important pour acheter un minibus qu’il conduirait lui-même , à la longue lui permettre d’abandonner les prêts et devient financièrement Independent.une fois les revenus augmentés, les conditions de vie de sa famille sont améliorés et il est qualifié parmi les riches du pays ainsi ses rêves sont réalises.
texts.en:
M. Fidèle was born in Gatsibo, the former province of Kibuye, which is now the district of Karongi, a western province. He is 35 years old, married with two children who are 5½ and 3½ years old. He began as a butcher, but later became a motorcycle taxi driver, which he has been doing for 3 years. Because he is thrifty and was able to save money, he became owner of the motorcycle which he had borrowed. He has been a client of ACB since June of 2008, and has already repaid a loan. He has requested this loan to pay the tuition of his wife, who is in her second year at university. In the future, he plans to sit for the test to obtain a Category D drivers license for a minibus taxi, then borrow enough to purchase a minibus which he would operate himself. Long term, this would enable him to increase his income and become financially independent. Theconditions of his life would be improved, and he would realize his dreams.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay tuition for his wife

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie D. C. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 36 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Virgie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Virgie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Virgie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Junard

texts.en:
Junard P. is from the town of Dalapang, Ozamiz city. He is 28 years old. Junard is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Junard owns & operates a business providing transportation services like "habal-habal" to local community members. Junard has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Junard joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Junard has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Junard is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Junard from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Isidro Hipolito

texts.es:
Isidro de 41 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, trabajando en su taller de madera, desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. 

Antes de tener su propio taller de ebanista, el trabajo en una mueblería pero como sus ingresos no eran suficientes para mantener su hogar tuvo que comenzar a trabajar en su casa, poco a poco haciendo mueblería en su casa y vendiéndola a sus vecinos, pudo ampliar su taller, ahora el es ebanista de madera. Hace sillas, mesas, conjunto de salas etc. 

Para seguir con su negocio el quiere comprar madera y pegamento. En el futuro quiere comprar una maquina condensadora y así ampliar mas la mueblería que hace.
texts.en:
Isidro, 41, lives in the Guasmo neighborhood of Guayaquil, and works in his wood workshop from 8am until 6pm every day. Before having his own cabinet-making workshop, he worked for a furniture manufacturer, but as his income was not sufficient to support his household, he had to begin working in his house. Gradually he set up a furniture-making workshop in his house, and sold his products to his neighbors. He was able to expand his workshop and now he is a cabinetmaker. He makes chairs, tables, living room sets, etc. In order to continue with his business, he wants to buy wood and adhesive. In the future he wants to buy a machine capacitor to further expand his cabinet-making workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wood and adhesive

loans.name: Clara Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora Clara Elvira M. es socia del banco comunal San Miguel, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel que  pertenece  a la parroquia del Valle, su gente se dedica  a la agricultura y cría de animales, la mayor parte de su población joven sale a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes oficios y mucho han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.

La Señora. Clara tiene 52 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad, 5 de ellos son casados y  viven independientemente, su hija casada que vive con ella  comparten gastos del hogar, sus dos hijos solteros estudian y trabajan, su esposo ha emigrado en busca de un mejor futuro para su familia, con el trabajo de toda su vida conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Clara se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos de su hogar y aprovecha para dedicarse a la cría de animales, tiene vacas que le producen leche que la vende en su comunidad, también tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende solo en los fines de semana.
 
Es socia de la banca comunal hace 10 años y los créditos le han sido de mucha ayuda para que sus hijos salgan  adelante. Su nuevo crédito lo va ha invertir en la compra de más productos para su tienda ya que su meta es crecer en este negocio.
texts.en:
