Clara Elvira M. is a member of the San Miguel communal bank. She lives in the community of San Miguel, which belongs to Valle parish. The people there work in agriculture and raise animals. Most of the young people leave for the city to work in different trades, and many have emigrated in search of better jobs. Clara is 52 years old. She is married and has seven adult children. Five of them are married and live independently. One married daughter lives with her and shares household expenses. Her two single children study and work. Her husband has emigrated in search of a better future for their family. With the work of their entire married life they have managed to build their own house. Doña Clara takes care of household chores and works raising animals. She has cows that produce milk which she sells in the community. She also has a small store in which she makes sales only on weekends. She has been a member of the communal bank for 10 years, and the loans have been a great help to her so her children can get ahead in life. She will invest her new loan in purchasing more products for her store because her goal is to make this business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, eggs and general provisions

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda L. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Luzminda is single and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Luzminda runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Luzminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Luzminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Arab Development Group-Jinja

texts.en:
33-year-old K. Annet, who belongs to the Arab Development Group, has been operating her pub business for the last three years in Namizi village in Central Jinja.  She began her business with only two crates of beer. 

Before that she was involved in timber sales. Over time her business has expanded, though rather minimally, as evidenced by the close to $9 she makes in a week. Modest profits, indeed, though she has been supplementing her income with sales profits from selling crops such as maize and cassava.

Annet is married and is a mother to four cheerful kids. With this loan she wants buy more alcoholic beverages for her pub.

loans.use: The purchase of more alcoholic beverages for resale

loans.name: Ana Lucía

texts.es:
La Señora Ana P. es socia del banco comunal Damas del Futuro vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza arquitectónica, sus bellos paisajes y su naturaleza, es tercera ciudad  más importante económicamente del país.
 
La Señora. Ana se encuentra en su octavo ciclo en la banca comunal, ha llegado a conformar grandes lasos de amistad con todas las compañeras de la banca.
 
Nuestra socia es comerciante de ropa desde hace mucho tiempo, labora de domingo a domingo excepto los días miércoles que es cuando va a comprar  más mercadería para la venta, no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo y labora recorriendo por las zonas rurales de la ciudad de Cuenca.
 
Doña Ana tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad que trabaja y ayuda  en los gastos del hogar, su esposo es comerciante se dedica a  la venta de ropa, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su hermano.
 
Con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para surtir más su mercadería.
 
Su meta es  llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana P. is a member of the Damas del Futuro Communal Bank, she lives in Cuenca city, this city is known for its architectural beauty, its beautiful landscapes and flora and fauna, and it is the third most important financial center of the country.

This is Mrs. Ana’s eight loan with the communal bank and she has formed great friendships with other members of the communal bank.

Our member is a merchant, she has sold clothing for some time, she works Sunday to Sunday except Wednesdays when she goes to buy more merchandize, she doesn’t have a work schedule and works traveling through rural areas of the city of Cuenca.

Mrs. Ana is 35 years old, is married and has an 18 year old son that works and helps her with the household expenses, her husband sells clothing. They don’t own a home which is why they live in Ana’s brother’s home.

With the new loan, Ana will buy more items to stock her store.

Ana’s goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Jusilyn

texts.en:
Jusilyn S. is from the town of Veruela. She is 35 years old, married and has five children. Her eldest is 18 years old. To make a living, Jusilyn owns and operates a business growing crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Jusilyn also sells ready-to-wear and used clothes.

Jusilyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jusilyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn C. is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns a monthly net income of 3,200 PHP. Marilyn is 49 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. She is from the village of Upper Langub, Calamba. 

In 2000, Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Marilyn is requesting her 19th loan amounting to 35,000 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Martha Braulia

texts.es:
La Señora. Martha C. es socia del banco comunal El Aguacate, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre y  pertenece a la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es hermosa por su cultura y tradiciones, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía, también tiene 4 ríos los mismos que bañan la ciudad.

Nuestra socia labora junto a su esposo en un taller de joyería, actividad que desempeñan hace varios años. También se dedica a la venta de cerdos, negocio que lo aprendido de sus padres y ahora tiene mucha experiencia en este trabajo, le gusta este trabajo ya que le da ganancias rápidas pero el problema es que debe tener un buen capital de trabajo para comprar sus cerdos.
 
La Señora. Martha tiene 33 años y su esposo 37 años, tienen 2 hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familia pero independientes.
 
Se encuentra hace un año y cuatro meses en el banco comunal y le gusta los créditos ya que son rápidos y sin muchos papeleos. El dinero de su  crédito lo va a invertir la mitad en el negocio de las joyas y la otra mitad en la compra de cerdos. Su meta es tener un gabinete de belleza.
texts.en: Martha C. is a member of El Aguacate (Avocado) community bank and lives in the community of the same name in the city of Cuenca. This city has a beautiful culture and tradition and is known for its great variety of gastronomy as well as having four rivers running through it. Martha works alongside her husband at their jewelry shop, an activity they have been doing for a number of years. She also makes a living selling pigs, a business she learned from her parents in which she now has a lot of experience. She enjoys the job because it earns income quickly, but the problem is it takes a lot of capital to buy the pigs at the start. Martha is 33 years old and her husband is 37. They have two children, ages 8 and 2. They don't own a home but live in a family member's home independently. Martha has been a member of her community bank for a year and four months and enjoys the loans since they are quick and don't have a lot of red tape. She plans on using half of the loan for her jewelry business and the other half to buy pigs. Her goal is to have a beauty shop.

loans.use: Purchase jewelry and pigs

loans.name: Virginia Ester

texts.es:
Doña Virginia, resiD. en Usulután, vive con sus hijos y su esposo, tiene 45 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. tablilla, tamales y meriendas, este negocio lo inicio hace 8 años con la ayuda D. sus hijos, pero por el momento quiere invertir y no cuenta con ahorros para poder realizar las compras necesarias D. materiales para la preparación D. sus productos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. maíz, condimentos, cacao y azúcar, así como productos para prepara las meriendas, este préstamo le ayudara a realizar la compra y a fortalecer el negocio para producir más e incrementar las ventas.
Tiene como propósito administrar bien los fondos del préstamo haciendo una buena inversión, pagar puntualmente y seguir creciendo en busca D. un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Doña Virginia lives in Usulután with her children and husband. She is 45 years old and earns her living by selling tablilla (a hot chocolate drink), tamales (local dish maD. from corn), and snacks. She started this business eight years ago with help from her children. She would now like to invest more money in it but she has no savings to buy the necessary ingredients.

Virginia is seeking a loan to buy corn, condiments, cocoa, sugar, as well as the ingredients she needs for snacks. The loan will help her buy these items and strengthen her business as she would be able to produce more and increase sales.

She plans to use the money wisely by investing it carefully, make her repayments on time, and continue developing, all in the search for a better future.

loans.use: to buy corn, condiments, cocoa, and sugar

loans.name: Magamaga Development Group-Jinja

texts.en:
50-year-old Florence B. has been operating her retail shop in Magamaga, Jinja, for the last decade. She said she made the decision to start up this business in the face of dire circumstances that on many occasions rendered her helpless as to how to provide for her family. At that time she was more preoccupied with agriculture, a modest means of subsistence. Through the course of the past decade, she said hard work and determination have become her mantra. 

Florence is happily married with 10 children.  She said she has been selling mostly household necessities, and her clients are mostly people from the neighborhood.   She said this business generates for her 180,000 shillings in weekly profit.  Florence also earns side income from a sugar cane trading business.  

With this loan, Florence said she will purchase more retail items to resell this Christmas season. She is a anticipating a boom in her business  operations during this festive season. Florence belongs to Magamaga Development group-Jinja.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to resell

loans.name: Saad

texts.ar:
سعد في عمر 32 سنة متزوج وله اربع اولاد يعمل في محل لبيع المعجنات (والمناقيش) له في عمله 9 سنوات يحب عمله
ويتقنه جيد يريد ان يتطور في عمله وان يصبح مالك اكثر من محل لأنه طموح لكنه يعاني من صعوبةمادية لأنه يلقى
منافسة وقد ساهم القرض السابق في تحسين وضع عمله يريد قرض من المجموعة بهدف شراء طحين ومازوت للفرن يتميز بالصدق 
والنظافة في العمل
texts.en: Saad is a 32-year-old husband and father of four who has 9 years of experience working at a shop that sells pot pies and fateera pies. Saad’s work is marked by straightforwardness and cleanliness, and he himself is driven to eventually become the owner of a chain of such shops. Nevertheless, this is financially difficult because of his competition. Saad’s last loan from Al Majmoua helped to improve his business and accordingly he is now seeking another loan to purchase flour and fuE. for his oven.

loans.use: To purchase flour and fuel for oven

loans.name: David L.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the SDA Primary School in Mayeberie village in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 1983 by the Seven Days Adventist Church Mission (SMD Mission), to give formal education to the children of Mayeberie village. Presently, this school is staffed with eight teachers and 160 pupils. 

This is the second loan that these teachers have requested from SMT/Kiva lenders. Having repaid their previous loan successfully, they now want a new loan in order to further improve of their standard of living. 

David L. K. is the head teacher and leader of this group. Mr. K. has taught for 35 years now. Born in 1951 in the village of Makump, Mr. K. is married to a businesswoman and the couple has seven children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Mr. K. has requested for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 from Kiva partner in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Ximena

texts.es:
Ximena forma parte del banco comunal “El único” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talcahuano. Ella compra y vende  calzados a pedido desde hace 2 años, trabajando directamente desde su casa y vende además en su lugar de trabajo dependiente, en un colegio, en donde ocupa un cargo administrativo. 
Cuando comenzó en el rubro del comercio, ella vendía empanadas y ropa, hace 6 años aproximadamente. Sin embargo la venta de calzados le ha brindado más ganancias. 
Con este préstamo comprará calzados, en la ciudad de Pucón, de esta manera tendrá más posibilidades de venta con el fin de obtener más ganancias. 
Ella vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas, quienes además le ayudan en su negocio durante la temporada de verano (enero – febrero), ya que tiene un puesto en la ciudad de Pucón, el cual atienden sus hijas de 19 y 12 años. Por su parte su esposo también la ayuda cuando tiene días libres en su trabajo, el se desempeña como chofer de locomoción colectiva.
El sueño de Ximena es tener un puesto en la ciudad de Talcahuano y de esta manera independizarse.
Su motivación para seguir con su negocio es costear los estudios superiores de su hija, ya que ella estudia en un instituto.
Para Ximena la ayuda de Fondo Esperanza ha sido un gran apoyo para su negocio, ya que se ha sentido acogida, debido al buen trato,  el compañerismo y  responsabilidad por parte de ellos.
Talcahuano es una comuna y ciudad-puerto de la región del Bíobío, al sur de Chile. Es conocida como uno de los principales puertos del país. Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa "cielo tronador". Posee un paisaje natural  muy atractivo, debido a la combinación de ríos, mar, planicies fértiles, vegas y los cuerpos montañosos, con una hermosa vegetación. Su economía gira en torno a su puerto, su Base Naval, y un importante barrio industrial con empresas siderúrgicas, refinería de petróleo, petroquímica, cemento, gas, etc.
texts.en: Ximena is part of "El Unico" community bank in the city of Talcahuano. She has bought and sold footwear for the past two years, working directly out of her home. She also works on location at a school where she holds an administrative role. When she started out in commerce about six years ago, she was selling empanadas and clothing. However, selling shoes has brought in more profits. With the loan, she plans to purchase footwear in the city of Pucón, and in this way she will have more sales possibilities with the end goal of earning more income. Ximena lives with her husband and her two daughters, who help her with the business during the summertime (January and February). She has a sales post in Pucón, which her daughters, ages 19 and 12, tend to. Her husband also helps when he has free days from his work as a public transportation driver. Ximena's dream is to have a sales post in Talcahuano and in this way become more independent. Her motivation to continue with the business is to finance her daughter's higher education since she is studying at an institute. Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza has provided Ximena and her business a lot of support, and she has been touched by her good treatment, the friendship and the responsibility. Talcahuano is a commune and city-port in the region of Bíobío in the south of Chile. It is known as one of the main ports in the country. Its name in Mapuche means "thundering sky." It has a lot of natural beauty thanks to its combination of rivers, sea, fertile plains, meadows and mountains coupled with beautiful vegetation. Its economy revolves around its port, its naval base and an important industrial neighborhood with steel, oil refining, petrochemical, cement and gas companies.

loans.use: Footwear

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi S. is  45 years old.  She resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, in an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.  S. produces cow ties, earning an income of USD 2.3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 2.6 per day. Each month, the family must spend USD 50 on food and USD 100 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Víctor Jhonny

texts.es:
Víctor Jhonny S. O. tiene 29 años, vive en Union Libre vive con la compañera y los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Víctor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  tener una casa nueva y superarse.

Le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Víctor Jhonny S. O. is 29 years old.  He lives with his partner and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He has three children.

The 'San José de los Amarillos' community bank is located in Amarillos community, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Víctor is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his products in the Murillo shopping area and sells his products in the same place.

Víctor is requesting this loan to grown corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to own a new house and to get ahead.

Víctor likes to play indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Hera Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Hera Devi M. is a resident of Khokhana, lalitpur. Khokhana is one of the developing villages of lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. M. has four members including herself in her family. She has two sons aged 30 and 28. 

Mrs. M. is engaged in a goat rasing business. She sells goats in the local market. Now she is requesting a loan of RS 10,000.00 loan to buy baby goats for her business.

loans.use: to buys baby goats for her business.

loans.name: Cristobal Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene de 41 años de edad, es soltero y con su familia en el distrito de Saqa, un distrito conocido a nivel regional por sus tradiciones. Se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Se dedica a la venta de alimentos, actividad que realiza  con la finalidad de apoyar en su familia en la economía.  La venta la realiza de forma ambulatoria, por las calles de su comunidad.  Cuenta ya con clientela fidelizada que lo apoya y lo elige por la calidad de los alimentos que vende y por el buen trato que da.

Manuel desea adquirir alimento más insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Manuel is 41 years old.  He is single and lives with his family in Saqa district.  This is a district which is well known at a regional level for its traditions.  It is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Manuel's business is selling food.  He carries out this business with the goal of financially supporting his family.  He makes his sales as an itinerant  vendor in the streets of his community.  He already has loyal customers who support him and choose to buy from him because of the quality of the food that he sells and the good customer service that he provides.

Manuel would like to acquire supplies with which to prepare his food and he would like to make more profits.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food

loans.name: Kuña Porä Group

texts.es:
El Comité se encuentra en el 4to. ciclo del programa “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras”, cuenta con 15 integrantes, todas del barrio Las Garzas de la ciudad de San Antonio - Villa Elisa; el grupo demuestra excelente moral de pago, disponen de un buen ahorro y también realizan actividades varias para su caja chica.
Son unidas y respetuosas entre sí, todas las decisiones las toman en forma democrática, utilizando el sistema de la votación para cualquier decisión a tomar.
La presidenta, Claudelina B., se destaca por su capacidad de liderazgo, alienta a sus compañeras a seguir esforzándose para salir adelante, valoran bastante la oportunidad que la Fundación les sigue brindando y todas tienen sus respectivos microemprendimientos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y gracias a anteriores créditos otorgados a este comité por Kiva fue incrementando su negocio, hoy día solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar abrigos, pantalones, remeras, buzos y otras prendas de invierno, de modo a seguir obteniendo buenos resultados en sus ventas.
texts.en:
The group is in its fourth cycle with the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program.  There are 15 members, and they are all from the Las Garzas neighborhood in the city of San Antonio – Villa Elisa.

The group demonstrates excellent morals about their payments.  They make use of good savings, and they also engage in various activities for their petty cash.  They are united and respectful of each other.  They make all of their decisions in a democratic way, using the voting system for whatever decision they make.

Claudelina B., the president, stands out for her leadership ability.  She encourages her colleagues to continue putting forth great effort in order to get ahead.  They really value the opportunity that the Fundación continues to give them, and they all have their own small businesses.

She sells clothes, and thanks to previous Kiva loans to this communal bank, she has been expanding her business.  Now she is requesting a new loan to be able to buy coats, pants, t-shirts, sweatshirts, and other winter garments.  That way she will continue getting good results from her sales.

loans.use: to buy coats, pants, t-shirts, sweatshirts, etc.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es: La señora Shirley tiene un puesto de venta de frutas donde vende a su clientela frutas como ser uvas, plátanos, frutillas y otros; su esposo es electricista. El crédito lo requiere para adquirir fruta al por mayor y así podrá aumentar su mercadería, sus ventas y por consiguiente sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto San Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz,  es casada y tiene un hijo. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Sra. Shirley has a fruit stand where she sells grapes, bananas, strawberries, and other types of produce to her customers. Her husband is an electrician. The loan she is requesting will be used to acquire fruit in bulk so that she can increase her inventory and her sales in order to generate more income.

She lives in her own home in the District of Alto San Antonio in the city of La Paz. Shirley is married and has a son. This is the first loan she has received from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is married with two sons. Both of them are very young and studying, attending local school. She herself is illiterate but she never compromised on her children's education. She works very hard for that purpose. She is a seamstress and sews clothes for her community clients.  She is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well. 

Her husband has a business selling costume jewelry. He is very experienced in his business and has a good number of clients who purchase jewelry from him regularly due to his good rates and good designs. Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy some costume jewelry like necklaces, earrings, etc. for the expansion of his business.  

He has been operating this business for the past 12 years and Kalsoom is hopeful that he will be able to fulfill the demand of his customers and improve his income after investing the loan into it. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kalsoom.

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a hard-working mother who is now 56 years old.  She has a grocery store where she sells noodles, junk foods, detergent soaps and canned goods.  Milagros has operated this business for almost seven years. 

Milagros is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional grocery items, soft drinks, frozen foods and vegetables.  She usually earns about PHP 8,000 each month in this business.

In the future, Milagros hopes to improve this kind of business in order to supplement her husband's income for the sake of their children and their future. She hopes that KIVA lenders will continuously support her in the business in order to achieve her goals in life.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items, soft drinks, frozen foods and vegetables

location.town: Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr:
Femme de 34ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants scolarisés âgée de 02 à 15ans. Elle débute son commerce comme ambulante des mèches au marche en 2001 et grâce à ses épargnes et vend sur une table au marché depuis 2003 avec un capital de 100.000Frs. Ses recettes journalières sont de 30000 à 50000frs. 

Avec ce prêt elle va acheter des variétés de tissage tel que (tissage naturel noble, olive, x-pression, tissage synthétique), des mèches telles que pony, olive, anglaise, afro. 

Elle fait preuve d'une bonne gestion et réserve un bon accueil à ses clients. Elle aimerait effectuer des voyages en Afrique de l'ouest afin d'importer la marchandise. 

Elle aimerait aussi renforcer les conditions de vie de ses enfants en l'offrant une bonne scolarisation et éducation. Elle est encouragée dans son entourage pour les efforts qu'elle fournit et sa motivation dans son commerce.
texts.en:
She is 34 years old, married and the mother of three children in school between the ages of two and fifteen. She started her business of selling hair extensions as a street peddler in 2001. As a result of her savings and selling from a stall in the market, she has capital of 100,000 frs. Her daily revenues are between 30,000 and 50,000 frs. 

With her loan, she is going to purchase a variety of weaves (such as natural noble weave, olive, x-pression and synthetic weaves) and hair extensions (such as pony, olive, English and afro).   

She manages her business well and properly welcomes her clients. 

She also wants to improve her children's living conditions by giving them a good education and upbringing. Her friends encourage her efforts and her motivation for business.

loans.use: to purchase weaves and hair extensions

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is divorced and has three children. She is a palm oil extractor at Abura, which she has done for seven years. The income she makes from her sales is used to take care of her children. The loan will be used to purchase more palm fruit to process to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit to process to sell.

loans.name: Magdalena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Magdalena del Carmen tiene 61 años, Es viuda vive con  una hija y un nieto, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Magdalena se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es incrementar las ventas para tener mas dienro para ayudar a la hija a educar al nieto.

Le gusta le gusta ver el futbool.
texts.en:
Magdalena del Carmen is 61 years old, widowed, and lives with a daughter and grandson in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Tierra Nuestra” (Our Land) meet in the neighborhood of San Luis de Zapotal, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Magdalena is a farmer who grows corn and rice. She buys her products at the AGRIPAC commercial center and sells at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

The loan she is requesting will be used for planting corn and rice. She plans to buy seeds and compost for her corn and rice crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges she faces include diseases that could impact her crops and the lack of money to pay for more workers. Her dream is to increase sales so that she can have more money to help her daughter provide for her grandson’s education.

Magdalena enjoys watching soccer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost for planting corn and rice.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 46 years old and married with two children.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a traveling sales business selling tobacco in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 49,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell.

Merlinda has borrowed and paid back 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the tobacco business for 18 years and earns additional income from raising pigs and farming sugarcane.

Merlinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more tobacco to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 35 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children. Four of his children are currently in school. Samuel has a business of a small retail shop that sells electrical items, which he has had for 5 years.         

To help expand his business, Samuel has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase electrical materials for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Samuel hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Samuel hopes to expand his business. Samuel is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program (SEP), which has helped his future prospects by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase electrical materials for resale.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en: Pascal is a hard-working 27-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with seven children who are school-going. To make a living, he has been engaging in the carpentry business. He supplements his income from the earnings he makes from his shop. He wants in the next five years to have expanded his business. His dream is to be an expert in woodwork. He is requesting a loan of 20,030 Kenya shillings to buy timber, nails, and paint.

loans.use: To buy timber, nails, and paint.

loans.name: Heberardo

texts.es:
Heberardo de 22 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona es agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Heberardo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, además de ser un producto consumido diariamente por las personas, una vez que realiza su cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la zona y fuera de ella,  con los ingresos que adquiera puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y esposa.

A observar que su negocio va creciendo y a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizante para mejorar sus tierras comosu producto, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá pagar su crédito y solventar las necesidades diarias de su familia.  Heberardo con trabajo y dedicación le brinda lo mejor a sus hijos, con la intensión de brindarles otra oportunidad académica en un futuro.
texts.en:
Heberardo is 22 years old.  He lives with his family in his own home, where he only has electricity (no running water).  His home is located in the rural area of the Tambogrande district, which belongs to Piura Department.  This is an area of agriculture, livestock and handicrafts.

Heberardo works in agriculture; he has his own farmlands where he grows corn, which he has been doing for several years; it's a product that's eaten daily by many people.  Once his harvest is ready he sells it in the different markets in and outside the area.  With the income that he earns, he is able to provide a better quality of life for his son and wife.

He has observed that his business is growing, and believed it necessary to request a loan for 1,500 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  The loan is for the purchase of fertilizer to improve his land and his crop.  With the earnings that he will generate, he will be able to pay back his loan and cover his family's daily needs.

Heberardo wants to provide the best to his children, through hard work and dedication, with the intention of providing them with other academic opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his land and his crop.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; este banco muy simpático está ubicado a 30 minutos de la Ciudad del Cusco en el poblado llamado Yuncaypata, este es un típico pueblito en el que se conserva toda la herencia andina pura, y viven todos en comunidad apoyándose en la época de siembra y cosecha, cuidando a sus hijos y a sus animales, es un pueblo muy bonito y es quechua hablante, está en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; la socia tiene33 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos de  14, 9, 1 años de edad;  la socia trabaja en  agricultura  y se dedica también a la crianza de animales como cuyes, ella está especializada en la crianza solo por ahora de cuyes y los lleva  a vender a los restaurantes turísticos, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de alimento, vitaminas y de cuyes desea comprar 50 cuyes para aumentar sus galpón cuyero, la socia invertirá el préstamo en la jaula, alimento y compra de cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar 50 cuyes, alimento para ellos y vitaminas, también arreglara el espacio acondicionando sus jaulas para recibir a mas cuyes.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
This member, Mrs. Luz Marina, belongs to a communal bank called 'Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata', a very friendly bank located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco, in the village of Yuncaypata. This is a typical Andean village which has retained it's pure heritage. Everyone lives communally, supporting each other through the periods of planting and harvesting, caring for their children and animals. It is a beautiful Quechua-speaking town, in the administrative division of Cusco.

Luz Marina is 33 years old, and married with three children aged 19, 14 and one. She works in agriculture and also raises animals such as guinea pigs, which she specializes in and brings them to popular tourist restaurants to sell. Luz Marina has requested the loan to invest in the purchase of a cage, food and vitamins, and wants to buy 50 guinea pigs so that she can boost her guinea pig shed. She also wants to prepare and fix up the cage space she has so that she can host more guinea pigs.

Luz Marina is grateful and appreciates the loan granted through this channel. She is disciplined and committed to repaying this loan as she has done with her previous loans.

loans.use: to purchase 50 guinea pigs, food and vitamins for them, and also to fix and prepare cage space so that she can house more guinea pigs

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy, 43, is a silk weaver. Her husband is a policeman. They have three children, one son and two daughters, who are in school. They live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Chanthy is requesting a loan of $200 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

Photo: Chanthy is dyeing silk.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Sandra Madelaine

texts.es:
Sandra Madelaine es soltera tiene 19 años de edad no tiene hijos vive con la mamá y las tres hermanas en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas  a la siembra de cacao.

Sandra se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao las compras y ventas las realizan en San Juan . 

Solicita el crédito para poder dar mantenimiento al cultivo de cacao para poder aspirar a venderlo a un precio más conveniente.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda para suplir necesidades económicas y mantener en buenas condiciones el cacao. 

Los desafíos que enfrenta a diario es  la competencia, las plagas y las enfermedades que puedan dar al cultivo.

El sueño de Sandra es poder salir adelante con la familia. En los tiempos libres le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Sandra Madelaine, 19, is single and has no children.  She lives with her mother and three sisters in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.   She’s a member of the “Cevallos” communal bank that’s located in Recinto San Francisco belonging to San Juan del Pueblo Parish that belongs to Ventanas.  They are cocoa bean farmers.


Sandra is a cocoa bean farmer and makes her purchases and her sales in San Juan.  She requests the loan to provide maintenance for her cocoa bean crops to be able to sell it at a better price.  The loan will be of much help for her to meet her economic needs and to maintain her cocoa beans in good condition.  The challenges she faces are pests and illnesses that can affect her crops.


Sandra’s dream is to be able to get ahead with her family.  In her free time she enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to provide maintenance for her cocoa bean crops.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 57 years old and married with three children. Luciana is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a Sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Luciana requested a PHP 13,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Luciana has been in this business for six years. In the future, Luciana would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 45 year old business lady. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for seven years. Christine also has a motorbike transport business to earn extra income. Previously, she was employed as a nurse. She works hard in her businesses to earn more income to raise her two children. Christine hopes to buy another motorbike with the KSh 75,000 loan she has requested.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Margie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Margie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Margie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Bondeni Farmers Group

texts.en:
Wasilwa is the facilitator of the Bondeni Farmers group. Wasilwa and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Wasilwa takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Wasilwa had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Wasilwa was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Wasilwa and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Wasilwa will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Bondeni Farmers group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is taking another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to boost her business of clothes selling, and also to do plumbing.  With the loan, she intends to purchase bales of clothes and to install water pipes in her home. She dreams of expanding and taking a bigger loan in the future to meet her needs.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes, and to do plumbing in her house.

loans.name: Señor De Puquin Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE PUQUIN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ines; ella es conviviente y tiene 54 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara diferentes platos de comida como pollo al horno, estofado de carne y sopas, la socia también se dedica al trabajo de lavar ropa en diferentes casas y el negocio de venta de comida lo realiza en forma ambulatoria, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de comida y mejorar en el trabajo de lavar ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras al por mayor.

 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de artesanía, negocio de venta de tejidos, negocio de restaurant, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Señor de Puquin" communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, which is part of Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Ines is 54. She lives with her partner, and has five children. She has a business selling meals. She prepares various food dishes, such as baked chicken, meat stew and soups. She also washes clothes in various homes.  She carries on her food business as a street vendor. 

Through these businesses, she is raising her children. She wants to expand and improve her food stand, and improve her work washing clothes.

She is applying for the loan to buy cooking ingredients, such as chicken, meat and vegetables at wholesale. The other members work at various activities, such as handicrafts, selling weavings, a restaurant, serving meals, and selling beauty products.

The member is thankful to those who are helping her achieve this dream, and promises to pay her instalments within the established time period.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients such as chicken, meat, and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Ngabori

texts.en:
Ngabori is 34 years old and married to Nkatile. They have seven children.

He has been in the business of buying and selling cows and goats for the last sixteen years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 59,000. He is applying for his fourth loan of KES 100,000. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the profits to buy more cows and goats for sale.

loans.use: to buy more cows and goats for sale.

loans.name: Sokly's Group

texts.en:
The mother of a big family of ten children, Sokly is 48 years old now. She is a farmer who has been growing rice to sell to support her family. To better feed her family, she also raises pigs in her backyard to supplement her income. She has been in this business for ten years.

Sokly and her group member, Vanna, are applying for their first loan with VisionFund. As the leader of the group, she plans to use her portion of this 400 USD loan to buy pig feed and a piglet.

This loan will enable Sokly to raise a fat and healthy pig. She hopes to earn more money by doing so.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and a piglet.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma, tiene 34 años, se dedica a la venta de frutas, es madre de 5 hijos, es casada y socia de Finca Perú desde hace 5 años, esta muy bien en Finca porque le da la seguridad y la estabilidad que no le dan otras entidades, aquí aprendió a ahorrar, a poder tener una base para un buen negocio, además la tranquilidad de su familia como de ella en lo económico, ahora compra frutas al por mayor y reparte.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá para comprar la carga de un camión para poder vender al por menor las frutas.
texts.en:
Clementina is a member of the Paloma community bank.  She is 34 years old and her business is selling fruit.  She is the mother of five children, is married, and has been a member of Finca Peru for five years.  She is very happy to be a member of Finca because it gives her security and stability which other institutions do not provide.  Here she has learned how to save, how to create the basis of a good business, and how to create financial harmony for herself and her family.  She now buys fruit wholesale and delivers them.  

Clementina will invest the loan that she is requesting in paying for a truck so that she can sell her fruit retail.

loans.use: to hire a truck with which to sell fruit

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité sop Mame Diarra est créé depuis le 30 décembre 2009, il est constitué de dix femmes qui habitent le même village. Leurs principales activités sont le petit commerce et l'élevage.

La responsable Faty est âgée de 48 ans,elle est mariée mère de quatre enfants; 
elle mène une activité de petit commerce de légumes,de transformation artisanale d'huile d'arachide et fait parallèlement de l'élevage de moutons, elle a une bonne expérience dans ces secteurs. Sur la photo elle est assise à droite avec un châle noir autour des épaules et tient un livret.

Elle achéte l'arachide, les légumes ( choux,aubergines, carottes,navets....) dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour revendre dans son village. 


Son prêt lui servira à diversifier et agrandir ses activités afin de se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Elle aide son mari pour les dépenses de la famille et souhaite augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The "sop Mame Diarra" group was formed on 30th December 2009. In it are ten women who live in the same village. Their main business is local retailing and animal rearing. The leader Faty is 48 years old, she is married and the mother of four children. She has a small business selling vegetables, processing peanut oil, and she also rears some sheep as well. She has good experience in these areas. 
In the photo she is sitting on the right with a black shawl over her shoulders, holding a book.
She buys peanuts and vegetables (cabbage, aubergine, carrots, turnips....) at the weekly markets in order to sell in her village. The loan will allow her to diversify and grow her businesses in order to make substantial profits. She helps her husband cover the family's living expenses, and would like to increase her savings.

loans.use: Acheter des légumes destinés à la vente

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Borrower Mr.Erdenebaatar is years old married man who lives with his family in apartment which he bought recently by his income. He works at local company while his wife works as a sales assistant at the biggest Expo center of the city. Besides his current job he operates home and office furniture selling business. He said: "Nowadays its really hard to live only salary income, so I decided to own a business". 

He is requesting a 3.000.000 MNT loan to purchase more furniture to sell and increase his family income in order to live with his family happily and successfully.

loans.use: to purchase more furnitures to sell

loans.name: Humberto Cesar

texts.en:
Humberto works in a restaurant and earns a fixed salary but it is not enough to cover the economic needs of his wife and two children. Nine years ago, he was under an economic depression and he needed to generate adittional income. This is the reason he started to invest in selling clothes.

His business has been growing with his wife’s support and his income has been expanding. His children have been able to keep up their studies.

Nowadays he has a stand in the local market where he offers his merchandise, and with the unconditional support of his wife, he hopes his business continues to grow.

He is asking for a loan of $475 USD to pay over a term of 6-12 months because is a good season is coming. Christmas parties increase the demand of his products and he wants to be able to supply it.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

El Sr. Humberto es empleado de un Restaurante, sus ingresos son fijos, pero no son suficientes y tiene responsabilidades económicas de una esposa y 2 hijos. Hace 9 años sentía que las presiones económicas lo agobiaban por lo que era necesario buscar generar mas ingresos; fue así como empezó a invertir en ropa para vender.

Con el apoyo de su esposa poco a poco fueron aumentando los clientes y mejorando los ingresos, gracias a ello, sus hijos han continuado sus estudios.

A la fecha ya cuenta con un puesto en un tianguis para ofrecer sus mercancías, cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposa, por lo que espera que su negocio crezca todavía mas.

Esta solicitando un crédito por la cantidad de $475 USD a 6-12 meses, pues se avecina una buena temporada, con las posadas y fiestas navideñas, se incrementa la demanda de ropa, por lo que necesita estar preparado con suficiente mercancía.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Therisssa

texts.en: Madam Therissa is a stone cracker. She cracks stones of different sizes and sells to constructors and the general public. From an interview conducted with her, she said, "The cost of buying stones for cracking is very high and I need assistance to enable me buy the stones." She is therefore seeking  a loan of $1000 from Kiva.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Minneh Wamaitha Maina Wants to buy a high breed Dairy Cow, Animal Feeds and 200 layers chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: A lovely young mother, Mrs. Stella G. is 34 years old, married with five children. She sells provisions and believes she can improve her business turnover  and her future if given a loan of $550. Stella hails from Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria .

loans.use: To buy more provisions for resale

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abla Z., 46, is married and mother of five children. She is also responsible for two other children. Her husband is illiterate and has become an alcoholic, so she has to support him as well.

Mrs. Z.’s source of income is selling cooked rice at school in her neighborhood. This is a very profitable business, but her capital is insufficient to allow her to expand and get the most from her micro-business. She is asking for a loan of US$ 800 to build a shed. This sum will also allow her to keep a consistent supply of cooked food on hand. She will thus be able to increase her sales and the profit from her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 46 ans, Madame Z. Abla est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Elle a à sa charge deux (2) autres enfants. Son mari est un analphabète qui s’est donné à l’alcool. Il est à la charge de la pauvre femme.

Madame Z. Abla a pour activité la vente du riz préparé dans une école de son quartier. C’est un commerce très rentable mais ses moyens sont insuffisants pour l’agrandir et le rentabiliser. Elle sollicite un appui financier de $800 pour construire un hangar et faire un stock consistant de ses aliments. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu.

loans.use: build a shed and have a consistent supply of cooked food on hand for resale

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata is a hardworking woman who has dedicated herself to giving her best to her three children and for this reason a year and a half ago she began traveling around her community selling food. She began by taking food to sell to bus stops and now she takes her food to sell on a tricycle. The reason she began doing this is because she needed to support her family. Her husband does not have stable work because he suffers from health problems. His continuing health problems make it so the family cannot rely on him for a stable source of income to cover the many costs associated will supporting the family. Thanks to Honorata’s talents in the kitchen and her hard work she has been able to make enough money to be able to pay for her children’s education in a privates schools and in the university. Honorata wants her family to have their own house one day because presently they live in a dwelling that belongs to a family member. To achieve this dream Honorata will continue to dedicate herself to her work. She wants to increase her business with a loan of US $375. She will invest the money in buying supplies in bulk that she will use to make the foods that she sells daily. With your help Honorata will continue work and her children will have a bright future.

Translated from Spanish and Mariela and Kendra of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

Honorata es una mujer valerosa que cada día se esfuerza por dar lo mejor de sí a sus 3 hijos y esta es la razón por la cual ha decidido hace un año y medio dedicarse a la venta de comidas de manera ambulatoria. Comenzó llevando la comida en tapers al paradero de buses y ahora vende llevando la comida preparada desde su casa en un triciclo, la razón más fuerte que la condujo a realizar esta labor fue el de llevar a su familia el sustento necesario para vivir; su esposo tiene trabajos eventuales y está delicado de salud, las continuas dolencias no le permiten un ingreso seguro y suficiente para poder cubrir varios gastos que se generan en el interior de su hogar. El rubro al que se dedica Honorata gracias a la buena sazón y trabajo diligente le ha permitido poder educar a sus hijos que estudian en el colegio y la universidad pero anhela algún día poder tener una casa propia ya que por ahora habita la morada de un familiar. Es por ello que está decidida a seguir trabajando con diligencia y quiere acrecentar su negocio y para llevar a cabo su propósito solicita un préstamo de 375 dólares que invertirá sabiamente en la compra de víveres al por mayor para poder elaborar las comidas diarias que comercializa. Con tu ayuda podemos hacer que Honorata siga trabajando para ver a sus hijos con un futuro mejor.

loans.use: Buy supplies for the preparation of foods that she will offer daily to her faithful clients.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa always had an enormous desire to help with her family’s economic well-being, particularly since the income of her husband, a mototaxi driver, was not enough to cover the daily expenses of the household. In this way, this noble mother began to sell candy in Santa Ana Park in her town, dividing her time between her job and the daily activities of motherhood. Her eight-year-old son, who has devoted himself to helping the family alongside his mother, energetically helps her with her candy sales. All their hard work is done with the goal of purchasing a mototaxi vehicle that will yield economic benefits to support their beloved son, a son who is always ready to help. Our economic support will be a great investment in the hands of this upright mother; she requests this loan to continue building her dreams, and only hopes that you won’t deny your support to this family.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen Rosa, siempre tuvo el inmenso deseo de colaborar económicamente con el bienestar de su familia, ya que el dinero proporcionado por su esposo, que es chofer de mototaxi, muchas veces no era suficientes para satisfacer los gastos diarios que demandaba su hogar, es así que esta noble madre empezó a vender dulces en el parque de Santa Ana de su localidad, compartiendo su tiempo entre esta labor y el de sus actividades cotidianas de madre. En la venta de golosinas la ayuda de manera muy animosa su pequeño hijito de ocho años, quien junto a su madre se ha comprometido con el desarrollo de su familia.Todo este esfuerzo lo realiza con el fin de ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar un vehículo mototaxi, con cuyos beneficios económicos seguirá brindando apoyo a su querido hijo que siempre ha estado presto a ayudarla.Nuestro apoyo económico será una gran inversión en las manos de esta noble madre es por ello que solicita un préstamo para seguir con sus sueños y sólo espera de ti no lo dude apoye a esta familia.

loans.use: Acquisition of wider quantity and variety of candy.

loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Tạ Thị T. is 47 years old. She and her husband have 4 children, they live in the town of Lương Bằng, Kim Động district. She opened a clothing store 10 years ago, this is the main revenue for her family. Her husband is a cow seller, he helps her out in his free time. It is hard for her to make ends meet, putting their children in school. But that wouldn't keep her from keeping a happy face. Her store caters to the women clientele from her town as well as the neighbor towns. This time she requests a loan of 950 USD to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Tạ Thị T., 47 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 4 con tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Kim Động. Chị mở cửa hàng kinh doanh quần áo cách đây được 10 năm, đây là nghề chính của gia đình chị. Chồng chị ngoài việc đi buôn bò còn thường xuyên hỗ trợ chi trong việc kinh doanh. Cuộc sống vất vả lam lũ để nuôi các con ăn học nhưng lúc nào trên khuôn mặt chị cũng thường trực nụ cười rạng rỡ. Cửa hàng của chị chủ yếu phục vụ những người phụ nữ nơi khu chợ chị bán và các vùng lân cận. Vòng vốn này chị rất mong muốn được vay 950USD để mua thêm hàng về bán.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Mrs. Sek P., 41, is married with two school-age children, and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She works selling a variety of grocery products to the people in her area, making on average around $20 each day of income while her husband is employed by a nearby local NGO, making typically around $5 each day. Mrs. Sek P. has humbly requested a loan to expand her inventory by adding more grocery products to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: to expand her inventory by adding more grocery products to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Finish building two rooms to be rented.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Ms Florinda is an active woman with many desires to succeed. She has sold beauty products, like perfumes, talcum powder, lipstick, nail cutters, and other things, for many years. She is an elementary school teacher. Thanks to her charisma and cheerfulness in selling her products she has gained a great number of clients. For this reason she has now decided to install a display counter so that she can exhibit her products and increase her demand and profit.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Florinda es una mujer activa y con muchos deseos de superación, se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la venta de productos de belleza como: perfumes, talcos, labiales, correctores para uñas, entre otras cositas. Es profesora de educación inicial y gracias a su carisma y jovialidad al ofertar sus productos tiene una gran gama de clientes, es por eso que ahora ha optado por poner un mostrador para que en el se puedan exponer sus productos y acrecentar su demanda y ganancias.

loans.use: To increase capital and offer a greater number of beauty products

loans.name: Roilith

texts.es:
The Lady Roilith R. T. is an associate of the “Vision2000" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region, Province of Pillory, district of San Hilarión. Her second-hand clothes sale business is located in her own house on Jr. José Olaya Street from which she draws from the nearby communities to sell her products to the inhabitants that like this type of articles of clothing.

She lives with her husband and 3 children, who motivate her to improve her work each day and thus to contribute to the income of the family. With the loan received of 1900 Soles which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy articles of used clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children in different sizes and styles that come in bales, that are sent from the city of Lima.

Roilith is an optimistic and happy woman that has learned to take her own decisions. She dreams of having a business buying and selling rice flour that is in strong demand in the area.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Roilith R. T. es socia del Banco Comunal “Vision2000” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Picota y distrito de San Hilarión, su negocio de venta de ropa de segunda esta ubicada en su propia casa en el Jr. José Olaya S/N desde donde se desplaza a las comunidades cercanas a vender sus productos a los moradores que gustan de este tipo de prendas de vestir.

Vive con su esposo y 03 hijos quienes le motivan a desarrollar su trabajo cada día y así contribuir con los ingresos económicos de la familia.

Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1900.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará prendas de vestir usadas para damas caballeros y niños en diferentes tallas y modelos los mismos que vienen en fardos, que lo envían desde la ciudad de Lima.

Roilith es una mujer alegre y optimista, que ha aprendido a tomar sus propias decisiones, sueña con tener un negocio de compra y venta de polvillo de arroz que tiene muy buena demanda en la zona.

loans.use: To buy used clothing in bales for resale.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 24 year-old Subira L.. She is married, and has no children. In 2007, Subira opened her clothing business. She has applied for this loan in order to expand the range of clothing on offer in her shop. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. For example, when a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. This is a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. They are, therefore, labelled ‘not-creditworthy’ by financial institutions because they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services, for women with low incomes.

loans.use: To purchase additional styles of clothing to sell

loans.name: Samath Ali

texts.en: Samath Ali lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and educated, and he has a grocery store. He loves his business and has good experience in has business. He needs to buy more retail products for his shop, so he wants to take out an individual loan. He wants to succeed in his business and make a good monthly income for his family. He is happy, and he would like to thank both AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more retail products

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the wife of M. A.. She has lived in the city of Borewala, Pakistan, for the last 4 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are in kindergarten (in Pakistan the age at which children start school varies). Her husband is a university graduate who teaches in a school and also has a livestock business. Nasreen baji does domestic chores and sells milk. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her husband to resell.

Nasreen baji is joined in her loan group by a few other members. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy more materials for her grocery shop. Ruqaiya baji wants a loan to buy medicine to resell. Kaneez baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Wahida's Tuache Uvivu Group

texts.en:
Wahida is 34 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 5 months and 14 years old. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Wahida is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with clothes sales, bites sales, fish and juice sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Sulton

texts.ru: Курбонов Султон кредитор Микроинвеста , с 2007 года по сей день. Первый займ он брал для покупки телевизора и подставки под него, для своего дома , как потребительский займ.Удачно без проблемно погасив его он решил повторно получить кредит. Следующий займ он планирует потратить на покупку мелкорогатого скота.Он объяснил , что в дальнейшем сезонн для откорма скота и его продажи, поэтому он хочет увеличить численность своего скота. Султон очень любит заниматься уходом за баранами.Сейчас у него дома 6 баранов.Султон Курбоновблагодарен за поддержку  KIVA  процветания в их деятельности.
texts.en:
Sulton K. has been a customer of MicroInvest from 2007 to the present. The first loan he took out was a consumer loan to buy a television set and stand for his home. Having successfully repaid it without problem, he decided to once again obtain a loan. He plans to spend his next loan on the purchase of small livestock, sheep and goats. He explained he wants to increase the size of his flock to fatten next season for sale. Sulton really loves caring for sheep. At present he has six in his flock. Sulton K. is grateful that Kiva supports the well-being of his business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening of livestock

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en: Fatma is 24 years old and married with no children. She has been selling charcoal in Zanzibar since 2007. Charcoal is a staple in households throughout Tanzania as it is still the most common method of food preparation in the country. As a result, there is a large market for charcoal in Zanzibar. Fatma is currently able to earn approximately $25 per month through her charcoal sales but she is hoping that this loan will allow her to increase her inventory and expand her business.

loans.use: Fatma would like to buy more charcoal to resell as her business.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng C., 28, is married and lives with her two children in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, making less than US$1 each day, while her husband works as a police officer. Her husband makes about US$1 each day. They also support an older mother at home. Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gone out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also been a factor in making the price of rice very high.

Heng C. is asking for a loan of US$300 to add to her grocery inventory. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To add to her grocery inventory.

loans.name: Sharifan Riasat Ali Group

texts.en:
Sharifan Baji ("baji" is an honorific meaning older sister) is a group leader of a few women in her locality. Irshad Baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her animal selling business. Asghari Baji wants a loan to buy an embroidery machine for her business. Sugran Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nasreen Baji wants a loan to repair her truck.  

Sharifan Baji is a 42-year-old lady who resides in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 25 years. Her husband name is R. A. who is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

She has five children: four sons and one daughter. Her eldest son completed his education to the 8th grade and works in a factory. The next oldest is a driver and also drives an auto-rickshaw. The next younger son is studying in 7th grade and her youngest son is in 5th grade. Her daughter makes embroidered dresses and also does household tasks. 

Sharifan Baji is a very responsible woman and performs her duties very efficiently. She also handles her decorative embroidery business which she started 15 years back. Now she has became expert in this business. She makes embroidered dresses and sells them in big clothing shops. She charges 1,500 Pak Rupees per dress. She is saving her income for her children’s education and for her daughter’s marriage. 

She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (Kiva's microfinance institution partner in Pakistan). Now, she is applying for a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 51-year-old married woman with three children, living in Old Saida, southern Lebanon. She owns a small shop, where she sells cloth and gadgets to people in the surrounding neighborhoods. Sabah wants to buy cloth for a very good price, in order to increase her profit, therefore she is asking to borrow US$ 1,200.

loans.use: Buy cloth for re-sale

loans.name: Damaris Del Scorro

texts.es:
La Señora Damaris del Socorro M. Sánchez tiene la edad de 34 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Damaris solo tiene 1 hijo de la edad de 5 años y cursa el 1 grado de primaria, sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio activo ya que su negocio es el medio que utiliza ganarse la vida, su deseos son de que Dios le siga prestando mas vida porque tiene que velar por su hijo quien todavía esta muy pequeño y además tiene quiere que aprenda a desenvolverse ante cualquier situación que se le presente para que día de mañana pueda ser un hombre de bien que sirva para la sociedad, sus sueños son de establecer una tienda de venta de mercadería en general debido a que en las cercanías de su vivienda no existe ningún tipo de negocio y esto seria una gran ventaja para ella ya que así podría obtener clientela y además serian sus principales ingresos y a la misma ves podría cuidar a su hijo en su vivienda ya que tiene 2 trabajos trabaja como docente en una universidad y en un instituto por lo que su otro medio de trabajo es la venta de mercadería en general que la distribuye de forma ambulante.  

La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante ya que su mercadería es ofrecida a sus vecinos, amigos y algunos estudiantes, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 4 años, Doña Damaris dio inicio a esta actividad por la necesidad de generar mas ingresos para su familia ya que tenia que responsabilizarse por su hijo y por su Mama ya que el salario de docencia que poseía no era muy alto y decide involucrarse en el negocio de la mercadería en general  y da sus inicios con poco productos como: ropa, perfumes y cosméticos por lo que recurre a las casas comerciales como Avon y Oriflame por lo que al principio fue muy difícil obtener la venta de los productos ya que no poseía la experiencia que necesitaba para ofrecer los productos y recurre a sus amigas para que ellas pudieran instruirlas en ofertar el producto mas tarde logra captar lo necesario y obtiene a sus clientes por lo que además el tiempo que poseía no le permitía pasar mucho tiempo con sus clientes pero su interés por este negocio le ayudo, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita comprar productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Damaris del Socorro M. Sánchez, 34, is a single mother of a 5-year-old son, who is in the first grade. She hopes to make her business business grow to support her family and to live a long life to care for her child, and raise him to be a productive man. Damaris would love to open a small grocery store in her home, to be able to care for her son while tending her business. There is no other store in the area, so opening one would be a good business move. She believes that she would not have to work two jobs as she does now (as a teacher and selling merchandise on the street). Damaris' business is the sale of general merchandise. She offers her products to family, friends and neighbors. She started 4 years ago, urged by the need to support her child and help out her mother. She began selling Avon and Oriflame products, and with the help of friends she learned the business and established a customer base. The loan she is requesting will be used a work capital, to purchase more products to satisfy her customers' demand.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en: Hilario P., 43 years of age, married, is a resident of Kiburiao, Quezon, Bukidnon .He is an active entrepreneur for a long time. He started his business after he inherited some inventory from his parents.  Since then, the business gradually increased  with the help of HSPFI as business partner.  He needs a loan of P20,000 to purchase stocks in volume to avail more discounts from his suppliers.  Mr. P. wants to expand his business from being retailer to being a wholesaler in the village.

loans.use: To purchase volume of stocks for sale

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.en:
P. Ravshan grows wheat and vegetables. He is 46 years old and has four children. Before he worked as a driver. He was not happy with his previous job because he received little compensation for his work. So he went back to his village and decided to manage his small farm. In the year 2000, he started managing his farm. He uses his harvest to buy the things his family needs and to help send his children to school. Ravshan is asking for a loan of 3500 Somoni. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and other farm inputs. The loan will help him increase his yield and improve his living conditions.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.
