In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Homid

texts.ru: Хайдаров Хомид мужчина , который торгует на рынке сахаром и конфетами. Для увеличения товара он решил получить параллельный займ. Сейчас поступил дешёвый сахар, который и хочет закупить Хомид. Он говорит, что через месяц в сезон варенья сахар подоражает,и ему будет выгодно его продать.
texts.en:
Homid H. is a man who sells sugar and candy at the market. In order to increase his stock he decided to take out a parallel loan. Right now cheap sugar is available and Homid would like to purchase it. He says that jam season will start in a month and sugar will become more expensive, making it profitable for him to sell it.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar for sale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy A. is 56 years old. She is married and has eight children. Two of her children are in school, three are working and, unfortunately, she has lost three of them. She owns and operates a grocery shop in her neighborhood and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, and biscuits. Mercy has been selling grocery items for the past twenty years to take care of the family. She has no regrets about what she does but her only challenge is having enough funds to buy more raw materials. She takes delivery of stock from Akim Oda and retails to her customers. She therefore requests a loan. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, and other items to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. She also sells cooked rice with stew in addition to the grocery business. Mercy belongs to a village bank called 1st Kings.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her grocery store

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en: Lhamsuren B. is a 29 year old single mother. Her only daughter, Hongorzul, is 6 and attends an elementary school. Her family lives in a rented home in a "ger" (traditional nomadic tent) district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2007, she started running a children's clothes stall at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. She used to run a retail business of buying and selling raw materials. With her previous business profits, she bought a stall at the Narantuul market and started her clothing business. Once a month she goes to Ereen, a Chinese border city, to buy children's clothes at wholesale prices. Lhamsuren requests a loan to purchase summer clothes to increase her business inventory. Her hope is to have her own place to live.

loans.use: To purchase summer clothes.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
J. Dilshod has a minivan and provides transportation services. He has 3 years of exerience in this business. Initially he rented a car, but after saving, he bought his own minivan. The business is stable and generates the main and considerable income for Dilshod’s family, improving their living conditions. Currently his minivan needs some repairs. He needs a loan of $800 USD to purchase the spare parts. Dilshod thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan with accuracy. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase parts to repair his minivan.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en:
A. Inobat is married and has two grown children. She owns a little place at the central market in the town of Isfara where she sells various types of clothing. Some of the advantages of her business are variety, consistency, and affordable prices. Inobat has been working in this business for ten years. She is always seeking to grow and develop her business, and improve her entrepreneurial skills. Currently, Inobat is requesting a loan of 3500 TJS to purchase more goods for the summer season. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s financial situation.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell for the summer season

loans.name: Zuhair

texts.en:
Zuhair is 31 years old and single. He owns a small computer repair shop in Ramallah, Palestine, where he specializes in computer sales, CD writing, typesetting, and computer repairs.

Zuhair is seeking this loan in order to purchase new and used computers and computer spare parts. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new and used computers and computer parts

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
S. Zamira is a very hard-working and enthusiastic girl. Because the small salary her parents receive was not sufficient to cover all the family's basic expenses, she decided to start her own business selling perfumes and cosmetics. Little by little, she gained more clients and increased her sales. Her wish to provide for her family and improve her living is what motivates her each day to improve and grow her business.

Zamira needs a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase merchandise and continue growing her business. She hopes you will want to play an important role in her business' growth and in the life of her family, and she thanks you for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy goods to increase the range of goods that she sells

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Va M. is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Vaiusu T.  She is married and has 0 school-aged children.  To make a living, Va owns and operates a handicraft business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling traditional handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Va has been engaged in this business for more than 2 years.

Va joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Va has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD.  Va is now requesting a new loan of 1100 WST, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Va plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Mujeres Con Suenos Y Metas Group 1, 2 & 3

texts.en:
Amada is the group coordinator and president of Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Mujeres Con Sueños y Metas (Women with Dream and Goals) which is starting its first loan cycle with Esperanza. She resides in the Northern slums of Santo Domingo, an area where both electricity and water services (none of which is potable) are unreliable. In addition she shares her small house with seven other individuals including her husband and three children. 

With this loan she hopes to open her own butcher shop to serve her community. She intends to put the profits she gains from the butcher shop  towards imporving her home, seeing her children educated to become professionals and finally towards her own education. Amadas long term dream is to study family psychology and she is hoping that with the new income from her butcher shop she will be able to see her dreams fulfilled. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Opening her own butcher shop

loans.name: Achraf

texts.en: Achraf is a 37-year-old married man who lives with his wife and 2 children. In 2008, he opened his own own dry cleaning shop and named it "Mister Clean." Today, Achraf is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase two additional washing machines and a dryer.

loans.use: To purchase two additional washing machines and a dryer

loans.name: Andir

texts.en:
Andir G. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell.  Andir is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman. She has seven children who attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to set up a charcoal burning business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ena

texts.es:
Ena, de 38 años, vive con su esposo (comerciante) y su pequeño hijo que cursa estudios primarios, la casa que habitan es propia. Ella cuenta con un pequeño kiosco dentro de las instalaciones de una institución educativa, donde vende comida, refrescos y golosinas sólo por las mañanas, esta actividad que la viene ejerciendo desde hace 4 años. Adicionalmente, por las tardes y en sus ratos libres se dedica a la venta de medicinas naturales de una marca reconocida en su ciudad y debido a su buen desempeño ascendió de supervisora y capacitadora, por lo que se siente muy satisfecha con sus labores. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sentirse una persona útil, además que le es muy  rentable porque cuenta con clientes estables y sus ingresos son buenos. Para el futuro le gustaría tener su propio restaurante. 

Ya tiene 5 préstamos con MFP y lo que le gusta de su grupo es que entre todos se apoyan, son comunicativos y muy responsables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará comestibles para su negocio de venta de comida, también productos de medicina naturales para tener en stock.
texts.en:
Ena, 38, lives with her husband (a businessman) and their small child who is in elementary school. The house they live in is their own. She has a small kiosk in one of the installations of an educational institution. She sells food, soft drinks, and sweets only in the mornings. She has been doing this for four years. Additionally, in the afternoons and her free time she sells brand name natural medicines. Due to her performance she rose to become a supervisor and trainer. She feels very satisfied with her work. What she likes best about her work is feeling like a useful person. Also, it is very profitable for her because she has established customers and her earnings are good. In the future she would like to have her own restaurant. She has had five loans with MFP. What she likes about her group is that they support each other, are communicative, and are very responsible. She will use the money she is asking for to buy groceries for her business of selling food. She will also buy natural medicines to have in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food

loans.name: Muritala

texts.en: Muritala is 35-years old and married with two children. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. Muritala has been selling medicine for the past ten years. He says, "I like my business, because I love to save lives." He is requesting a loan of $675 so he can purchase more inventory and service more customers. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Hilian Ernec

texts.es: Hilian Ernec C. Mejía de 35 años de edad, reside en Colón en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos. Hilian posee una panadería desde hace ocho años negocio el cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco. El solícita un préstamo a través del cuál el pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración del pan, así mismo desea poder comprar utensilios los cuales se utilizan para hornear el pan. Hiliac es una persona muy trabajadora la cual ha enseñado a sus hijos el valor del trabajo y es por esto que desea seguir creciendo en el negocio y poder brindarles una vida mejor a sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Hilian Emec C. Mejia is 35 years old and lives in Colón in the La Libertad neighborhood. He lives with his wife and 2 children. He has run a bakery for 8 years, which has been growing. He requests a loan so that he can purchase more raw materials to make more bread, and purchase enamelware to bake the bread. Hiliac is a hardworking person who has shown his children the value of work, and because of this he wants to continue to build his business to be able to give his children and wife a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw materials to make bread

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 32 years old. She sells kitchen utensils such as pots, stoves, cutlery, etc. She is married to an electrician who does all kinds of electrical work like the wiring of houses, repairs of electrical appliances, and other electrical work.  They both have three kids.

Victoria is a reliable member of LAPO Microfinance. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell to make more profit so she can support her family by providing the basic necessities of life and give them a good education. Thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa M., age 68, is a loving mother to her two children. Even though her children are now 33 and 25 years old, she still wants to support them financially, because they are day-laborers (not salaried) and their small income is sporadic. Ninfa wishes that, some day, her children’s lives will be stable and they will have their own families. 

When Ninfa learned about ASHI, a Kiva field partner in the Philippines, she thought that it would be a good source of capital to start her own business and  to achieve her dreams for herself and children. After she was recognized as a member of ASHI, she requested a loan and started a small “sari-sari" (variety) store. However, when she finished repaying her loan, she changed her business to rice farming. Since it was the season for planting rice, she though it would be best to invest her money there, because the profit is as much larger than the profit from her sari-sari store. Her eldest son is her partner in managing her rice farm. 

However, Ninfa wanted to restart her sari-sari store to bring the convenience of a small grocery store to people in her village. Her village is very far from the main town and is almost inaccessible, because it lacks transportation and other public facilities. Ninfa is now requesting a loan to restart her sari-sari store. She hopes that her sari-sari business will succeed.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is a client of Asociación Arariwa. He is member of a communal bank consisting of twenty members in Cusco. The group is called Las Hijas de Maria (“Mary’s Daughters”).

Fernando is a graphics and Web designer and in the past two years has also begun renting out the lower level of his home to commercial tenants. Due to some recent medical expenses, Fernando has been unable to pay for all the required maintenance and improvements of his rental property. He is therefore requesting a loan to be able to meet all his obligations as a landlord. He hopes in the future to be able to further improve the property and attract higher rents.

Fernando appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of his rental property

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma K. is an entrepreneur and a married woman with two children in school. She runs a food shop in the Yombo Kiwalan Ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells varieties of good food, including rice, maize flour, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She has been in the business for five years. 

Salma purchases the business goods from the city market business center and sometimes directly from wholesale suppliers. She managed to double her capital from the initial funding of T.shs 500,000 to 1,000,000 T.shs. She needs a loan of T.shs 1, 000, 0000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Susan Wanjiku

texts.en:
Susan Wanjiku is a 70-year-old lady who is married to Charles, and they are both farmers. Susan has been doing small-scale farming for the past 38 years. She has planted crops like maize, beans and bananas, but she specializes in dairy farming.

She was introduced to Kadet by an existing client and she plans to expand her dairy farming business with the loan for which she has applied. Susan intends to purchase another dairy cow to boost her farming business. 

Susan hopes to become a famous dairy farmer in her district and she describes herself as a hardworking farmer.

loans.use: To expand her dairy farming project

loans.name: Chrin

texts.en: Mrs. Chrin S. was born in 1978 and now she lives in Trapeang Khlout village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and she owns a small plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn an income. Her husband, Mr. Chear Yim, is a laborer. Even though they have different careers, they do not make enough money to support their living conditions. Therefore, Mrs. Chrin S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase two cows for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living situation with this loan. She is the mother of three children who are enrolled in the local public school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase two cows for breeding

loans.name: Cecil Mariela

texts.es:
La señora Cecil Mariela A. P., tiene 28 años de edad, vive en el barrio lomas de Guadalupe, es casada y juntos se apoyan con los gastos del hogar, él señor trabaja como supervisor y ella como inspectora de calidad, ambos laboran en zonas francas, ellos tienen 3 hijos.

Dentro de las necesidades más primordiales que tienen como familia, esta la remodelación de su hogar para esto ellos solicitan un préstamo para el cambio de techo de la vivienda, debido a que se encuentra en pésimo estado y amenaza con la inseguridad familiar, con este apoyo económico esperan mejorar sus condiciones de vida que favorezcan  toda la familia, sobre todo a los hijos menores que son los que habitan todo el tiempo en el hogar.
texts.en:
Cecil Mariela A. P., 28, lives in the Lomas de Guadalupe neighborhood. She is married, and she and her husband jointly support the household. He works as a supervisor and she is a quality control inspector. They both work in the free trade zone. They have 3 children. Among the most basic needs that the family has is the renovation of their home. To do this they are requesting a loan to replace the roof of their house, since it is in terrible shape and threatens the security of the family. With this economic support they hope to improve the living conditions of the entire family, most of all for their young children who spend much of their time in the home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to replace the roof of their home

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr: Sophie S. Est âgée de 41 ans, elle est mariée sans enfants mais tutrice de 6 enfants qui lui sont confiés par des parents et/ou proches. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAMAKHEUL depuis 7 ans et a 14 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et son prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité par l'achat de 15 moutons, de les engraisser et revendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Elle participe à l'amélioration de conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sophie S. is 41 years old. She is married and has no children of her own, but she is the guardian of six children who have been entrusted to her care by relatives and/or close friends. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in DIAMAKHEUL for seven years and has had 14 consecutive loans; she has never had any problem repaying these. She has a sheep fattening activity, and her loan will allow her to develop her business by purchasing 15 sheep, fattening them up and selling them after four to five months at weekly markets in her town. She is contributing to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Tamaraneh Traders Group

texts.en:
Rugiatu S. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Sanda village, 32 years ago. She is married to a welder and the couple has three children: two are in primary school and the other is a baby.

For three years now, Rugiatu has been selling cooked rice, meat, fish and vegetables in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone.

This is first loan that Rugiatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Rugiatu will use her SLL 500,000 share of the loan to buy cooking materials like rice, palm-oil, fish, etc. wholesale.

loans.use: To buy cooking materials like rice, palm-oil, fish, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Roy

texts.es: Roy V. A., tiene la edad de 28 años, está en unión libre, y vive con su esposa. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Roy también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Roy V. A. is 28 years old and lives in a common law marriage with his wife. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase manure and fertilizer for his coffee crop. He hopes to give his coffee crop the adequate maintenance so that he can obtain the best quality and be able to obtain the most profits possible at harvest. This is the first time he has obtained a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the facilities they have provided him. Roy has also been farming for many years. He hopes in the future to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability and to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase manure and fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
ZORAIDA
Hace muchos años la Sra. Zoraida apertura un restaurant en un pequeño local el cual con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pudo adquirirlo, pero vio la necesidad de tener su propia casa así que con sus ingresos compro un terreno y pudo construirlo ahora alquila su restaurant y en su casa tiene una pequeña tienda que la ayuda a pagar los estudios de sus hijos y los gastos en casa. Ella está muy contenta y agradecida con EDAPROSPO y KIVA  por los préstamos recibidos. Seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
ZORAIDA Many years ago Zoraida opened a restaurant in a small place. She was able to get it with much effort and dedication. But, she saw the necessity of having her own house. She used her earnings to buy a piece of land, and she was able to build it. Now she rents her restaurant. She has a small store in her house, which helps her pay for her children’s education and the household expenses. She is very happy with and grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva for the loans she has received. EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Groupe 3 De Djekafo Togo

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe 3 de l’association Djekafo de Togo sont des femmes mariées dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Togo dans la commune rurale de Sakoïba dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs superficies culturales et de cultiver d’autres spéculations en plus du mil pendant l’hivernage, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. 
Les membres du groupe vont cultiver le mil, l’arachide et le niébé (haricot).
Madame Fatoumata  Coumaré compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 50kg de grains d’arachide de semence et recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour et de désherbage pour son champ d’arachide. 
Elle se ravitaille en semences à la foire de Konodimini. 
Exploitant une superficie de 2 hectares, elle espère produire 400kg de niébé, 10 sacs d’arachide et des fanes de niébé destinées à faire des bottes. 
Les bottes de niébé sont stockées et vendues pendant la période de soudure. 
Une partie de la récolte est auto consommée tandis que l’autre moitié est stockée et vendue petit à petit pour gérer les petites dépenses du foyer au quotidien.  
Madame Fatoumata  Coumaré à l’image des autres femmes du groupe a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans leurs foyers.
texts.en:
The five members of Group 3 of the association Djekafo of Togo are married women in large traditional families.  The women average 38 years of age and three children each and all live in the village of Togo, in the rural community of Sakoïba, region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through ties of kinship, marriage, and community.  With the goal of expanding their cultivated acreage and growing other crops in addition to millet over the wintertime, the group members turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second farm loan cycle.  They are going to grow millet, peanuts, and niébé(black-eyed peas). Ms. Fatoumata Coumaré intends to use her loan for buying 50 kg of peanut seeds and recruiting laborers for plowing and weeding the peanut field.  She gets her supplies of seeds at the Konodimini fair.  Working an area of two hectares, she hope to produce 200 kg of niébé, ten sacks of peanuts, and some niébé stems to be baled.  The bales of stems are stocked and then sold during periods of shortages. Part of the harvest is consumed at home, while the other part is stocked and sold a little at a time in order to manage the day-to-day expenses of the household.  Ms. Fatoumata Coumaré, like the other women in the group, has the goal of being self-sufficient in food for their households.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying peanut seeds and paying for field hands

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: madame T. ama est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de Attiégou qui est un quartier périphériques de la ville de lomé. en 2000 elle a débuté le commerce de chaussures, elle a associé plus tard à ce commerce la vente de sacs de sortie pour dame ce qui lui a permis d'accroître ses revenus. elle sollicite chez WAGES son premier prêt pour s'approvisionner avec une vingtaine de chaussures et une quinzaine de sacs pour dame.
texts.en:
Mrs. T. Ama is married and a mother of 3. She lives in Attiégou, a neigbourhood just outside of Lomé. She started a shoe business in 2000. She later started selling handbags, which has allowed her to increase her revenue. She is requesting her first WAGES loan to stock up on 20 pairs of shoes and 15 handbags.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes and handbags

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy J. is from the town of Banga. He is 45 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Judy grows corn for sale. Just like most entrepreneurs, Judy also wants to be successful and increase his income. Judy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judy has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Judy is requesting his fourth loan, for 12000 PHP, to purchase fertilizer and other farming needs.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farming needs.

loans.name: Rosa Irene

texts.es:
Rosa de 36 años, ella tiene una papelería en el Ecuador se les llama “bazar” y vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Ella comenzó hace 10 años vendiendo laminas y cuadernos, y con la motivación de tener que mantener a su hijo tuvo que continuar trabajando ya que esta divorciada. Ella ahora trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm en su propio negocio. Una de las dificultades es la falta de tiempo y la delincuencia que ahora hay en el sector. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, cemento y pinturas para remodelar la papelería, en el futuro quiere construir su casa de dos pisos y tener mas surtida su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old and has a paper goods store, which are called “bazaars” in Ecuador. She lives in the Guasmo section of Guayaquil (an urban area where the majority of residents are merchants). She started 10 years ago selling laminated school sheets and notebooks, motivated by the need to support her son since she is divorced. She now works from 7:00 am to 11:00 pm at her own business. Some of the difficulties she faces are lack of time and the delinquency that now exists in the area. She wants to use the loan to buy notebooks, as well as cement and paint to remodel her store. In the future, she hopes to add a second floor to her home and to better supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, paints.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda;  La socia tiene 41 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos,  La socia se dedica a confeccionar diferentes trajes para damas, caballeros y niños La socia trabaja desde hace 20 años haciendo corte y confección. La socia necesita comprar telas, hilos y botones.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para elaborar trajes de vestir. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This community bank member belongs to the community bank "Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastian," which is located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco. She is Sra. Hilda, who is 41 years old. She is married and has four children. She works making various articles of clothing for women, men, and children. She has worked for 20 years doing tailoring and making alterations. She needs to buy fabric, thread, and buttons. She is applying for the loan to invest in the purchase of supplies to make articles of clothing. She is grateful for and values the loans granted through this means and at the same time promises to make all her payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to make clothing

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is from the village of Purok 2 Bolibol, Oroquieta City . She is 49 years old. Gloria  is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Gloria  owns  & operates a retail store (Sari-sari store). Gloria has been in this business for about 10 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for this activity.

 In 2007, Gloria  joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria  has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC amounting to PHP 6,000. Gloria  is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for her Sari-Sari Store. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Gloria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her retail business (SariSari Store)

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie D. is 38 years old, married and has two children. She is from the town of Banga in South Cotabato province on the Mindanao islands. She is involved in farming but also opened an eatery four years ago. While her husband mainly focuses on the farm, she cooks the food that she sells at her eatery. She also helps sell their harvest. She said she loves farming, but she has to think of ways to improve their family income.

Rosenie joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. Rosenie successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rosenie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and invest in her eatery. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and invest in her eatery

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab I. is a 30 year old married lady with two children. 

She operates Fried Potatoes in Kenyatta avenue Street in Malindi. The lady was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the company’s clients. She is now getting a third loan for Kshs 15,000, with which she plans to expand her business by buying more stock and venture into selling fresh juice as well. 

Zainab hopes that, by doing this, her business will grow and she will be able to use the anticipated profit to help support her family.  She hopes to someday own a well established restaurant in the area.

loans.use: To buy more stock food items like cooking oil , and venture into selling fresh juice

loans.name: Diostita

texts.en:
Diostita is a hard-working mother who offers tricycle transportation to earn a living. (Her tricycle is a motorcycle with sidecar.) This is much more expensive than a tri-bike but the owners make a bigger income. Her supportive husband, Reynaldo, is a driver and manages their transport business. Diostita and Reynaldo offer good service to people in their village. She appreciates that the organization has helped her improve her business and her quality of life.

Diostita has requested a loan of 15,000 Php for the maintenance of their tricycle including needed spare parts. She hopes to buy another tricycle in the future for more work. Diostita is hoping that her transport business will help her with the financial needs of her family and support her grand childrens' education so that they are able to move forward out of poverty. She positively believes their lives can be changed.

loans.use: to buy needed spare parts for her tricycle

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband.  With the loan, he will buy construction supplies such as bricks, cement and sand in bulk quantity to improve the sales of his construction supply business.  He has a good clientele base who prefers to give him orders because of his quality items.
  
Naseem is 52 years old, mother of a son who is a graduate (14th Level) and works in a hospital on monthly wages. To financially support her family, Naseem does embroidery works. She has contracts with different boutiques, to whom she provides the finished products to get a good income.
  
She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and she is very confident that taking a loan will be a good decision for her family which will benefit her husband and family on a long term basis. She lives in the city Lahore which is famous for its culture and history.  There, she owns a two room house where she has been living with her family for over 25 years.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for a construction supply sales business.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is 38 years old. She lives in the village of Locute in the district of Tambogrande. It is primarily a rural area with many small fruit farms and individuals who raise animals. Guadalupe lives with her husband and their three children in a home they own.

Guadalupe raises animals in the yard behind their home. She raises pigs, chickens, and ducks. These are all animals that can be raised in relatively small spaces within corrals. Guadalupe's husband owns a small plot of land on which he raises vegetables. He sells the vegetables himself in the local markets at retail prices.

The requested loan will be invested in additional feed for the animals. Guadalupe hopes to be able to fatten her animals up a bit more before the holiday season in order to take advantage of the better prices during the season. She has a good credit history and is well-respected in the community. Her primary goal is to provide greater opportunities and an education for her children.

loans.use: Additional feed for the animals

loans.name: Damarys Eugenia

texts.es:
Damarys Eugenia B. C.  tiene 35 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el cantón  Ventanas en la Provincia de los ríos.  Tiene 2  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS VENCEREMOS  se encuentra ubicada a pocos minutos de la Oficina Ventanas en el recinto la América , perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Damarys Eugenia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, Agro insumos Karlita y Comercial Jiménez y los vende en la feria en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandu. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una finca.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Damarys Eugenia B. C. is 35 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children. She lives in the Ventanas canton in the province of  Los Ríos. She has 2 children.  

The members of the rural community bank UNIDOS VENCEREMOS  [Together we will Win] are a few minutes from the Ventanas Office in the community of  La América, which belongs to the Ventanas canton. This bank is dedictaed to short cycle agricultural work such as corn, rice and lima beans. They have been doing this for a long time.   

Damarys Eugenia works in agriculture. She has grown corn, rice, and lima beans for 2 years. She buys her products from Agripac, Agro Insumos Karlita, and Comercial Jiménez. She sells in the market of the same community.   

She is asking for the loan to buy agricultural materials and fertilizers to grow corn, rice and lima beans. The support of the loan would help her to meet her needs financially. She faces challenges such as pests and diseases and weather variation. Her dream is to buy a farm. 

She likes sports.

loans.use: Agricultural materials and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old single man. He is from Lebanon. He works in the agriculture field, having operated a dairy product sales business for eight years. He works independently in his business and he lives on his own. 

He has been practicing dairy farming since 2006. Most of his customers are people from his area. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to purchase a cow in order to increase his productivity.  He is a very hard-working person.  This sale will increase his working capital for his dairy business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn T. is from the village of Sinian, Cobungan. She is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Emelyn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of fresh ocean-caught fish in the local community. Emelyn has been engaged in her business for more than 12 years and earns approximately 3,100 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2004, Emelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing materials. Emelyn is requesting fourth loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for the business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es transportista publico;  está casado, tiene dos hijos de 16 y 10 años respectivamente y vive en su casa propia ubicada en la zona Villa Huayna Potosí de la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito será utilizado para la compra de equipo de GNV (gas Natural Vehicular) para la transformación de Gasolina a GNV para su movilidad. De esta manera abaratará los costos de combustible en por lo menos un 40% y mejorará sus ingresos.

 Es el primer crédito con IMPRO y el primero via Kiva.
texts.en:
Antonio is a public transporter. He is married, has 2 children, 16 and 10 years of age respectively, and lives in his own house, located in the Villa Huayna Potosi zone of the city of El Alto.

His loan will be used for buying equipment from BNV (Vehicular Natural Gas) to transform his vehicle from gasoline to natural gas as a new source of power. In this way, he will save on fuel costs by at least 40% and also, improve his income.

This is his first loan with IMPRO and also, his first via Kiva.

loans.use: TO PAY THE COST OF EQUIPMENT AND CONVERTING HIS PASSENGER TRANSPORTATION VEHICLE FROM GAS TO NATURAL GAS

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.en:
The Committee Mujeres Alegres from San Ignacio, Misiones, is dedicated to raising chickens. With this 2nd level loan, they expect to be working together and helping one another to improve their quality of life and their families.

Mrs. Carolina A. is undertaking the business of raising chickens, so credit needs to be available to provide all the necessary supplies, such as food for the chicks and materials to build the corral. She wants to progress and get her family out of poverty.

loans.use: Buying chicks, chicken feed and veterinary drugs.

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Chan Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fourteen people make up this village bank loan based in Prey Kuy village in Takeo province. They will each use their portion of the loan in various ways to improve their families' standard of living. Mrs. Mom C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sorn Bak, is a construction worker. They support four children, three of whom are seamstresS. in garment factories while the other is a student. Recently, she has a problem because her house is not comfortable for living. To improve this condition, Mrs. Mom C. is applying for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena is a member of Sarita communal bank at FINCA Peru. She is 40 years old and has four children who are in school. She sells kitchenware in a local market. She also sells school supplies. She intends to use her current loan of 1,000 PEN to purchase school supplies to sell. Magdalena would like her children to continue studying and become professionals. She would also like to use her savings to buy her own house one day.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies to sell

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria A. R. tiene 21 años, Es soltera con el  hijo en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Luz Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es casarse y vivir en otra ciudad.

Le gusta salir a pasear y las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Luz Maria A. R. is 21 years old.  She is single and has one child.  They live in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province.

The members of the Mujeres Mushuc Ñan Communal Bank are located in the Guanto Cruz community, Guanujo parish, Guaranda canton.  This communal bank has 22 women who are farmers.  They grow blackberries and corn and raise poultry.  They raise dairy cows to make cheese.

Luz Maria plants blackberries and corn and raises poultry.  She buys her products in Guaranda and sells them at the fair in Guaranda.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies, animals to raise, and feed for the animals.  The support of the loan will help her financially to get her necessities.  She faces challenges like pests, diseases, and weather changes.

Her dream is to get married and to live in another city.

She likes to take walks, and she likes the festivities at Carnaval.

loans.use: to get supplies, animals to raise, and feed for the animals

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dry goods business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her dry goods business.

Marissa has been in this business for 9 years. She earns more income from cosmetics sales.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell

loans.name: Gladys Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Cristina tiene 22 años, es madre soltera y viven ella y su hija en la casa de sus padres en el Barrio Jardín de la ciudad de Encarnación.
Tiene un puesto de venta de termos y juguetes en la terminal de ómnibus de Encarnación, con más de 4 años de antigüedad en ese rubro ella se ha destacado laboralmente y ha logrado mantenerse estable y de igual manera a ha sabido cuidar moral y económicamente a su hijita.
Es una persona muy trabajadora y gracias a la actividad que realiza ha podido ir creciendo en su micro-empresa. El destino del crédito que solicita sería realizar compras de más juguetes para la venta.
texts.en:
Gladys Cristina is 22 years old and a single mother who, along with her daughter, lives in her parents’ home in the Jardín section of the city of Encarnación.

She has a post for sales of Thermoses and toys at the bus terminal of Encarnación.  With more than 4 years of experience in the trade, she has stood out work-wise and has managed to maintain stability.  Likewise, she has known how to care for her daughter emotionally and financially.

She is a very hardworking person and, thanks to her activities, has been able to grow her micro-enterprise.  The loan would be destined for buying more toys to offer for sale.

loans.use: buy toys to sell.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: El señor Paulino tiene una tienda de barrio en su domicilio; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería como ser: galletas, refrescos, azúcar, fideos, etc. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona Ernesto Torrez de la ciudad de La Paz; es casado tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Sr. Paulino has a neighborhood store that he operates in his home. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase merchandise such as cookies, soft drinks, sugar, noodles, and other products.

Paulino lives in his own home located in the District of Ernesto Torrez in the city of La Paz. He is married and has two children. This is the first time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to purchase cookies, soft drinks, sugar, noodles, and other products to sell in his store.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 23 years old and married with one infant-aged child. He is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns approximately PHP 6,000 per month. 

Kennedy is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his corn farm. Kennedy has been growing corn for almost three years.

In the future, Kennedy hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn a higher income to support the needs of his family. He hopes that Kiva lenders will continuously assist him in the business so that he can start another kind of business and give his family a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his corn farm

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
Ana Luisa tiene 19 años, es soltera vive con la madre, no tiene hijos vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SANTA ROSA DE AGUA CLARA, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 20 socios es el segundo crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, arroz, maiz y yuca, además se dedican al comercio.

Ana se dedica a la agricultura siembra arroz y maiz en tierras de los padres. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar tierras propias y seguir trebanajdo en la agricultura y tener una familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir con las amigas a conversar.
texts.en:
Ana Luisa is 19 years old, single and lives with her mother.  She doesn't have any children and lives in the precinct of  Agua Clara in the Chillanes canton.  

The communal bank Santa Rosa de Agua Clara is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  It is made up of 20 members and this is the second loan that they have requested from the cooperative.  The members of this bank work in agriculture, growing cocoa, rice, corn and yuca.  They also work in business.  

Ana works in agriculture.  She grows rice and corn on her parent's land.  She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and sells at the Sunday markets in Chillanes.  

This loan will help her purchase agricultural supplies and thereby help to increase her production.  She has faced challenges such as illness among the workers, insects and crop diseases.  Her dream is to buy her own land, to continue working in agriculture and to have a family.  

In her free time she likes to go out with her friends and talk.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Pedro José tiene 41 años, su actividad es la venta de medicina natural. Tiene más de 6 años en su negocio. Es un hombre responsable pues tiene que hacerse cargo de sus 10 hijos a pesar de ser tantos ha logrado superar las dificultades que con ellos ha enfrentado. Todos los días Pedro tiene que tomar un autobús para empezar a vender los productos a sus diferentes clientes que a diario viajan. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pastillas, vitaminas, cremas, pomadas, inyecciones entre otras.
texts.en: Pedro José is 41 years old and his business is selling natural medicines.  He has been in this business for more than six years.  Pedro José is a responsible man as he has to take care of his 10 children.  Although he has a lot of children, he has managed to overcome the difficulties that he has faced.  Every day, Pedro has to catch a bus to start selling his products to his different customers who travel daily.  He will use this loan to buy pills, vitamins, ointments, injections, etc.

loans.use: to buy pills, vitamins, creams, ointments, injections, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia nació en la ciudad de Espinar del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 46 años de edad. Actualmente, Julia vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus cinco hijos. Julia es cocinera y trabajaba en el restaurante turismo “Yanapay” pero tuvo que renunciar. Ahora, Julia piensa abrir un cafetín en la ciudad de Espinar y con el préstamo que pide desea comprar vajillas como por ejemplo platas, tazas y copas. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoq Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Julia was born in Espinar, a town located in the Cusco department, and she is 46 years old. Julia currently lives in the town of Cusco with her five children. Julia is a cook: she used to work in the tourist restaurant “Yanapay” but she had to resing. Julia is now considering opening a small café in Espinar, and she wants to use the loan she is requesting to buy crockery such as silverware, bowls and glasses. She is a responsible and hardworking person, and thanks to these qualities her fellow members invited her to become a member of “Mosoq Killa”, a communal bank of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: To buy silverware, bowls and glasses.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza is a 38-year-old married woman with six children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.She is charged with the responsibility of looking after the family, and her desire is to educate her children up to university. For ten years, she has been selling food. Her major challenge is price fluctuation of agricultural products. Nevertheless, her dream is to own a food store. Tereza needs this loan to buy cassava, maize and millet flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy cassava, millet and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Froilan

texts.en: Froilan is 28 years old and lives in the peaceful village of Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He has one child enrolled in school, and makes a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store which he opened three years ago. He earns PHP 16,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to buy additional groceries to sell to his customers. This is his first loan from GDMPC and he is committed to use it to successfully expand his store and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Feliza Janeth

texts.es:
Feliza  es una madre de 29 años empezó su negocio con un pequeño capital una tienda de abarrotes con nombre "4 Hermanos", trabajo que realiza sola desde la 7H00 am hasta las 19H00 am. En su pequeña tienda ella tiene productos como verduras, arroz, azucar; lo que no se le diciculta al momento de abastecer el negocio ya que son productos fáciles de conseguir y de movilizar, su incoveniente es realmente la movilización ya que su zona es de dificil acceso.Junto a su esposo que labora de guardia de seguridad ella ha procreado  hijos, los cuales tienen 8 6 y 2 años y estudian recién primaria.

Ya que sus niños estan empezando sus estudios ella sabe que le espera un largo camino para educarlos y desea un préstamo para surtir su tienda con arroz, azucar, verduras. Tambien tener mas ingresos y ahorrar y además hacer su casa de cemento y así vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
Feliza is a 29 year old mother, who began her business with a small amount of capital.  She has a grocery store named "4 Hermanos"  ("4 Brothers"), where she works from 7 am to 7 pm.  In her small shop she stocks products such as vegetables, rice, sugar.  It's not difficult at the moment to supply her business, as these products are readily available and easy to obtain.  Her drawback is really distribution as her area is difficult to access.

She has children with her husband, who works as a security guard.  The children are 8, 6 and 2 years old, and they are recently attending primary school.

Since her children are beginning their education, she knows it's going to be a long path to educate them, and she wants a loan to stock her store with rice, sugar, and vegetables.  She will also earn more income and save money, and also make her house from cement and so live in better living conditions with her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and vegetables.

loans.name: Yainkain

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Yainkain.  She is married and has 6 children, aged 24, 22, 17, 12, 7 and 5 years. She has 4 additional dependents who live with her because they are her relatives. She helps with their schooling. In 2005, Yainkain established her business selling foods such as rice, groundnuts and beans, etc. She began her business after she was assisting her mother.  She decided to open her own business which she is operating now.  Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  Yainkain needs a loan in order to buy rice, groundnuts and beans. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000.  In the future, Yainkain plans to complete her building project and to educate her children well.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy local food stuff for her business

loans.name: Manuel Enrique

texts.es:
El  socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El  socio Manuel; tiene 23 años de edad, el socio es soltero; él socio es estudiante de la carrera profesional de Contabilidad en la universidad nacional, el socio  paralelamente a sus estudios trabaja con sus padres en la empresa familiar que ellos tiene, el socio ha estado trabajando con ellos en la empresa y aprendiendo mas de sus carrera en contabilidad llevando las cuentas junto a sus padres, el socio ahora esta independizándose y él mismo desea invertir en su propia empresa, el socio ha ahorrado y junto al crédito que desea obtener por este medio, él pondrá su propia empresa, para la cual requiere implementar con la compra de una computadora para su empresa. él socio estará abocado principalmente al área contable en su empresa. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar una computadora para su empresa.

El  socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Manuel belongs to the “COMUZONE II” communal bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Manuel is 23 and single. He is an accounting student at the national university. On top of his studies he works with his parents in the family business. He has learned about accounting keeping accounts with his father. He is now becoming independent and he wants to invest in his own business. With his savings and this loan, he will start up his own business for which he needs a computer. He will be working in accounting in his new business. He is requesting this loan to purchase a computer.

He is grateful for the support offered and promises to repay his quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase a computer for his business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 43 años y es socia del Banco Comunal "Mujeres Valerosas II“ del distrito Tarapoto en el departamento de San Martín. Està casada y tiene 3 hijos. Su pareja le ayuda en la preparación de la comida que vende por las noches de forma ambulatoria.

Tiene este negocio desde hace 13 años, ella preparan y vende juanes, humitas, pescado asado y muchos platos de la región. 
Con Manuela Ramos lleva trabajando cinco años. 
Con el nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 comprará ollas y una máquina de moler. Su objetivo es que todos sus hijos sean profesionales, como dice... esa es la motivación de su trabajo.

Lo que le gusta de Manuela Ramos es la oportunidad de recibir un préstamo con bajos interes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 and a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Valerosas II" from the Tarapoto District in the department of San Martín.  She is married and has three children.  Her partner helps prepare the food she sells as a food vendor at night.

She has been in business for 13 years, selling "juanes", "humitas", baked fish and many regional dishes.  She has been working with Manuela Ramos for five years.

The new loan in the amount of 800 PEN will be used to by pots and a grinder.  Her goal is for her children to become professionals since, as she says, that is her main reason for working.

What she likes most about Manuela Ramos is the opportunity to receive low-interest loans.

loans.use: To buy pots and a grinder.

loans.name: Mt. Livingstone Group

texts.en:
Said, who is in his late 30s, is married with one child who goes to school. He takes care of his sister who is a widow. He is an electrical repairman.  He works from  8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Said’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use to buy a meter machine and a spanner for his business. His dream is to one day be able to have a bigger workshop.  He will share this loan with his loan group, "Mt. Livingstone", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy a meter machine and a spanner for his electrical repair business.

loans.name: Rosa Juana

texts.es:
Rosa Juana tiene treintainueve años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas  a la siembra de cacao.

Rosa  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao las compras y las ventas de los productos para los cultivos compra en San Juan. Solicita el crédito para poder dar mantenimiento  a  los cultivos de cacao.

El crédito será de mucha ayuda para poder invertir en los cultivos de cacao. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia,  plagas y enfermedades.

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el boly.
texts.en:
Rosa Juana, 39, lives in a common law relationship and has two children.  She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Cevallos” communal bank that’s located in Recinto San Francisco that belongs to San Juan del Pueblo Viejo Parish in Ventanas.  They are cocoa bean farmers.


Rosa Juana is a cocoa bean farmer.  Her purchases and sales take place in San Juan.  She’s asking for a loan to provide crop maintenance to her cocoa beans.  The loan will be of much use to her to be able to invest in her cocoa bean crops.  The challenges she faces are competition, pests and crop diseases.  In her free time she enjoys playing sports, especially volleyball.

loans.use: to provide maintenance for her cocoa bean crops.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is from the village of Panay, Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 26 years old. Miguel is married and has two children. To make a living, Miguel owns & operates transportation services and from this he earns 5,000 PHP per month. He has been doing this work for three years. 

Miguel joined GDMPC in 2007 and he has been a member of  GDMPC for almost 4 years.  Miguel is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase spare parts and repair his vehicle for better usage. 

Miguel plans to improve the general living conditions of his family and his business as well.

loans.use: buy spare parts and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en: Saidi wants a loan to buy a local brew for resell. Age 29, he hails from the Kyenjojo district and is a father of five children between the ages of 1 and 11. He wants to see his children get a good education. Having inherited land from his father, he planted tomatoes from which he accumulated capital to start his current business, which he has been operating for two years.

loans.use: to buy a local brew for resell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
As a responsible mother of five, Leonora needs to work hard to provide for her family. She is a widower and serves as both father and mother to her children in the absence of her spouse. She established a small business to generate an income. 

Leonora sells shoes, slippers and sandals to the people in her neighborhood. During market days in her village (which usually fall on Thursdays), she offers her products at the market where her sales capacity is increased.

Leonora is now asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy additional quantities of slippers, shoes and sandals to sell. She hopes that this loan will be granted to her as it is the only opportunity to progress her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional quantities of slippers, shoes and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama is a married woman, who is 23 years old and has no children.

Miriama owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Miriama needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2011, Miriama joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Miriama's first loan with SPBD. 


*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Youssou

texts.fr: Monsieur Youssou  est un homme marié qui vit au Sénégal  depuis plusieurs années. Il est père de 5 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 3 et 14 ans.  Il est  agent de sécurité  dans un  poste de santé de la localité ou il vit.  En meme temps il pratique la vente d’habits  et de rafraîchissement  au portail de son lieu de travail.  Il a choisi cette activité  de commerce parce qu’il le trouve rentable d’autant plus qu’il a besoin de plus de revenus pour une prise en charge totale des besoins de sa famille. Il est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2011. Il sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de caisses de boissons et de sachets d’eau destinés a la vente. Son  objectif est de développer d’avantage son commerce et accroitre ses bénéfices.
texts.en: Mr. Youssou is a married man who has been living in Senegal for many years. He is the father of five children ranging from three to 14 years of age. Here is a security guard in a healthcare facility in his town. At the same time, he sells clothing and refreshments at the entrance of his work place. He has chosen this business activity because he finds it profitable, given that he needs additional revenues in order to be able to provide for his family’s needs. He has been a member of a branch of U-IMCEC since November 2011. He is seeking a loan of 100,000 West African francs in order by cases of beverages and plastic bags with water for sale. His goal is to grow his business further and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy beverages as well as plastic bags with water for resale

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Lida; Continua con su negocio de compra y venta de verduras, tomates, cebollas, zanahorias, pepinos entre otras verduras llevando a los diferentes pobblados como a Huaypetu que esta en la ceja de selva, la socia desea seguir prosperando para apoyar a sus hijos y para incrementar su negocio y de este modo mejorar su calidad de vida, la socia comprara verduras al por mayor y las llevara a la ceja de selva para distribuir a sus clientes que venderan al poblado, la socia desea invertir en la compra de verduras y en el transporte.
texts.en: Lida continues her business, buying and selling vegetables, tomatoes, onions, carrots, and cucumbers, among other vegetables.  She takes them to different villages like Huaypetu, located in the jungle.  She wants to continue prospering so that she can support her children, continue growing her business, and in this way improve her quality of life.  She buys vegetables in quantity and takes them to the jungle to distribute to her customers who will resell them to the consumers.  She would like to invest in vegetables and transportation.

loans.use: to pay for vegetables and transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken and pigs for commercial rearing.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 44-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan and a mother of five children. She makes pickles and sells olive oil and she is operating from her home.

Sanaa is requesting a loan of 1200 JD to purchase materials needed in making pickles and to purchase olive oil to sell.

Sanaa is looking to rent a plot of land planted with olives trees with an aspiration of purchasing a bigger house that meets her standards.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for making pickles in addition to purchasing olive oil.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
