This is 49 year-old Isatu. She is a widow and has 1 child aged 24 years. She has 2 additional dependents. In 1980, Isatu established her essential drugs (tablets, syrups, pain killers) business. She began her business because she dropped out of school when she became pregnant by her late husband. Her parents asked her to marry him as they thought it was the best decision.  Since her dreams of going to medical school were shattered, she was given some amount of money after given birth, which she used to start selling medication. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about Le 3,585,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Isatu has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy the following medication: Panadol - 1 carton @ Le440,000, ORS - 1 carton @ Le340,000, hot rubs - 4 bundles @ Le150,000, cold rubs - 2 cartons @ Le150,000, dexoranges - 4 carton @ Le220,000 and haemporte - 2 carton @ Le220,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 538,000. In the future, Isatu plans to complete her unfinished building. She felt good as this loan is helping her to improve her business.  She is nervous about the future. She hopes for her adopted children to have a good education.  The loan will serve as another source of income.  

Changes in government policies such as increases in taxes are her problem, but in terms of competition, it is moderate as she only has one competitor in that area.  She serves patients from the nearby hospital and retailers, about 50 people per day.  Her business is popular because she has good customer care and offers a legal business.  Isatu usually buys her drugs in Freetown twice per month using public transport.  She uses some of her profit for the construction of her house and the rest as additional capital for her business.  She is honest and hardworking. Her business is improving and she hopes to acquire more loans to develop her business.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy medication for sale

loans.name: Diego Andres

texts.es:
Diego es una persona muy luchadora que ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, ha logrado tener la fortaleza y las ganas de salir adelante para superar las dificultades y continuar progresando en su vida. Hace aproximadamente 5 años decidió montar su propio taller de confección gracias a que desde muy joven aprendió la actividad, pero en ninguna empresa había podido conseguir empleo ya que sufre de epilepsia; de esta manera podría entonces generar sus propios ingresos y poder garantizar una buena calidad de vida. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos su taller de confecciones ha venido creciendo en gran medida, pues en un principio inició trabajando el solo y ha medida que pasa el tiempo viene contratando bastantes operarias para su taller de confección. Debido a que los pedidos por parte de sus clientes siguen creciendo, Diego busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de comprar una máquina cortadora e insumos necesarios para la confección.
De esta manera su taller podrá seguir creciendo y así podrá seguir garantizando un buen empleo para las personas que tiene trabajando en su taller. Además, Diego tiene el sueño de tener un gran negocio y poder empezar a sacar su línea propia, de modo que siga progresando en su vida y superando sus dificultades.

loans.use: Comprar una máquina cortadora e insumos necesarios para la confección.

loans.name: Adèle's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adèle, celle qui a la main levée sur la photo est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un certain Léonce. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Adèle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de la maison sont assumées par Adèle et son mari. Adèle n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour répondre à ses besoins, Adèle vend des chaussures et des tissus à son domicile et de façon ambulante. Adèle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Adèle ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe, sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des chaussures.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Flora is a 29-year-old entrepreneur and mother of two children. She lives with her parents in Morogoro District, Tanzania. She is a committed Camfed Learner Guide who teaches students life skills studies and self-awareness for at least two and half hours per week. Flora has a business selling charcoal. She started this business in order to solve the challenges faced by her family. She is doing this kind of business because most people in her society use charcoal rather than firewood as a source of energy. 

She uses the profits she obtains through this business to meet the needs of her family. She is now submitting her request for a loan from Kiva in order to build a simple room (store) for selling charcoal and to expand her business. Her vision is to save money for the purpose of sending her children to school.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more clothes for women and children

loans.name: Felana

texts.fr:
Felana a 31 ans, elle est mariée.  Le mari est un agent de sécurité. Le couple a 2 enfants de 2 et 8 ans dont un scolarisé dans une  écoles privée (paiement d’écolage) . 
Felana a exercé l’activité de vente de légumes depuis 8 années.  C’est une activité héritée de ses parents. Le point de vente se situe à l’un des marchés de la capitale. Le marché est sûr. La vente dépend de la qualité, la quantité  et de la diversification des produits. Elle est à son deuxième prêt  pour augmenter le stock des produits. 
Le couple ne paie pas de loyer car la famille habite dans une maison appartenant aux parents mais prévoit d’acquérir un terrain et construire une maison pour être autonome.

loans.use: acheter différentes sortes de légumes

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.en:
Wilmer is a butcher and owns a small stand where he sells beef. His father taught him the family trade over 35 years ago and had him help him in his shop. Wilmer eventually started his own business but about 8 years ago his store caught on fire and he has not been able to buy a new place to sell from. Therefore, Wilmer has been selling meat from a table and a stand that he made himself. He is need of a loan so that he may begin to buy different kinds of meats including poultry and fish. He wants to increase his revenue so he can save money for a new store. His goal is to increase his profits and buy a new refrigerator for leftover meats. For the time being he can only buy amounts he knows he will sell because he does not have sufficient storage for leftovers. He believes that having the flexibility to generate more revenue he will eventually be able to have a store of his own again and he will be able to provide a better living to his three children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a larger variety of meats including poultry and fish

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa owns a business where she sells clothes and makeup. She has been working on this line for 5 years. Since she was young she has been dedicated to sales in order to bring some income to the family. Slowly she has raised some money that can be used for the week. She visits some zones where she knows sales will be secure. She delivers on credit and registers what is collected in her book and collects each week. From Thursday to Sunday, she does her run in the afternoon. Thanks to her income and her husbands they have been able to buy goods such as her house. She needs the loan to order and buy seasonal clothing, perfumes and makeup. Narcisa was born in Guayaquil and is 42 years old. She has 2 sons. Her husband also works as a mechanic. He provides a strong support for Narcisa. Both are responsible for the home and family. Everything they save goes towards their house which is made of cement. It is very important for Narcisa that her children are able to go to school in order to look after themselves in the future. Narcisa wants to continue to expand the business in order to increase her income.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Zoe], Kiva Volunteer.

Narcisa tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y maquillajes. Lleva 5 años vendiendo esta línea. Desde joven se ha dedicada a vender para poder llevar algún ingreso a la familia. Su capital lo fue reuniendo poco a poco a medida que su esposo le daba para la semana. Ella recorre ciertas zonas que ya las tiene definidas. Entrega a crédito y registra en su cuaderno lo que coloca, cobra cada semana. A partir del día jueves hasta el domingo sale a sus recorridos por la tarde. Gracias a los ingresos de ella y los de su esposo han podido tener su bien más importante que es su casa. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa de temporada y hacer los pedidos de perfumes y maquillaje que también coloca. Narcisa nació en Guayaquil. Tiene 42 años. Con 2 hijos. Su esposo también trabaja como mecánico. Él ha sido un apoyo para Narcisa. Ambos son muy responsable en el hogar todo ahorro ha sido para su casa que ahora ya es de cemento. Ellos han tenido que trabajar desde joven para poder subsistir. Lo más importante para Narcisa es darles los estudios a sus hijos y que puedan defenderse en el futuro. Narcisa desea crecer en su negocio y seguir generando ingresos para su hogar.

loans.use:
To buy seasonal clothing, perfumes and makeup

para comprar ropa de temporada, perfumes y maquillajes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I intent to expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Mrs. Clara I. is a dynamic client of Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) who specializes in the sale of basic foodstuffs to people in her area. Caroline is a young woman of 42, married with eight children, from Asaba of Delta State in Nigeria. She hopes to expand and improve her business with a loan of $750.

loans.use: To buy more items for her inventory

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa Z., age 32, is a mother of three. Her main work involves commerce in staple foods and in charcoal. This business demands a good deal of funding because food-producing regions are located far from the Maritime Region where she lives. In order to make her business profitable, a lot of goods must be purchased on each trip. This would require access to a lot of money. This is why she is requesting $800. She has always proven herself by repaying her previous loans without incident. This loan will be an added resource for making her business worthwhile.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 32 ans, Madame Z. Yawa est mère de trois (3) enfants. Son activité principale est le commerce des produits vivriers et du charbon. Ce commerce demande beaucoup de fonds car les zones d’approvisionnement sont bien éloignées de la Région Maritime où elle habite. Pour rentabiliser cette activité, il faut acheter beaucoup de produits lors d’un déplacement. Ceci exigerait la disponibilité de beaucoup d’argent. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite $800. Elle a toujours fait ses preuves en remboursant ses crédits antérieurs sans incident. Ce crédit sera pour elle une ressource supplémentaire afin de mieux rentabiliser son commerce.

loans.use: Commerce in staple foods and in charcoal

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.en: Hello, I have this small business in my house in the neighborhood of Villa Nueva. I sell used clothing for children, men and women. I have been doing this for five years. The loan money is to invest in the business and have more variety of clothing to be able to provide better service to my clients. I already have several orders from my clients as we approach the Christmas season.

loans.use: Purchase used shirts, pants, skirts, shorts, blouses and other clothes

loans.name: María Candelaria

texts.es:
María Candelaria is a woman who makes the most of her sales and handicraft abilities. Candelaria creates different types of handmade crafts depending on the season. The original reason she started working was that their household’s living expenses were depleting all the funds earned by her husband. She began to seek opportunities with which to take advantage of her creative and sales skills. With the help of a friend, she began selling second-hand clothing at a flea market where she could also showcase her handmade articles.

Regardless, she is out of clothes for the holiday season and only has summer items left. For this reason, she asks for a loan of $475USD to be repaid over a period of five months. With this money, Candelaria would be able to buy winter clothing as well as materials to create her holiday season crafts. With your help, Candelaria will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

María Candelaria es una mujer que aprovecha sus habilidades de vendedora así como las habilidades que tiene para hacer manualidades. Dependiendo de la temporada Candelaria elabora una manualidad diferente. Sin embargo la situación primordial por la que comenzó a trabajar fue porque los gastos de su casa estaban absorbiendo todo el dinero que su esposo ganaba por lo tanto Candelaria comenzó a buscar cómo aprovechar sus oportunidades de vender y hacer manualidades. Fue así como con la ayuda de una amiga comenzó a vender ropa de segunda en un mercado rodante y ahí ingresó sus manualidades.

Sin embargo para la temporada navideña se le terminó la ropa y tiene pura de verano. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Candelaria podrá comprar ropa para la temporada de invierno y materiales para elaborar sus manualidades para la época navideña. Con tu ayuda Candelaria podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for the winter season.

loans.name: Rasheeda's Group

texts.en: Rasheeda B. is from the second largest city in Pakistan, Lahore. She is married and the mother of six children; four sons and two daughters. She works as a cook for a local family. Her husband drives a van, her eldest son is a turner, the next oldest operates a car tires business, and the third one operates a construction business. Rasheeda is requesting a loan to buy construction supplies for her son's business. She is the leader of her loan group. The other members are: Zarina B., who requests a loan to improve her husband's fruit-selling business; Hameedan B., who requests a loan to buy her husband a rickshaw for his transport business; Saira B., who requests a loan for her cloth and material business; and Sabeeka B. who will use her loan to improve her son's embroidery business. All of these women have proven that these loans do make a difference to their lives, and they are very active and responsible. They always come at the group meetings punctually and never delay their loan installments.

loans.use: To improve businesses

loans.name: Kibrie

texts.en:
M. Kibrie is 26-year olds and the loving mother of four children of school age. 

Kibrie raises sheep which she sells for meat. She has been in this business for 8 years. Currently she has four sheep in her farm. This brave woman is running her business independently and quite successfully which allows her to contribute a considerable income to the family. 

Kibrie is planning to expand her farm and to purchase a further three sheep. At the same time she needs to buy fodder and is requesting a loan of 1,000.00 US Dollars over 12 months. Kibrie promises to pay the loan in time and tanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: To purcahse three sheep and fodder

loans.name: Mujeres San Jardin De Jorge Ii Group

texts.en:
The women of the community bank Mujeres Jardin de San Jorge have been with Friendship Bridge for two years now, but were previously with another finance institution. They weren’t happy there and set out to find lower interest rates, which they found with Friendship Bridge.

They are excited to see the long-term benefits these savings will bring to their business and are planning accordingly.

Of the eighteen women, half of them are artisans, weaving beautiful ‘huipiles’, traditional Mayan blouses as well as skirts, purses, and scarves.

Eight of the women are asking for a group loan of 16,500 quetzales ($2175) ranging from $150 to $400 per person. Four of these women will invest in colorful threads to weave and sew.

One woman has a jewelry business, selling beaded bracelets, necklaces and earrings in the nearby tourist capital, Panajachel. In addition to purchasing materials, she plans to hire an employee to increase her production.

The other three women (one who could not be in the picture) have small ‘tiendas’, stores, where they sell soft drinks, snacks, chicken and sausages. These women have a goal of opening additional stores, where they will offer an expanded variety of products, ranging from food to basic commodity products.

All these women have children, sometimes as many as eight each and they dream of being able to better provide for their families.

With a lower interest rate, they are able to invest in more materials, therefore producing more and earning a higher income. With this added income, the women are able to provide better education for their children as they can purchase the books, clothing and supplies they need.

All of them whish that their children will finish school and become professionals so that they don’t have to struggle in the same ways they have had to.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving, beads for jewelry, and supplies for small stores.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita is the eldest of 3 children. Her happy disposition and her hard working nature have become her greatest attributes. Rita, immediately after having completed high school she decided to face life head on so that she might earn a daily living to support her parents and to provide an education to her younger brothers. This hard working young woman tried her luck in many jobs but unfortunately none were very profitable. But a few months ago she decided to buy an immense variety of fruits and vegetables wholesale in her native city of Juliaca to re-sell in a mine, a secluded, cold and poorly accessible location. With this business and her hard work, finally she has been able to improve the quality of life for herself and for her beloved parents. With your generous support it will be possible for Rita to firmly establish her efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Rita es la mayor de 3 hermanos, su alegría y empeño por progresar se han convertido en sus principales características. Rita inmediatamente después de concluir sus estudios secundarios decidió enfrentarse a la vida para ganarse el sustento diario y así apoyar a sus padres con la educación de sus menores hermanos.Ésta emprendedora muchacha tentó suerte con muchas actividades, desafortunadamente ninguna le resultaba rentable, hasta hace algunos meses que decidió comprar una inmensa variedad de verduras y choclos al por mayor de su ciudad natal Juliaca para venderlos en la mina rinconada, lugar muy distante, frígido y poco accesible.Con este negocio y su empeño, finalmente está logrando mejorar su calidad de vida y apoyar a sus queridos padres.Tu generoso aporte permitirá concretar los proyectos de Rita.

loans.use: An increase in her capital so that she might offer vegetables in greater quantities.

loans.name: Marbela

texts.es:
Marbela is a member of the Communal Bank of Las Americas, which is located in Psj. 27 de Mayo S/N in the district of Ucayali. She is 41 years old and is the mother of 3 children. Her husband works in civil construction, but his income is not enough to support his family. Consequently, Marbela used her first loan of S. 300 to set up a small shop of acquisition and sale of goods.

Now she continues with her sale of goods, but she has to travel to Lima to bring back clients' orders. With her income, she is building a room in her house where she can exhibit her products.

With this loan of S. 1,000, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy clothes, sheets, bedspreads, blankets, decorations, et cetera.

Marbela has overcome many difficulties, but with the assistance of Manuela Ramos she is able to succeed and obtain many things.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marbela pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Americas, ubicado en el Jr. Vorgen de Fatima Mz. 23 Lt. 20, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja en construcción civil, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Marbela con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña tienda de compra y venta de mercadería. En la actualidad continua con su venta de mercadería, para ello tiene que viajar a Lima para traer sus pedidos que le hacen sus clientes y con las ganancias obtenidas esta construyendo un local en su casa para poder exhibir sus productos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: ropas, sabanas, colchas, cubrecamas, adornos, etc. Marbela supero muchas dificultades, pero con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos le ayuda a salir adelante y obtener muchas cosas.

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise

loans.name: Mohammad Hamayoun

texts.en: Mohammad Hamayoun lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a tailor who makes wedding dresses, and he has 3 workers. He has been involved in this business for more than 5 years and he wants to make himself more popular in the city and expand his business. He has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and buy new machines so that he can work faster and become stronger in his business.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in a small flour mill machine and other raw materials for a small confectioner's shop.

loans.name: Anna's Vumilia Group

texts.en:
Anna is a 27-year-old married woman with 2 children who are 8 and 11 years old, respectively. She began selling bananas in 2001 and to this day she works everyday from 7am to 8pm at her business. As a result, she generates a monthly profit of approximately $40 from her banana sales.

Anna now seeks a loan to buy more bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has vegetable-selling business.

loans.use: To expand and improve their respective businesses by purchasing additional fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura is a member of the Bonanza communal bank.

Maura lives with her partner, is 39 years old and has 4 children. She lives in the community of Ceccelambras which is located in the city of Ayacucho. Maura works growing potatoes, whose production is sent to the city of Lima and she also buys potatoes from the producers in her area and, after consolidating them, them to the city of Lima 2 times a week in the production months of February to August. In addition, Maura buys a variety of animals in the area villages in the months of September to January and then sells them in her community’s market.

Maura needs a loan of 3000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of goat and pig livestock.

Maura dreams of having a car with which she will be able to transport her products and of providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.

Maura es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Maura vive en la comunidad de Ceccelambras que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Maura se dedica a la agricultura de papa, cuya producción lo envía a la ciudad de Lima y también compra papa de los productores de su zona y luego de acopiar lo manda a la ciudad de Lima 2 veces por semana en los meses de producción de febrero a agosto, además Maura en los meses de septiembre a enero compra animales variados en los pueblos de su zona y luego lo vende en la feria de su comunidad.

Maura necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que fue invertido en la compra de ganado caprino y porcino.

Maura sueña con tener un carro con el cual pueda transportar sus productos y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Maura needs a loan 3000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of goat and pig livestock.

loans.name: Sagar

texts.fr: Sagar S. est vendeuse au marché Grand Thies de pagne ,encens ,tissu,etc..depuis dix ans.Elle est agée de quarante trois ans et est mariée et mere de cinq enfants
texts.en:
Sagar S. is in sales at the Grand Thies marketplace. She has been selling pagnes (colorful West Africa cloth), incense, fabrics, etc. for ten years. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of five.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sellling various items

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Madame Salimata  Konaté est agée de 32 ans et vit avec ses cinq( 5) enfants et son époux dans une famille monogame dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) )
Afin de s’insérer dans la vie économique, elle s’essaya à plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus sans succès. Elle opta finalement de s’installer dans le secteur de la nourriture depuis maintenant 8 ans. Elle fait des friandises (beignets) et de la petite restauration à savoir (préparation du haricot, de la spagueti etc).  Très  connue et appréciée grâce à la qualité de ses plats alimentaires, elle a une clientèle qui grossit de jour en jour.
Dans le souci de maintenir cette clientèle de plus en plus importante, elle décida de rejoindre le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elle est en relation depuis 3 ans. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel après 4 prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) tous remboursés sans difficultés
Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières au grand marché de Koutiala auprès des grossistes et fait sa cuisine devant sa porte sise au quartier Hamdallaye. Les beignets, haricots et spagueti ainsi préparés sont vendus devant la concession conjugale. La clientèle est constituée de toutes les catégories sociales de la cité. Elle vend chaque jour et cela durant toute l’année généralement au comptant et quelques fois à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 60.000FCFA par mois qu’elle  compte utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Dans l’avenir , son ambition  c’est d’ouvrir un restaurant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salimata Konaté is 32 years old and lives with her five children and her husband in a monogamous family in the Hamdallaye village (Prefecture of Koutiala, third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). So as to get a footing in economic life, she started several businesses, without success. In the end, she settled for the food-serving business eight years ago. She makes and serves snacks (beignets) and simple dishes (beans, spaghetti, etc). Well known and much appreciated thanks to the quality of her cooking, she has a clientele that is expanding every day. Anxious to maintain her ever-increasing clientele, she decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. She's now seeking her second personal loan after four group loans (solidarity loans) that were repaid without problems. She purchases raw materials from wholesale sellers in the grand market in Koutiala and does her cooking in front of her door in the Hamdallaye neighborhood. Beignets, beans and spaghetti are thus prepared and sold in front of the family house. Her clientele comes from all social categories in the city. Her business is open daily and all year long. She usually sells for cash and sometimes on credit. She foresees that she will make a monthly profit of XOF 60'000 (ca US$ 120), to be used to repay the loan and help with the daily family expenses. In the future, her ambition is to open a restaurant.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of bean, boxes of spaghetti and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in cell phone calling cards to resell

loans.name: Rath

texts.en:
Rath N., 54, lives in Kampong Cham and has sold rice noodles since 2000. On average, she makes $2 a day. Rice noodles, called in the Cambodia language “Nom Banchok,” are one of the favorite foods among Cambodians. Rice noodles are served with mint, banana blossoms, string beans, English cucumber, mung bean sprouts, and other vegetables. Rice noodles can also be used in green and red soup. Green soup, called “Nom Banchok Samlah Khmer,” is cooked with boneless fish. Red soup, called “Nom Banchok Namya,” is cooked with pork or chicken. 

Rath N.'s husband is a farmer who makes about $1.5 a day.  She would like a loan of $500 to make two investments.  First, to purchase a water pump for her husband to irrigate his farmland; and second, open a grocery store for her children to start a business to augment the family's income. (Rath is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and open a grocery store.

loans.name: Mercedes Yamilleth

texts.es:
Mercedes P. es una dama de muy bajos recursos pero con un gran espíritu de superación ya que junto con su cónyuge se esfuerzan para brindar a sus tres hijos un techo digno ya que su vivienda se encontraba en malas condiciones debido a los fenómenos naturales y climáticos y también al pasar del tiempo.

Al haber iniciado dicha obra, ha logrado levantar las P. y realizar la estructura pero todavía le hace falta la compra de los materiales para poner el techo, piso, puertas, ventanas y pintura de P.. Por esta razón ella ha buscado el refugio en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción para continuar con su construcción en su municipio de Somotillo.
texts.en:
Mercedes P. is a woman of very few material resources, but with a great spirit of determination to overcome life's challenges. Together with her partner she is working hard to provide her three children with a decent home, as their current residence is in poor condition owing to natural phenomena, the climate, and also the passing of time. Mercedes has started work on the house, and has succeeded in making the basic structure and building the walls. She stills needs to buy the materials for the roof, floors, doors, windows and wall paint. For this reason she has approached Ceprodel for a loan allowing her to purchase these building materials and continue construction in her municipality of Somotillo.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny N. is a villager in the Koun Tnaut Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate cassavas. She now faces a problem with her plantation because she does not have enough money to grow them. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She hopes to increase her income and to improve the living conditions with this new loan. Her husband, Mr. Ath Un, is a rice middleman. Mrs. Ny N. is 46 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer who helps his mother, and the other is attending the local school. Her husband is presented on right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cassavas to plant and grow in her fields

loans.name: Ukombozi Group

texts.en:
Cathrina has been a clothes seller (vitenge and bed sheets) in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 8 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more bed sheets and vitenge for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Cathrina is 42 years old, divorced, and has two children: ages 24 and 21. She also cares for three additional dependants. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mareciana and Maria. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (bed sheets and vitenge) for her business.

loans.name: Michail

texts.en: Michail is married. He owns a small store that sells car spare parts. His business is located close to a car maintenance shop. This gives him an opportunity to have many repeat clients and a stable business. Michail has been in this business for 10 years. During this time, he has developed a good business network that supplies him with the parts his clients order. Michail would like to borrow 10,000 UAH for 3 months to purchase spare parts in bulk. Michail says that short-term loans help him in his business a lot.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат парень 22 лет , пока не женат проживает вместе с родителями.Работает моляром автомашин.Раньше при первом займе он вёл свою деятельность в городском гараже по ремонту автомашин.Теперь научившись своему делу , он решил отделится и начать работать самому.Сейчас он работает на дому.Для покупки аппарата для покраски машин он решил повторно подать заявку на займ.Первый займ он использовал для покупки набора ключей, приборов для ремонта моторов автомашин. Шавкат благодарен , сто в кредит возможно расширить своё дело.
texts.en:
Shavkat is a 22 year old young man, for now he is not married and lives with his parents. Shavkat works as a car painter. Previously during his first loan he had his business at the public auto shop. Now, having learned his craft he decided to start his own business and work on his own. He works at home. In order to purchase a special apparatus to paint cars he decided to apply for a second loan. He used his first loan in order to purchase tools to repair auto engines. Shavkat is grateful that he can expand his business with the help of a loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tool to paint cars

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine P. is a hairdresser by profession. She has a shop on one of the streets in her community. She has some apprentices in training. She is requesting a loan to procure hairdressing materials such as cream, lotion, artificial hair, etc. to enable her to provide quality services to her clients.

Catherine is 35 years old. She is divorced and has three children: one son and two daughters. She says all of her children are still in basic school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the farming/commercial town of Achiase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Catherine works very hard to make enough money to take care of her children.

Catherine has been in business for seventeen years and wants a loan to procure supplies in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education.

loans.use: To procure hairdressing materials

loans.name: Perusi

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Perusi S. from Mwanza. She is married with three children, between the ages of 11 and 14 years old. Perusi has been running a poultry business since 2002.

Raising "kuku" is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

Perusi works at the business for 8 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Perusi currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more kuku (chickens). In the future, she plans to expand her business. Perusi thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more kuku (chickens) to raise

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.ru: Абдукаримова Шодигуль проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 54 года, замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Муж находиться в России на заработках , поэтому весь груз по обеспечению семьи лежит на ее плечах. Работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Засеяла пшеницу. Кроме того планирует посев овощей и для этого она решила получить кредит для покупки семян , удобрений и салярки. это поможет ей своевременно произвезти посев.
texts.en:
Shodigul A. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 54 years old, married, and has six children. Her husband is working in Russia, so she must shoulder all of the responsibility for raising the family. She works on a small farm. She has planted wheat. She also plans to raise vegetables, so she decided to request a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and diesel fuel. This will help her to complete the sowing on time.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds, fertilizer, and fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing yams

loans.name: Women Of Success Group

texts.en:
Bendu is a single mother with 2 children ages 4 and 11 years. Her children attend a private institute within the Red Hill field Community in Browerville. She sells table goods and sometimes fries doughnut (a flour product).

"I am successful in this business because the goods sold are truly needed in the community," she explained. She’s desirous of opening a bakery from proceeds generated from the business in the future.

loans.use: To buy goods for resale, and for flour to produce doughnuts

loans.name: Negmat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
    Негмат – молодой человек 1989 года рождения. Холост. Занимается продажей мобильных телефонов и аксессуаров и бытовой техники в районе Стадион, ряд магазинов Зафар города Худжанда. Негмату привозят товар из Китая а часть из Дубая. Сам Негмат ездит за товаром редко, потому, что транспортные расходы обходятся дорого. Негмат планирует расширить бизнес и закупить партию двух стандартных мобильных телефонов. Поэтому он просит кредит для осуществления его планов.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Negmat is a young man born in 1989. He is a bachelor. He sells mobile phones and accessories and household appliances in the region Stadion, in the store row Zafar in the town of Khujand. Negmat is supplied with merchandise from China and part from Dubai. Negmat himself travels for the merchandise rarely because the transportation costs are expensive. Negmat plans to expand his business and buy a batch of two standard mobile phones. This is why he is asking for a loan to realize his plans.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mobile phones

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.en:
Norma is 63 years old and is married with four adult children. Norma and her family live in the city of Pucallpa. Norma sells fish and "mazamorra D. maiz" (a local pudding-style dessert maD. from corn). Her husband is a fisherman. 

Norma has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for seven years and belongs to the communal bank "Las Almendras" (The Almonds). She invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in purchasing fish for sale. Norma plans to invest this loan of 1200 soles in fish traps as well as in peanuts and corn for the dessert that she makes.

Thanks to her loans from Manuela Ramos, Norma has been able to fix up her house and also invest in business ventures. In this way she is able to support both her husband and their small grandson who lives with them. Norma's goal is to eventually have her own clothing shop.

loans.use: To buy fish traps for husband's fishing business and peanuts and corn for making a dessert to sell.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La señora Ramona Z. es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad.
Tiene poco tiempo que adquirió su vivienda por medio de un crédito Gubernamental el cual le está haciendo falta una parte para el enganche, pero ella no cuenta con el dinero necesario para liquidar está deuda y que la casa sea de ella y de sus hijos.
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder pagar el enganche y así su familia va estar más segura.
Doña Ramona trabaja de intendente de un edificio de la ciudad, este es el ingreso que tiene y con el cual pagara el préstamo.
texts.en:
Ramona Z. is a single mother with three children in her care. Recently she bought a house through a government loan. She still needs to pay off part of the down payment, but she doesn't have the money to pay off the debt and get the house for herself and her children. She is seeking a loan to be able to pay the down payment so her family can be more secure. Ramona will pay back the loan from the income she receives as a janitor in a building in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the down payment on a house she is financing through the government

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es: Cecilia Del Carmen  V. D. A. vive en el departamento D. La Paz junto a su familia, que está conformada por su esposo y sus tres hijos menores D. edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Cecilia posee su propio negocio, el cual le permite ayudar a su esposo en los múltiples gastos familiares, el negocio D. Cecilia consiste en la elaboración y venta D. pupusas, cuenta con una clientela ya estable, pero Cecilia quiere fortalecer mas su pupuseria con este crédito, que le ayudara a comprar mayor cantidad D. materia prima, para lograr aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Cecilia Del Carmen V. D. A. lives in the district of La Paz with her family, which consists of her husband and their three dependent children who are students. She has her own business, which enables her to help husband with multiple family expenses.

Cecilia’s business involves making and selling pupusas. She has a steady clientele, but she wants to make more improvements to her pupuseria. With this loan, she will buy more ingredients to help increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en: Annelyn G. is thankful she doesn’t have to tend other people’s farm since she owns a hectare of rice field to attend to. She is 41 years old, married and has two children. Her rice field is the family’s source of income that’s why she makes it an effort to ensure her crops are growing healthy. To sustain her farm, Annelyn needs additional financial assistance. She asked to loan Php10, 000 from CEV.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es:
El señor José Miguel F. está solicitando un préstamo para poder mejorar su vivienda para bienestar de sus dos pequeños hijos.
A la casa le está haciendo falta el vitropiso pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la mejora y pagar a la persona que se encargara de colocar el vitropiso.
Don José Miguel trabaja en una agencia aduanan en el departamento de elaboración de pedimentos, este es el ingreso que genera para su familia y con el cual planea pagar el crédito.
La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposa la señora Araceli Trejo y una hija, ya que el señor José Miguel se encontraba en su trabaja cuando se realizo la visita.
texts.en:
Señor José Miguel F. is applying for a loan in order to be able to improve his dwelling for the wellbeing of his two little children. At his house, he lacks floor tiles, but he doesn’t have the money necessary to be able to carry out the improvement and pay the person that he will hire to lay the tiles.

Don José Miguel works in a customs agency in the department that processes petitions. This is the source of the income that he earns for his family and with which he plans to pay off the loan. The person who appears in the photo is his wife, Señora Araceli Trejo, and a daughter since Señor José Miguel was at work when we made the visit to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Laying of floor tiles throughout his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cement and building material to sell

loans.name: Sr. De Malta Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento Señor D. Malta  es grupo antiguo que se encuentra en su 4º ciclo es responsable en sus pago y que no entraron en Mora ya que son socias comprometidas con nuestra Institucion. Este Banco esta dirigido por la Sra. Betty  quien es la lider y muy responsable en sus pagos ella  tiene 5 hijos y tiene su negocio D. venta D. hamburguesas en la esquina D. su casa, como Tesorera se encuentra la Sra. Nancy, quien es una persona joven es casada tiene 2 hijas y tiene el negocio D. venta D. muñecas D. peluches en la Av. San Martin a persar D. estar en su segundo ciclo demostrò ser muy responsable y puntual en sus cuotas  y como Secretaria se encuentra la socia Marlen  tiene 1 hijo tiene su negocio D. venta D. comida . El crèdito es para aumentar el Capital D. sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Bank D. Emprendimiento Senor D. Malta is an older group in its 4th loan cycle. The group is responsible with its payments and has not been delinquent because they are reliable members of our institution. This bank is led by Mrs. Betty who is very punctual with her payments. She has 5 children and has a business of selling hamburgers at the corner of her house. The treasurer is Mrs. Nancy, a young lady, married with 2 daughters. Her business is selling stuffed animals on San Martin Avenue. Although this is her second loan cycle, she has shown to be very responsible and punctual with her payments. Mrs. Marlen is the secretary. She has 1 son and her business is selling food. The loan is to raise capital for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise capital

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis A. R. de 51 años de edad Reside en el departamento de Chalatenango, vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores de edad los cuales se dedican a estudiar. El posee una panadería, en la cual trabaja junto a su esposa, con el fin de brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener una vida mejor, llena de todas las necesidades básicas. José Luis solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materia prima para la elaboración del pan, el junto a su esposa son una pareja muy alegre los cuales comparten no solo el mismo trabajo sino también el mismo deseo de brindarles a sus hijos una vida mejor.
texts.en:
José Luis A. R. is 51 years old. He reside in the Chalatenango State. He lives with his wife and three young children who are still in school. He owns a bakery, in which he works with his wife, to provide their children with a better life, full of the basic necessities. José Luis is asking for a loan with which he can buy raw ingredients for making bread. Together with his wife, they are a happy couple who share not only in the same work, but also in the same desires to provide a better life for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Gianina

texts.es:
Gianina es una mujer dinámica y emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 29 años, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad y junto con su esposo se dedica a la venta de condimentos al por mayor los que son distribuidos en mercados y bodegas de esta ciudad.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Libertadoras” desde hace cuatro años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles lo que le permitió empezar con el negocio de condimentos.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 2200.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà condimentos(comino, ají panca, pimienta, etc) en la ciudad de Lima y posteriormente distribuirà en su ciudad.
La meta de Gianina es tener un local propio en el mercado para vender estos productos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Gianina is a dynamic and enterprising woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 29 years old and the mother of two young children. She and her husband work together selling spices to markets and shops in their city.

Gianina became a member of the “Las Libertadoras” (“Liberators”) Communal Bank four years ago. The first loan that she received was for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles, which enabled her to start her spice business. She is currently requesting a loan for 2,200 nuevos soles with which she will purchase spices (cumin, chili pepper, black pepper, etc.) in Lima to later sell in her city.

Gianina's goal is to have her own stall in the market to sell her products and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use this loan to purchase spices (cumin, chili pepper, black pepper, etc.) in Lima to sell in Pucallpa.

loans.name: Cerina

texts.en:
Being 53 years old, Cerina keeps herself strong to perform her farming duties. She is married and has six children.

Cerina said that she learned farming through her parents and started farming way back in 1987. She works hard at the farm to achieve an abundant harvest. She also wants to have better income so she could provide for her family’s growing needs.

Cerina is a member of CEVI and is grateful for the financial services she gained access to. She is now requesting a loan of Php 15,000 which she will use to finance her farm. This loan will help Cerina ensure healthy crops and a good harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal  “Fortaleza” esta representada por la señora Mary y conformada por 12 miembros todos de la  misma zona  barrio el carmen una gran mayoría de las socias tienen su negocio y otras van a empezar uno nuevo, y sobre todo cuentan con lo necesario para poder cubrir con un crédito con nuestra institución. Entre las actividades que realizan las socias esta la venta de pan, venta de comida y los señores al transporte como la venta de abarrotes que le permiten pagar de forma puntual sus cuotas. La competencia entre las socias está realmente muy difícil, especialmente en la venta de comida y en la venta de pan y abarrotes que cada socia espera cada día un buen resultado en sus ventas, existe una gran competencia, ya que existen negocios bien establecidos y conocidos. 

Respecto a las actividades que desempeñan los miembros del grupo tenemos que: Mary (la presidenta) y Jackeline son las únicas que se dedican a la venta de cosméticos desde hace 36 años atrás una y la otra desde hace 48 años, Mary vende productos Avon por catalogo y Jacky ya es Directora de los productos de belleza de Yanbal; por otra parte Isabel, Dora, Lidia y Esther venden comida una de ellas se especializa en la venta de pan la experiencia promedio de todas ellas es de 19 años. Roberto tiene una tienda de abarrotes y cuenta con una experiencia de 1 años, Luis vende compuadoras desde hace 36 años arás, Teresa vende utencilios varios desde hace 36 años al igual que Roberto y su hermana Roxana vende ropa y cuenta con el mismo tiempo de experiencia, Nelson es portero de un colegio desde hace 15 años y por último está Juanita que se desempeña como niñera desde hace 36 años. 

El  crédito esta destinado a la iniciativa de poder agrandar un poco mas en su negocio incrementados su mercadería y su materia prima para mejorar sus Ingresos para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y a su familia, ellos desean seguir siendo parte del banco para que en el futuro tengan mas apoyo económico. 

La mayoría de las socias ya cuenta con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital a la cual están agradecidos por su apoyo y confianza.
texts.en:
The Fortaleza Communal Bank is represented by Mary and comprised of 12 members. They are all from the same neighborhood, El Carmen. Most of the members have businesses, and others are going to start a new one. Above all, they have all that is needed to cover a loan with our institution. Among the activities that the members do is selling bread and selling food; the men work in transportation such as selling groceries, which allows them to make their payments punctually. The competition among the members is truly very difficult, especially selling food, bread, and groceries. Each member hopes to get a good sales result each day. They are very competent because their businesses are well established and well known. The businesses of the group members are as follows: Mary (the president) and Jackeline are the only ones who sell cosmetics (one has been in this line of work for 36 years, the other for 48 years): Mary sells Avon products via catalog and Jacky is the Products Director for the Yanbal line of beauty products. Isabel, Dora, Lidia and Esther sell food - one has a grocery store and a year of experience, Luis has been selling computers for the past 36 years, Teresa has been selling utensils for the past 36 years, and her sister Roxana also sells clothing with the same amount of experience. Nelson has been working as a doorman at a school for the past 15 years, and Juanita has been working as a nanny for the past 36 years. The loan is to be able to make their businesses a little bigger by increasing their merchandise and raw materials to improve their income. This way they will be able to get their children and their families ahead. They want to be able to continue being part of the bank in order to have more economic support in the future. Most of the members have experience with communal groups thanks to loans with institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital. They are very grateful to Fundación Agrocapital for their support and trust.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Tarif

texts.en: Tarif is a 37 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Tarif has been an electrician since 1998. When he first started his business, he had to face competition and financial issues in order to purchase all the tools and electrical wires needed for his work. Tarif is talented; he is known for his good work. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and repair his business car which allows him to go to his clients. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work, as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase tools and repair his business car

loans.name: Felicial

texts.en: Felicial sells drinks and juice at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to expand her business. She is 42 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a civil engineer and he also supports the home. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more drinks to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Olarewaju

texts.en:
Olarewaju sells motor spare parts at retail prices to his customers and has been in this business for a long time. He needs the loan of N100,000 to purchase more motor spare parts to sell.

Olarewaju is a hardworking man. He is 35 years old and married with two children. His children attend school and this gives him joy. He lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Poly

texts.en:
Mr. Poly H., 40 and his wife, Mrs. Amiros Sles, 38, were married in 1995 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Four of them attend school and another one is still young. The family is living along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Poly and his wife have been selling goats and chickens for a year. They buy them from other provinces far away from their house and sell to a middleman who comes to buy at their house.  

Poly hopes to expand his business to become bigger and be able to generate income as well. So he is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase additional goats for resale.

loans.use: To buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Terrazas Group

texts.es:
El Grupo terrazas esta compuesto por tres socios, Mayra (venta de comida), Cesar (Venta de comida), y Elsa (venta de fruta y comida) todos viven en Ciudad Peronia, Villa Nueva.
Mayra es la lider del grupo, ha trabajado desde hace 6 años en la venta de comida en el cual le va muy bien. Tiene 29 años, esta casa y tienen dos hijos uno de 14 y uno de 10. Su negocio ha ido incrementando gracias a la buena atencion al cliente que ella ofrece a sus clientes. Doña Mayra solicita el crédito para poder invertir en  su venta, y asi poder brindar un mejor servicio y al mismo tiempo brindarle un mejor futura a sus hijos. Este prestamo ella lo utilizara para comprar una plancha de tortillas
texts.en:
The Terrazas group is made up of three members: Mayra (who sells food), Cesar (who also sells food), and Elsa (who sells fruit and other food). All three live in the city of Pernoia, Villa Nueva.

Mayra is the leader of the group and she has been working for the last three years selling food and business is going well. She is 29 years old, married, and has two children, one who is 14 years old, the other who is 10. Her business has grown thanks to her attentiveness to her customers. Mayra is asking for a loan to invest in her business so that she will be able to offer a better service to her customers and offer a better future to her children. This loan will be used to buy a tortilla press.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in her business, food sales

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 29-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Hassan has been working in agriculture since 2005. He owns livestock and also plants some fruits and vegetables. 

He requested a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase a cow to increase his livestock. This is the first time he has requested a loan. Hassan is special in his work because he does his best to produce the best quality. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t use to produce as much as he does today. Hassan decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans to keep on expanding his work by producing more.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada y es soltero vive con su Mama y sus Hermanas a quienes el mantiene con su trabajo que tiene como actividad la de chofer propietario en una empresa de radio taxi GOLD, cuyas rutas principales son del centro de la ciudada hacia la zona sud, es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora que siempre ve por el bienestar de su Madre y sus hermanas. Su deseo del Sr. Daniel es el de comprar una casita para su Mama para que pueda vivir tranquila su vejes, El crédito solicitado es para mantenimiento preventivo de su vehiculo, ya que es su unica fuente de ingresos cada temporada le hace el mantenimiento para que su vehiculo no presente fallas a la hora de salir a trabajar, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Daniel is 30 years old, lives in a rented house and is single. He lives with his mother and sisters, whom he supports with his work as an owner-driver for the GOLD taxi cab company. The company’s main routes are between the city centre and the south of the city. He is a responsible and very hard-working person, always thinking of the wellbeing of his mother and sisters. He would like to buy a small house where his mother can grow old peacefully. The loan he has requested is to pay for some preventive maintenance work on his vehicle. As it represents his only source of income, he services his car every year so that it doesn’t break down while he is working. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in him and for the approval of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, D.  60 años, es una madre muy responsable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia al lado D. su esposo y  sus 3 hijos mayores.Se dedica a  la venta D. bocadillos  por las tardes. Es experta en freír  picarones (dulce hecho a base D.  harina, camote, zapallo y  levadura). Cada día trabaja en busca D. vender todos sus picarones,  ya que D. ese modo sus utilidades son buenas. Años atrás vendía en la puerta D. su casa, lo que  no  era muy rentable, y en la actualidad  venD. en un paradero y sus compradores son las personas que  esperan y bajan D. los buses, y eso le es muy beneficioso, ya que esta obteniendo buenas ganancias. Está contenta con lo que hace, porque le da tiempo para vender  diferentes productos D. belleza, y tiene planeado construir más cuartos en su casa, para que en el futuro pueda vivir D. sus rentas.Este es su doceavo préstamo con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso, es por ello que se compromete en  seguir pagando sus cuotas como siempre lo ha hecho. Alicia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra  D. insumos para la preparación D. sus picarones, asimismo tiene pensado invertir en el incremento D. cosméticos para continuar vendiendo.
texts.en:
Alicia, age 60, is a very hard-working and responsible mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and 3 grown children. She sells sandwiches in the afternoon. She is an expert in frying picarones (sweets maD. from flour, sweet potato, pumpkin and yeast). Every day she works to sell all of her picarones, and so her profits are good. Years ago she sold them out of her house, which was not very profitable, so she now sells her food at a bus station and serves people waiting for buses and just arriving. This is very profitable and she is making a good income. She is happy with her work, because it also gives her time to sell beauty products. She plans to build more rooms in her house, and in the future to rent them and live off of that income. This is her twelfth loan with MFP, and she knows that it will be very helpful. For this reason she promises to continue to pay her instalments on time as she always has. Alicia plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of ingredients for her picarones, and she is also thinking about investing in more cosmetics to continue selling them.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Digmar

texts.es: Digmar, es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 35 años, vive feliz en su casa propia a lado de su esposa Enafilia de 34 años, y sus dos pequeños hijos, quienes son su motivación para esforzarse cada día. Junto a su esposa, se dedican al cultivo de coco, plátano, café, maíz,  yuca y frutas cítricas, sobre sus fértiles terrenos que posee. Cuando decidieron hacer una vida en común, valoraron el aprendizaje que le dieron sus padres, además porque estos frutos son los que mejor producen en esta zona de la Selva Central del Perú. Cada mañana de manera ordenada Digmar, sale a limpiar y cuidar sus cultivos, porque sabe que la recompensa de su ardua labor vendrá en la cosecha. Él confiesa que le fascina ver sus plantaciones fuertes, sin maleza que interrumpa su crecimiento. Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera profesional en la ciudad y no dependan de las labores agrícolas solamente, a pesar de ser muy rentable. Por el momento desea aumentar la cantidad de plantaciones de café y naranjas que tiene. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y como presidente de la junta directiva de su grupo, es quien hace cumplir las normas y reglas de su grupo comunal, para que todo marche muy bien como hasta ahora. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará diversas herramientas de trabajo como machetes y javas, también contratará operarios para que limpien los terrenos que acaba de comprar.
texts.en:
Digmar is a very hard-working man. He is 35 years old and lives very happily in his own house with his wife Enafilia, who is 34, and their two small children, who are his motivation to work hard everyday. With his wife, he grows coconuts, bananas, coffee, corn, cassava and citrus fruits on fertile land that he owns. When Digmar and Enafilia decided to make a life together, they chose these crops because they valued the teaching his parents gave him, and also because these crops are the ones that grow best in this zone of Peru's Central Jungle. Every morning, according to his routine, Digmar goes out to weed and take care of his crops because he knows the payment for his hard work will come in the harvest. He confesses that it fascinates him to see his plants grow strong, without any disease that interrupts their growth. His greatest desire is for his children to be able to study a professional career in the city and not depend on agricultural work, despite its being very profitable. For the moment he wants to increase the number of coffee fields and orange fields that he has. This is Digmar's second loan with MFP, and as president of the board of directors of his group, he is the one to makes his communal bank follow its rules. For this reason everything has gone very well until now. With the loan he is requesting, Digmar will buy various work tools like machetes and crates. He will also hire workers to clear the fields he has just bought.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy machetes and crates, and hire workers to clear his fields

loans.name: Jealyn

texts.en:
Jealyn S. is from the village of Pagalongan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 26 years old. Jealyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jealyn provides transportation services to local community members. Jealyn is just starting this business.

In 2010, Jealyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jealyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jealyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. is a 77-year-old single woman. Twelve years ago, she opened herself up to taking the risk of venturing in a business through the motivation of her business partner Rita, who is now 80 years of age. The two had their own share of a small amount of capital to start a business of buying and selling salt and “muscovado” sugar. They have a small table made of bamboo in the market to sell their products to people. 

“Mucovado” is a variety of sugar which is commonly called the “red" sugar. It is processed naturally and free from any chemicals and preservatives. This is supposedly the most expensive kind of sugar, wherein customers are people from class A and B. However, in the province where the supply of this is abundant and the sellers' packaging and marketing strategies are very poor, the demand in the market is low. Middlemen buy large volume and are the ones to improve the packaging for export, selling in other cities through malls. Therefore, they’re the ones who gain bigger profit.  

Despite Victoria’s age, she still has hopes to improve the packaging of her business and to increase her sales turnover. With that, she will have more profits and her dream of helping some of her relatives would be materialized.

loans.use: To purchase larger volume of "muscovado" sugar and salt for selling

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina L. is from the town of Banga. She is 44 years old and married with 4 children. Two of her children still go to school and she hopes to have them graduate college soon. To make a living, Regina raises corn for sale. Regina also raises pigs. She hopes to acquire more piglets and also add chickens to her livestock.

Regina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Regina is now requesting her 4th loan, for 12000 PHP, to purchase fertilizer such as manure and also livestock feed.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and livestock feed.

loans.name: Jose Aladino

texts.es:
José de 54 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

comenzó con una vitrina vendiendo dulces y bebidas, poco a poco fue surtiendo su local con víveres, hasta ahora que tiene una pequeña tienda surtida en la ventana de su casa vende dulces, bebidas, granos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, bebidas, un congelador para mejorar y surtir su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande y surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
José, age 54, has a small store in the front part of his house. He lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil (an urban zone where most of the inhabitants are informal merchants). He started with just a display case selling sweets and drinks. Little by little he was stocking his place with supplies. Now he has a small store that is stocked in the window of his house. He sells sweets, drinks, and grains. He will use the loan to buy rice, drinks, and a freezer to improve and stock his store. In the future he wants to have a larger, stocked business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, freezer, drinks

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana  F. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Pungtod, Brgy. Caceres, Oslob, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a retail  business selling frozen food products.  Her husband Rogelio F., who is 46 years old, works as a deliveryman to earn his living.  They have 6 children who are 16 to  27 years old. 

Feliciana  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Feliciana  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 49,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to purchase more frozen products to sell so that she can continue to save up for the education of her children. Feliciana  F. is a "Dungganon" woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Meziel

texts.en:
Meziel S. is 24 years old, single and has an infant. She is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag municipality in the province of Bukidnon in northern Mindanao. Meziel runs a store from which she sells rice by the kilogram to the local community. Meziel has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Meziel joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Meziel is requesting her first loan from HSPFI of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional rice to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice to sell

loans.name: Jivimin

texts.en:
Jivimin S. is from the town of Banga. She is 44 years old and married. To make a living, Jivimin owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jivimin has been engaged in farming for over 12 years. She also manages a sari-sari store now. She sells sugar, vinegar and other products.
Jivimin joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jivimin is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Zivar

texts.en:
Zivar M. started her own business eight years ago because her husband’s salary was not enough to cover their family expenses. She sells confectionery like candies, cookies and pastries in the local market. The income she generates allows Zivar to support her family. 

Zivar dreams of enlarging her store and purchasing more merchandise to satisfy her customers' demand. Today she is requesting 1000 AZN. She is going to spend the loan on purchasing confectionery to enlarge the range of goods she sells. She is planning to spend the income for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: purchasing confectionery to enlarge the range of goods she sells

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao P. is a single mother caring for four children in Battambang Province. All four of the children attend the local school and are dependent on her income. She married years ago, but divorced her husband. 

Mrs. Mao P. is a local farmer. She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crops on her land, such as cabbages, cucumbers, and morning glories, which she sells to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. 

Mrs. Mao P. is a sacrificing and determined woman who tries to earn money to ensure her children will attain the highest level of education. She faces a difficult season if she is not able to irrigate her crops. She is taking out her loan to purchase some pipe to connect with her existing machine to pump water for her crops. The rest of the funds will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase some pipes to connect with her existing machine to pump water for her crops

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en:
Hezron, age 32, sells clothes and shoes in a densely populated area where he caters to a good market of middle income earners. He is requesting his first loan of Kes. 20,000 to add a new stock of clothes.  

For extra income, Hezron is a farmer. He is married and a father to two children who are in school. He hopes to own a boutique in the future and has a five-year plan of eventually owning a plot.
