loans.use: To add a new stock of clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: Sot K. is a 52-year-old woman who lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She and her husband are local farmers and earn an income of approximately 2 USD per day. This couple lives with five children and earns a living by planting various crops on their own farmland. Growing crops is an annual action with which they have had great success, and they can plant both rainy reason and dry season. Presently, Sot K. faces a problem with traveling. Sot K. said that she has been paying for motor taxis to get to go anywhere, because she does not own a vehicle, and her saving is not enough to buy it one. To solve this problem, she is applying for a loan to add with her personal saving to purchase a new motorcycle for traveling.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle for traveling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva M. has been trading in shoes since 2000.  Eva buys from local shoe makers who provide her with quality shoes. The prices on these shoes are very affordable, unlike prices on shoes imported from abroad. With husband and 3 children all working hard and helping each other in daily life and in business, Eva’s trade is a family business which supports the big family’s needs and the children’s education. 

With the winter and pre-Holiday demand, Eva is planning to acquire more inventory to satisfy her clients and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for resale

loans.name: Kulpunay

texts.en:
Kulpunay S. is 39-year-old attentive mother of four children. She has higher pedagogical education and works as a teacher of Russian language and literature at the local school. Her husband works as a policeman. Unfortunately, Kulpunay and her husband's wages are too low to cover all of their household's expenses. In order to find an additional means of subsistence for her family, Kulpunay decided to start her own business reselling goods.

With an initial capital of 20,000 KGS, Kulpunay began to sell women’s clothing and outer garments. Her start as an entrepreneur was successful due to strong efforts, which led Kulpunay to broaden her business by selling different kinds of fabrics. Her loyal customers were attracted by the high quality of goods and Kulpunay's cheerfulness.

In June 2010, when violent clashes broke out in the city of Osh, Kulpunay lost her business, which was robbed and looted. However, Kulpunay hasn’t given up and is ready to resume her lost business and continue working. Therefore, Kulpunay is applying for a loan of 100,000 KGS to restart her business. She plans to rent a space in the local market to sell women’s clothing and fabrics. Kulpunay’s motivation is really strong because she is eager to see her children educated and successful.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase women’s clothing and fabrics for resale

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 25 years old. She is married and her husband works with her. She has three children; the youngest is one and a half year old  and the eldest is five years old. Two of her children goes to school and one has not begun school yet. Esperance has a butcher and her husband helps her search for goats for sale. Esperance is requesting a loan in order to buy more goats for slaughtering and sell skewered meats. The profits will be used to reinvest in her business of goats.

loans.use: To buy  more goats for slaughtering to sell skewered meats.

loans.name: Karina Aura

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora  Karina es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijas de  15, 7 y 4 años que estudian en colegio, en  escuela y en  jardín de infantes. Su esposo es comerciante.

De lunes a viernes trabaja en quehaceres domésticos y los sabados y domingos instala en su casa un pequeño restaurante en el cual prepara deliciosos platos para los clientes que llegan hasta su local, en las mañanas prepara el delicioso encebollado y en las tardes almuerzos y meriendas con una variedad de platos, nos cuenta que solo abre en estos días por que es cuando más personas pasan por el lugar y que esto le deja buenos ingresos extra.

Este crédito es para comprar productos para preparar  sus deliciosos platos. Sus sueños son que sus hijas tengan una buena educación y que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Virgen De Monserrate community bank meets every fortnight in the city of Charapoto. This town is known for its traditional culture and also for being minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province which are San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Karina is a founding member of the community bank and likes the ease with which one can obtain a loan. She is 33 years old, married and has three daughters of 15, 7 and 4 years studying in high school, primary school and kindergarten. Her husband is a merchant.

From Monday through Friday she is busy with housework and on Saturday and Sunday she has set up a small restaurant in her home that serves delicious dishes to customers. In the morning she prepares delectable encellobados (a typical Ecuadorian breakfast preparation) and in the evening a variety of snacks and dishes. She tells us that she only opens on weekends because that is when most people pass by and this brings her good additional income.

This loan will be used to buy items to prepare her delicious dishes. Her dream is that her daughters receive a good education and become professionals.

loans.use: Buy general produce

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en: Marie Rose is 25 years old  and has a 3-year-old child. Marie Rose has owned a shop in which she sells vegetables, rice, sugar and cooking oil for 2 years. Marie Rose is requesting a loan in order to buy more vegetables, rice and cooking oil. With the profits she hopes to make, she plans to continue her house construction.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Los Claveles De Jojutla Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama los "Claveles de Jojutla", porque así se llama la calle donde viven las integrantes del grupo. Esta ubicado en el estado de Morelos en México. El grupo esta conformado por 12 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un prestamo. Verónica García B. es la tesorera del grupo. Tiene 44 años, estudio hasta la primaria, y se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos negocio que inició hace 12 años. Solicita el préstamo para ampliar su negocio y piensa invertirlo comprando más mercancía, como: perfumes, cremas, desodorantes y cosméticos en general. Sus clientes la prefieren por ser una persona atenta, agradable y por que siempre entrega sus pedidos a tiempo. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta. Quiere este crédito para comprar mas mercancía para su negocio y con las ganancias obtenidas invertir en su negocio para ofrecer a más personas sus productos. También desea construir mejor su casa para brindarles una vida más digna a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called "Claveles de Jojutla" (the Jojutla Carnations) because that’s the name of the street where the members of the group live.  They are located in the state of Morales in Mexico.  The group is made up of 12 members and this is the first time they have applied for a loan.  

Verónica García B. is the group’s treasurer.  She is 44 years old and studied through primary school.  She is involved in the sale of cosmetics, a business she began 12 years ago.

She is applying for the loan in order to enlarge her business and is planning on investing it in the purchase of more merchandise such as perfumes, creams, deodorants, and cosmetics in general.  Her customers prefer her because she is an attentive, pleasant person and because she always delivers their orders on time.

She is very happy to be applying for the loan.  She wants to use the loan to buy more merchandise for her business and, with the earnings she obtains, invest in the business in order to offer her products to more people.  She also wants to improve her house in order to offer a more respectable life to her family.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, deodorants, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria Estefanía

texts.es:
Maria Estefanía A. C. tiene 31 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y  con los  hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener terrenos y comprar vacas reproductoras.

Le gusta cocinar y arreglar la casa.
texts.en:
Maria Estefanía A. C., 31, is married living with her husband and children in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.  She has five children.

The GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN communal bank is located in the community of Guanto Cruz, located in Guaranda Canton.  It has 22 members who farm blackberries, raise barnyard animals and dairy cows for cheese making.

Maria is a blackberry and corn farmer and also raises barnyard animals.  She buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells at the Guaranda Farmers Market.

She is requesting funds to buy supplies and animals to raise and feed for them.  Help from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  Her dream is to own fields and to buy breeding cows.

She likes to cook and to do housework.

loans.use: to buy supplies, animals to raise and feed for them.

loans.name: Serena

texts.en:
Serena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from raising pigs. Serena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store business. She hopes to send her children to college and to renovate her house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Emilce Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Emilce Concepcion B. R. cuenta  con 30 años de edad, es  madre, sus hijas están en edad escolar.
Ella se dedica al comercio independiente de productos cosméticos de una afamada marca, pero quiere contar con un stock de mercaderias mas variado, de manera a satisfacer las diversas necedidades de sus clientes y de esa manera aumentar el volumen de ventas.
El objetivo por el que trabaja duro cada día Emilce es, además de la manutención de sus hijas, establecer un local comercial y de esa manera ofertar los productos que hoy no está pudiendo ofrecer a falta de la economía necesaria.  
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar cosméticos de otras marcas y otros productos como bijouteries y prendas íntimas.
texts.en:
Emilce Concepcion B. R. is 30 years old.  She is a mother and has school-age daughters.

Emilce sells a well-known brand of cosmetics independently.  However, she would like to have a more varied stock of merchandise so that she can meet the diverse needs of her customers and, in this way, increase her sales volume.

The goal towards which Emilce works hard every day, in addition to supporting her daughters, is that of setting up a sales location and selling products that she can't sell right now because she doesn't have the necessary money.

Emilce is requesting a loan to buy other brands of cosmetics and other products such as costume jewelry and lingerie.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and other products to sell

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es:
Carmen es una señora de  30  años de edad, soltera sin carga familiar directa, actualmente vive en el caserío Sialupe Baca ubicado a 25 minutos  de la ciudad de Mochumi – Lambayeque. Este lugar es una comunidad rural,  pequeña de 200 familias aproximadamente.

Desde hace 6 años la señora Carmen se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora. La chicha de jora, es una bebida tradicional y muy popular en el norte del Perú. Esta chicha era una bebida tomada por nuestros antepasados y está hecha a base de jora (insumo similar a la malta) y maíz. Ésta es una bebida fermentada. 

Carmen es muy popular y conocida por su deliciosa chicha. Sus clientes están más que satisfechos con su producto y es por eso que siempre la visitan. Además de ello Carmen cuenta con  algunos ingresos adicionales producto de la comercialización de aves de corral.

Carmen solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles, para la compra de jora, azúcar, ollas y tinajones necesarios para la elaboración y fermentación de la chicha. Esto le permitirá a Carmen seguir ofreciendo la chicha que sus clientes tanto disfrutan.

Carmen es un cliente antiguo de Edpyme Alternativa y tiene un buen record de pagos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 30-year old woman who is single and she doesn’t family in her care. She lives in the community of Sialupe Baca, located at 25 minutes from the city of Mochumi, Lambayeque. It is a small rural community consisting of approximately 200 families.

For the past 6 years Carmen has been selling chicha de jora. Chicha de jora is a traditional and very popular drink in Peru's north. Chicha was a drink that was enjoyed by our ancestors and it is made from jora (an ingredient similar to malt) and corn. It is a fermented drink.

Carmen is very popular and well known for her delicious chicha drink. Her clients are more than satisfied with the product and that is why they always visit her. In addition, Carmen also has an income from selling poultry. 

Carmen requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase jora, sugar, pots, and barrels which she needs to make and ferment chicha drinks. This will help Carmen keep selling chicha drink to her clients who enjoy it so much. 

Carmen is a long time client of Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) and she has a good payment history.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make chicha drinks.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда жительница района Шахритус. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Занимается торговлей на центральном рынке района. В основном она занимается продажей детской одежды. В этой области уже три года. Муж и дочка помогают ей в продвижении ее бизнеса. Она хочет увеличить товарооборот и расширить свою деятельность. Кредит берет для покупки ковров и детской одежды.
texts.en: Mavluda lives in Shahrituz. She is 39 years old, married, and has one child. She works trading in the area’s central market. Primarily she sells children's clothes. She has been doing this for three years. Her husband and her daughter help her with her business. She wants to increase sales and expand into other areas. She is taking out a loan to buy carpets and children's clothes.

loans.use: to buy carpets and children's clothes.

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en:
Dainess, a single woman in her mid 20's, is the mother of a very small child. She also takes care of her young sister who is still in school. Dainess has been running a beauty salon for two years now, and is able to make a good monthly profit working from 8.00 a.m. to 9.00 p.m. daily.

This will be Dainess's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, her previous loans, all since repaid, having been used to pay for her sister's school fees and salon equipment. She now hopes for a loan to buy yet more salon equipment. Her dream is to one day become a designer.

She will share this loan with her group "Saranga," which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment.

loans.name: Angelina Del Carmen

texts.es: Angelina Del Carmen tiene 20 años, su actividad es una panadería. Tiene más de 14 años, en su negocio. Es una mujer emprendedora a pesar de la edad que tiene ha sabido aprovechar las oportunidades que se le ofrecen. luego ella compraba los productos en la panadería donde el esposo trabajaba y ella los vendía, la ganancia era poca, con el tiempo pusieron su propia panadería pequeña únicamente para elaborar repostería, con los financiamientos de fundación león 2000, ha podido comprar maquinarias para trabajar y ahora elaboran panes de toda clase, y ella vende y también tiene otros vendedores. El financiamiento es para la compra de huevos, harina, mantequilla, queso, dulce entre otros.
texts.en: Angelina Del Carmen is 20, her activity is a bakery. She has over 14 years experience in business. She is an enterprising woman who despite her age has seized the opportunities offered. She used to buy the products in the bakery where her husband worked and she would resell them her profits were small but eventually they set up their own small bakery only to make pastry.  With funding from Fundación León 2000, she has been able to buy machinery to work and now produces breads of all kinds that she sells and she also has other vendors. Funding is for the purchase of eggs, flour, butter, cheese, sweets and more.

loans.use: to buy eggs, flour, butter, cheese and sweets, among others.

loans.name: Karibu View Group

texts.en:
Mwajabu, who is in her late 30s, is married with two children who are going to school.  She has had a business selling clothes for 10 years now.  She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the clothes sales and also for a poultry business. She has paid back her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan so she can start distributing her clothes upcountry.  Her dream is to one day be an international businesswoman.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Karibu View" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To distribute  her clothes upcountry

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 28-year-old enterprising man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family goal is to build a house and marry. For seven years he has been in a motorcycle transport business, and this has enabled him to give a helping hand to his parents in raising his siblings. He has a challenge with continuous mechanical breakdown of his motorcycle, and his desire is to buy a new one. James wants this loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Marijen

texts.en:
Marijen is 32 years old and has a fish selling business. This business has been running for 4 years. Marijen's husband is a fisherman and she helps him sell his catch at the market. Marijen also buys more fish from other fishermen so she would have more to sell.

Marijen has 5 children and the oldest child is 6 years old. 

Marijen earns about 3000 PHP per month and works hard to support her family.

Marijen has requested this loan to buy fishing materials such as nets & hooks and more fish for sale. In the future, Marijen hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as nets & hooks and more fish for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 31 years old, and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 
To earn a living, Victoria has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 1,200 each month doing this type of work. Victoria has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to purchase raw ingredients for snacks making.
Victoria has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Victoria would like to see her children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for snacks making

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Ernesto Brian

texts.es: El señor Ernesto vive en casa de sus padres la cual queda ubicada en la zona de  Achumani de  la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene un hijo. Pertenece a un  grupo musical del cual el es encargado. Su esposa trabaja en un instituto donde enseñan el idioma Inglés. El crédito lo requiere para adquirir instrumentos musicales como ser guitarras eléctricas.
texts.en:
Sr. Ernesto lives at the home of his parents in the District of Achumani in the city of La Paz. He is married and has one child. Ernesto is part of a musical group in which he is the leader. His wife works at an institute where she teaches English.

This loan will be used to buy musical instruments, such as electric guitars.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 46 years old and lives in Barnersville. She is married and has six children between 17 and 30 years old.  Two are attending school and live at home, while the other four are living on their own.  Musu is a college student and her husband is a bus driver.  For the past fifteen years she has been selling cassava, potatoes,and yams.   

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cassava, potatoes,and yams for her business.  She likes her business because she makes a lot of profit and has many customers.  She hopes to build a house and a shop for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, potatoes, eddoes and yams for her business

loans.name: Monte De Bendicion 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Midely is a member of her group "Monte D. Bendicion" (Mount of Blessing). Her group is located in the area surrounding Santo Domingo, one of the poorest area in the capital where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable.

Midely is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She will use this loan to buy underwear and pants (women's and men's). She is taking this loan to start her business. She was invited to join this group because the other members knew that Miledy was wondering how to start a business but she was needing capital to begin.  She is using her business profits to reinvest in her business.

Midely  makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and her child. She says that her biggest challenge is to finish building her house. She said her most favorite activity is walking with her son. She dreams of having her house built and living safe and tranquil. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy underwear and pants.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, who is 38 years old and resides in Silang, Cavite City, in the Philippines. She is married to Romeo, a driver, and she has one child. She and her husband manage their own household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and to support her child’s schooling. 

Erlinda oversees the operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a daily quota each day to her. Aside from this, she also sells products via direct sales to her customers. In her business, her regular customers are from the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle and to pay for its maintenance. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Erlinda dreams of being able to give her child a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a thirty-six-year-old diploma holder, married with three children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in her, and her family dream is to educate her children and build a permanent house.

She has a retail shop which she has been operating for the last three years. She faces the challenge of price fluctuation, and her dream is to own a wholesale shop. Jeniffer needs the loan to buy soap, sugar and matchboxes for resale.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Warda

texts.en:
Warda is a 26-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Warda is selling clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase more clothes to sell and expand her business.

Warda is looking to open a shop for her clothes so that she can increase her family's income and improve their living conditions.

Due to culturA. issues, the man in the picture is Warda's husband.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 22 years old and has been in farming for over five years, with his current produce being eggs for the local market. He is single and lives in Litein, South Rift, Kenya, which is his paternal home. He also retails tea, which he sources from other farmers in the area.

Paul has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds and expand his poultry farming business. He says the business will help him build a strong foundation for a family and will meet his basic needs. He is optimistic his business will continue to grow.

He says finances for doing business remain a farmer’s challenge.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Gemma has a tailoring shop where she makes and sells school and office uniforms and dresses. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Carolin

texts.en:
Carolin, 35, is married with four children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling both food and daily use products in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business. Carolin needs a loan of $1500 Samoan Talas (WST) to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or $167 US per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2009, Carolin joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Carolin's second loan with SPBD.

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco tiene su negocio de venta de carne de res en el mercado, es casado y con tres hijos los cuales se encuentra en edad escolar, el trabaja todos los días de la semana.
Ha trabajado tres prestamos con ceprodel y todos estos han sido para su negocio.
El trabaja con su esposa y tiene diez años de tener el negocio, el visita nuevamente las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco has a business selling beef in the market. He is married and has three children who are school-aged. He works every day of the week. 

He has had three loans with Ceprodel and all have been for his business. He works with his wife and has had his business for ten years. He has visited Ceprodel offices again to request a new loan in order to buy beef for his business.

loans.use: to buy beef for sale

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto tiene 33 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Juticalpa, su familia esta conformada por su esposa quien es Maestra de Educacion Primaria y sus dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar educación básica y pre-escolar en la escuela de la localidad. 

Desde niño Rigoberto aprendió el manejo y responsabilidad de tener una actividad comercial ya que sus padres tenian una pulperia y él les ayudaba a atenderla. Ahora Rigoberto se dedica a dos actividades de lunes a viernes es Maestro de Construccion y los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de zapatos y sandalias en el Mayoreo de los municipios de Juticalpa y Catacamas.

Él solicita este préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar un gran surtido de sandalias y zapatos, especialmente estilos que estan a la moda para asi llamar la atencion para que mas personas visiten su negocio. El mayor deseo de Rigoberto es el de aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma mejorar la economía de su hogar.

Este es su tercer ciclo en FAMA y con los prestamos obtenidos ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y antes contaba solo con un local y ahora tiene dos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 33 years old and lives in the city of Juticalpa.  His family includes his wife, who works as an elementary school teacher, and his two children ages 8 and 2 who attend the local school and pre-school.

When he was a boy, Rigoberto learned how to run and manage a business, since his parents had a grocery store and he helped them tend to it.  Now Rigoberto runs two businesses.  From Monday to Friday he works as a construction foreman and also sells shoes and sandals on the weekends, mostly in Juticalpa and Catacamas.

He is asking for this loan so that he can buy a large quantity of sandals and shoes, especially those that are in style, so that he can attract attention to people who visit his business.  Rigoberto’s greatest desire is to increase his income and improve his household finances.

This is his third cycle with FAMA and the loans have helped get his family ahead.  He used to only have one location, and now has two.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is a 64-year-old married woman. She lives in Cabungaan Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Brigida plants, harvests and sells bananas for a living. She's been in the business for 20 years and gains 2,000 PHP a month from this business. She has requested a loan of 4,433 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

In 2011, Brigida joined GDMPC to seek assistance to improve her business. She hopes to improve their living conditions and to save a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Irene Soraida

texts.es:
Irene es una mujer de 19 años, muy honesta, alegre y trabajadora. Irene vive con sus padres en Tulcán que es la Capital de la Provincia del Carchi.

Irene trabaja con su madre en la crianza de cerdos rosados y blancos. Es el segundo crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a invertir en la compra de balanceado para la alimentación de sus cerdos ya que quiere engordarles para poder sacarles a la venta, también usará este crédito para la compra de crías de cerdos blancos para engorde y su posterior venta. Este proceso ayudará a Irene a incrementar su negocio y crecer su propio capital para en un futuro poder formar una familia y sustentar los gastos.

Irene desea seguir trabajando para poder obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Irene is a 19-year-old, very honest, happy, and hard-working woman. She lives with her parents in Tulcan, the capital of Carchi Province.

Irene works with her mother in raising  pink and white pigs. This is the 2nd loan she has solicited through FODEMI, and she will invest it in buying feed for her pigs so she can fatten them to sell. Also, she will use the loan to buy more white pigs to fatten and later sell. This process will help Irene to expand her business and increase her own capital for the future, enabling her to form a family and cover future expenses.

Irene wants to continue working in order to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy feed for her pigs and also more white pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Benkadi Kagoua 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  Benkadi Kagoua 7 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kouroubadougou, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec    KOURA, debout au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte  acheter des intrants, semence, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour  pour l’exploitation de 0,75 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi Kagoua 7 group are married women with an average age of 40, on average 6 children, and who all live in traditional family settings in Kouroubadougou, one of the villages in San, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan with the institution. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Koura, standing in the middle of the picture, farms groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the labour costs for the cultivation of three quarters of a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 100 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small equipment, and to pay labour costs.

loans.name: Selvin Rolando

texts.es: Selvin Rolando de 36 años de edad, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora quien se dedica de lleno a su propio negocio en el cual trabaja como agricultor, sembrando frijoles y maíz, para posteriormente comercializarlos en su casa de habitación y así mismo en diferentes mercados donde vende por mayoreo, obteniendo ganancias aceptables, principal razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual le sea posible comprar mayor cantidad de semillas para sembrar y de esta forma aumentar en gran porcentaje la cantidad de cosechas para vender, lo que le permitirá a Selvin contar con más ganancias, las cuales sean de mucho beneficio para su esposa y su hogar.

loans.use: Compra de semillas para sembrar

loans.name: Sourouchi Toto's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sourouchi Toto, celle qui a la main levée sur la photo est âgée de 26 ans et est mariée à un certain Donatien. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sourouchi Toto vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par le couple. Sourouchi Toto a fréquenté l'école et s'est arrêté au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses charges, Sourouchi Toto vend de l’igname frit accompagné de beignets de haricot depuis dix ans environ. Sourouchi Toto s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Sourouchi Toto ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe, sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter de l'igname, de l'huile végétale et du charbon de bois.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en: Mwanaidi is 20 years old. She is not married and lives in Bagamoyo District, Tanzania. Mwanaidi is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide who teaches local students valuable life skills. Mwanaidi plans to start a business selling women’s clothes. She requests a Kiva loan to start this business which she believes will change her life economically. Mwanaidi will use the profits to help her family with human basic needs and to help her study a short computer course.

loans.use: to start a business selling women's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married with five children; two children attend college, two are in secondary school and one child is in primary school. She has been in the clothing business since 1990. She previously took a loan from Krep and successfully repaid it.

She is seeking a loan to expand her business and diversify her line of products for motorcycle taxis which are becoming common in Kisumu and the surrounding areas.

She will use her income to pay for her children’s college fees and for her family’s needs.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a hard-working and responsible single mother of three kids, ages 18, 20 and 21. She didn't have anyone's support in raising her kids, and she had to work very hard for their well being. To cover the costs of their education, Rosa has been selling food for the past six years, and has been able to move the family forward. To meet the growing demand for her products, one of her sisters and her oldest son help out.

Rosa wants her business to keep growing, and is requesting a loan to remodel her shop so she can have larger store that is more customer-friendly. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can play a part in the growth for this business and help Rosa. She and her family are thankful for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, es madre soltera de tres jóvenes, de 18, 20 y 21 años de edad. Rosa nunca ha tenido el apoyo de nadie para sacar adelante a sus hijos, y ha tenido que esforzarse mucho pero lo hace por el bienestar de ellos. Para poder cubrir los costos de sus estudios Rosa inició con la venta de comidas desde hace seis años, de esta manera ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, para poder cubrir su creciente demanda ahora cuenta con la ayuda de una de sus hermanas y su hijo menor.

Rosa desea que su negocio continúe creciendo, para lo que solicita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la remodelación del local, de esta manera podrá ofrecer un lugar más amplio y agradable para sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a Rosa, ella y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Afi Lucia

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afi Lucia L. was born on March 22,1966, she does not have any children but is supporting three (3) nephews and a niece. For the last 15 years she has been doing small retailing and farming. With these activities she assumes as best one can the food needs of the children. Honest and dynamic, she has been able to manage her three previous loans. In order to increase her cultivable land, she is soliciting a financial help of $750 that will allow her to cultivate corn, manioc, okra and peanut. Part of it will be designated for the sale of peanuts, medicines and others. Thus she will be able to provide for her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née le 22 Mars 1966, Madame L. Afi Lucia n’a pas d’enfants mais elle a en charge trois (3) neveux et une nièce. Elle fait depuis plus de 15 ans le petit commerce et l’agriculture. A partir de ces activités, elle assume tant bien que mal les besoins alimentaires des enfants. Honnête et dynamique, elle a su gérer les trois précédents crédits obtenus. Afin d’étendre sa surface cultivable, elle sollicite un appui financier de $750 qui servira à faire la culture de maïs, de manioc, de gombo et d’arachide. Une partie va être destinée à la vente d’arachide, de médicaments et autres. Elle pourra ainsi subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Cutivate corn, manioc, okra and peanut

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty is 54 years old with three children; two of whom can be found in Bolivia and one is traveling. Currently her children are dedicated to the construction and collaborate with her since she runs her business at night. Betty is a very hardworking mother and responsible for her family.

Betty is dedicated to selling food in her family business that offers Sillpanchos and Trancapechos. She takes care of it for 15 days and her brother takes care of it for the other 15 days. They have more than 30 years of experience in that area of food and have a great demand since they are well known in that area.

The competition nowadays for this product is very high, but since the business has been around for so long; the excellent location on America Street and Lobertador Bolivia; and of course the quality of their products relative to other places, they have been very successful.

Betty will buy a conservative with three parts that will allow her to keep her vegetables, conserve the meat and some seasonings used in making her product. The price varies and can range from $400 to $500. This is the fourth time that Betty is seeking a loan. She has repaid all her previous loans without any problems. She was only behind for one day but is a great client and qualifies for another loan. She is currently seeking a $525 loan.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Betty tiene 54 años de edad, cuenta con 3 hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran en Bolivia uno de viaje. Actualmente sus hijos se dedican a la construccion y colaboran con ella ya que la atención de su negocio se la hace por la noche, Betty es una madre muy trabajadora y responsable con su familia. Betty se dedica a vender comida, en su negocio familiar ofrece Sillpanchos y Trancapechos, por otra parte la señora atiende 15 dias y los otros 15 dias su hermano, ambos se turnan. Tienen una experiencia de más de 30 años en el rubro de la comida y con una buena demanda debido a que son muy conocidos. La competencia hoy en dia de este producto es bastante fuerte pero la antigüedad del negocio, la excelente ubicación America esq. Libertador Bolivar y por supuesto la calidad de producto que ofrece a comparación a otros lugares de venta. Betty comprara una conservadora de tres cuerpos, los cuales le serviran para guardar sus verduras, conservar la carne y algunos condimentos que utiliza en la elaboracion de su producto, el precio es variable ya que el que comprar algo nuevo nuevo el precio oscilaría entre $us. 400.- y $us. 500.-. Esta solicitud es la cuarta secuencia de Betty, los anteriores créditos los canceló con normalidad, presenta un promedio de mora mínimo de 1 dia de retraso pero se la puede calificar como una buena cliente esto en funcion a nuestra Institucion. Se hace notar que el crédito es por Bs. 4,000.-

loans.use: Purchase a conservative.

loans.name: Ni Komang Sunarti

texts.id:
Besides being a farmer Ni Komang Sunarti also raised fattening piglets. With the capital she had, Ni Komang Sunarti bought 2 piglets for Rp250,000 (about US$26)/piece. Ni Komang Sunarti is persistent in this business, since family economical needs forced her to work hard to think about raising her 3 small children. Her stall is already permanent. Ni Komang Sunarti could profit Rp1000,000 (about US$105) within 6 months. This profit very much help her household expense needs, since if they only rely on her husbands income as tenant farmer, it would not be sufficient to pay for daily expoenses. For future plans, Ni Komang Sunarti likes to raise more pigs so that she could receive more profit, and her family's economy could improve.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Selain sebagai petani Ni Komang Sunarti juga memelihara babi penggemukan. Dengan modal yang ada, Ni Komang Sunarti membeli 2 ekor bibit babi seharga Rp. 250.000.- per ekor. Ni Komang Sunarti sangat tekun menjalankan usaha ini karena tuntutan ekonomi keluarga sehingga ia harus bekerja keras dan memikirkan biaya 3 orang anak yang masih kecil. Kandang yang dimilikinya sudah permanen. Ni Komang Sunarti bisa menerima keuntungan sebesar Rp.1.000.000.- dalam 6 bulan. Keuntungan ini sangat membantu untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya, karena bila hanya mengandalkan suami yang hanya sebagai petani, kadang tidak mencukupi untuk biaya sehari-hari.Untuk itu rencananya kedepan, Ni Komang Sunarti ingin lebih banyak memelihara bibit babi agar bisa mendapat keuntungan yg lebih dan ekonomi keluarga semakin baik.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock & feed

Membeli pakan dan bibit babi

loans.name: Alizakir

texts.ru:
Alizakir B. lives in Saatli, Azerbaijan. He is 50 years old, is married and has 3 children. Alizakir is the sole provider for his family and his sole means of income is raising cattle. Every year he purchases young calves from households in nearby villages, then grows them in his household for 8-9 months and afterwards sells them to local butchers.

Today, Alizakir is thinking about expanding his business, as the profits from his current livestock are not enough to support his 3 children. He plans to expand his annual purchase of calves by 5 heads. In order to do this he needs to invest $500 in his business. Alizakir has turned to Normicro – a KIVA partner - in order to receive a loan for this sum.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr. Ализакир живет в городе Саатлы Республики Азербайджан, расположенном в Закавказье. Ему 50 года, он женат, имеет 3-х детей. Ализакир является единственным кормильцем семьи и имеет единственный доход от выращивания и продажи крупного рогатого скота на местном базаре. Ежегодно он покупает молодых телок с приусадебных хозяйств близлежащих деревень, выращивает их в течении 8-9 месяцев в своём хозяйстве и затем продаёт уже повзрослевших коров и быков местным мясникам. Сегодня Ализакир думает о расширении своего бизнеса, т.к. дохода с нынешнего стада не хватает для обеспечения необходимых потребностей его 3-х детей. Он планирует расширить ежегодный обьём закупок телят на 5 штук больше. Для этого ему требуется инвестировать в его бизнес около 500 долларов. Чтобы получить эту сумму, Ализакир обратился в микро кредитную организацию "Нормикро" - партнёру КИВА - для получения кредита.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
"My name is Rukhsana A.. I have lived all my life in Arifwala, a small town in Pakistan. I am married and the mother of two: one boy and one girl. My husband is a rickshaw driver and we need a loan to pay off the remaining installments on our rickshaw. I plan to construct an additional room in my house in future.

There are four other women for whom I also want to get loans, so that they can improve their businesses. Shamim B. requires a loan to buy a donkey cart. Azra B. wants a loan for her husband who supplies various grocery items to different shops in the city. Shabeer B. wants a loan for their sugarcane juice stall. Zakia B. will use the loan for their grocery item supplies business."

loans.use: Pay off remaining installments on our rickshaw

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Giá, 39 years old, lives in Sóc Sơn. She joins the TYM Fund in 1994. The funds of her first loan was invested in a food stand which serves inexpensive breakfast items. She was young and energetic. Her house situates right at Rout 133, near by the headquarter of the Air Force division and other government offices. From a small breakfast stand, she expands it to a full-fledged restaurant, Phúc-Giá. The restaurant has three employees with monthly salary of 50USD each. Her monthly income is 350USD. She is applying for a loan of 1,200USD to stock more goods. She hope she can be approved with her next loan of 3,000USD,

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Giá, 39 tuổi, sống tại Sóc Sơn là thành viên tham G. Quỹ năm 1994. Vốn vay vòng 1 được chị đầu tư bán hàng ăn sáng với những món ăn ngon miệng, rẻ tiền, đặc trưng của vùng nông thôn Việt Nam như xôi đỗ, cháo gà, bánh nếp, bánh rán ... Mặc dù còn trẻ nhưng chị Giá là một phụ nữ năng động tháo vát, nhà lại ngay mặt đường 131, cạnh sư đoàn không quân và các cơ quan, thuận tiện giao thông, nên chị bàn với anh sửa chữa nâng cấp nhà mở rộng kinh doanh hàng ăn. Với cái rét thấu người duới 10 độ, nếu bạn có thời gian và muốn làm ấm lòng mình để bù đắp năng lượng tiêu hao xin mời đến với nhà hàng Phúc-Giá với món khoái khẩu lẩu lòng bò-gà. Hiện tại chị Giá thuê 3 người giúp việc với mức lương tháng 50USD. Với thu nhập 350USD/tháng của cửa hàng, vòng vốn này chị Giá xin vay 1200USD để mua thực phẩm, đồ uống thu hút thêm ngày càng đông khách. Trong tương lai, dự định của chị là muốn vay thêm 3000USD đầu tư nhà hàng tại một địa điểm khác.

loans.use: Buy food, drink

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is known as an enterprising and optimistic woman. Her clients recognize the hard work she puts into her work everyday and see her worried about the care of her farmland and an adecuate spreading of compost. All this to support her family economically and most importantly pay her children’s education, which is a cost that continues to demand more and more.

Despite Esther’s hard work in her fields, her crops are not improving and she is very worried because the only way to better her next harvest will be to use compost and buy a greater amount of plants. She hopes you can kindly contribute so she can reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

ESTHER, se caracteriza por ser una dama emprendedora y optimista, sus clientes conocen del trabajo que realiza y el empeño que le pone a su actividad todos los días, al verla muy preocupada en el cuidado de sus terrenos y el adecuado abono que le da a sus productos. Todo ello con el fin de poder solventar los gastos de su familia y sobre todo cubrir la inversión que demanda la educación de sus 2 hijos quienes a medida que van creciendo van demandando mayor inversión, Esther trata de cubrir de cierta forma los requerimientos y necesidades de sus hijos, con tal de verlos realizados.A pesar del gran esfuerzo que tiene que hacer en sus chacras sus productos no están mejorando y ella está muy preocupada, porque la única manera sería abonar sus terrenos y comprar mayor cantidad de plantas de cultivo para mejorar su próxima cosecha. Para ello requiere de una suma de dinero el cual solicita en calidad de préstamo y espera que usted pueda cooperar noblemente para alcanzar este propósito.

loans.use: To buy fruit plants, composts and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dương Thị Hạnh, 26 years old, lives with her husband and their 4 years old son. This is her second loan with the TYM Fund. Before joining the Fund her family was in very difficult time, now it’s been improved. She is a seamstress and she needs some capital. People advised her to join the Fund. Her first loan was easy and well invested. She feels very comfortable with the weekly repayment plan and would like to continue. Her current income is 4-5USD a day. She would like to apply for a loan of 575USD to stock more material for her job..

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Dương Thị Hạnh, 26 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2007. Đây là vòng vốn thứ 2 chị được vay. Trước khi vào Quỹ, kinh tế gia đình chị Hạnh có nhiều khó khăn do mới xây dựng gia đình. Chị Hạnh làm hàng may phục vụ nhân dân trong vùng nhưng ít vốn nên công việc chưa mang lại nhiều kết quả. Được chị em tư vấn, chị xin vay vốn của Quỹ Tình thương. Sau vòng vốn đầu, chị Hạnh đã quen với việc hoàn trả tuần và nhận thầy hiệu quả do Quỹ mang lại. Hiện nay, mức thu nhập mỗi ngày của chị trung bình 4-5USD. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay mức tối đa là 575USD để mua thêm vải may. Chị Hạnh hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con trai 4 tuổi.

loans.use: Buy materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Karima

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 25 year-old Karima Y.. She is single, and has no children. In 2007, Karima established her small petrol station business. Karima requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of oil in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of petrol in bulk.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Uch C. works at a garment factory, earning $3 per day. Her husband, Mrs. Kheav Sokhon, 34, works for a mobile phone company and earns about $5 per day. They have one child and live in Kork Khleang Village, Phnom Penh City.

They would like to attempt new ventures to increase their income. They request a loan of $1,000 to purchase oxen to breed and sell. The loan will allow them to increase their household income and thereby improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase oxen to breed and sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aminata D. is 47 years old and lives with her eight children and her husband in a monogamous family in the Pelengana quarter, south of the city of Ségou (fourth largest economic region in Mali). In the beginning she used to send her servants out to search for firewood for her own personal use, but when her neighbors saw the bundles of wood, they would always come and ask her to sell them some of it. Therefore, she decided to get involved in the firewood business and has been involved in it for 13 years. She makes all her sales at home, for cash or credit to her customers, who are mainly comprised of women as well as bakers. She sells firewood year-round. After having taken out five group loans, she is on her second individual loan and all previous loans were correctly repaid. With this loan she hopes to buy 20 loads of firewood from the surrounding villages of Ségou from farmers who are legally established in the firewood business, and she hopes to make a monthly profit of 12,000 FCFA (about $29), which she hopes to reinvest into her business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Aminata D. est âgée de 47ans et vit avec ses 8 enfants et son mari dans une famille monogame dans le quartier Pelengana sud de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région économique de la république du Mali). Au début elle envoyait ses domestiques chercher du bois de chauffe pour usage personnel, ses voisins voyant les tas de fagots, venaient toujours lui demander de leur en vendre une partie. C’est ainsi qu’elle a pris l’initiative de faire ce commerce et cela depuis 13 ans. Elle effectue toutes ses ventes à domicile au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée à majorité de femmes et également de boulangers. Elle mène cette activité toute l’année. Apres 5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe), elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 20 chargements de bois de chauffe dans les villages environnants de la ville de Ségou auprès des paysans légalement établis pour cette activité et espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 12 000 FCFA. Elle compte renforcer son commerce avec ce bénéfice.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Ousmane B. est chauffeur de profession, il est marié et pére de 4 enfants. Ce sociétaire de la caisse de Ziguinchor, est trés réaliste, grâce à ses économies et un premier prêt de  1 500 000 F CFA il a construit sa propre maison. Il sollicite un crédit pour acheter des zincs et sortir enfin de la location
texts.en:
Ousmane B. works as a driver and is married and the father of four children. As a member of the Ziguinchor savings bank, he is very practical and thanks to his savings as well as a first loan of 1,500,000 Francs CFA, he built his own house. He is seeking a loan to buy sheet metal so that he will finally be able to get beyond renting.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish housing construction

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of jewelry, perfumes, clothing and other goods for her small business.

loans.name: Mariétou

texts.fr: Mariétou T. est une vendeuse à Ouakam qui a huit ans d'expérience. Elle est mariée et grâce et son commerce, elle entretien sa famille. Elle peut souvent gagner jusqu'à 10000 fcfa par jour. Elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer ses activités en vue d'augmenter ses revenues et améliorer ainsi sa situation.
texts.en:
Mariétou T. is a salesperson in Ouakam who has 8 years of experience. She is married and thanks to her business, she suports her family. She can often earn up to 10,000 F CFA per day. She is requesting this loan to bolster her business so that she can improve her earnings and thus her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling cloth and incense

loans.name: Lauth A.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Lauth M. from Mbeya. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 14 and 18. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependents whose parents died of HIV.

Lauth has been running a small shop since 2007. Her business is purchasing items wholesale and selling them retail. She works at the business for 8 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Lauth currently earns about $150 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $425 in order to buy soda, wheat flour, rice, and groundnuts. In the future, she plans to expand and establish another business. Lauth thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy soda, wheat flour, rice, and groundnuts

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora L. is currently in the business of selling alcohol. Flora is 20 years old and is divorced. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house and open up shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To construct a house and open up shop

loans.name: Lina

texts.fr: Née en 1941 à Gbodjomé, Mme A. Lina est mariée et mère de neuf (09) enfants. Son mari étant retraité toutes les charges du ménage se reposent pratiquement sur elle seule. Ce qui rend la vie du foyer difficile, car son petit commerce de légumineuses et articles de ménage n’arrivent pas à couvrir les charges du ménage. Pour s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante en marchandises et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille, elle sollicite un financement.
texts.en:
Borin in Gbodjomé in 1941, Mrs. Lina A. is married and the mother of nine children. Her husband being retired, she has to provide for the household expenses almost on her own. This makes life difficult since her little business selling legumes and household goods, is not sufficient to meet the family expenses. She's seeking a loan to purchase large quantities of goods in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods for her shop

loans.name: Reaksmei

texts.en: Mrs.Reaksmei I. is a villager I. Kvav village I. Takeo province. She is a basket maker. Her husband, Mr. Morm Virak, is a coconut seller. His business is going well and he wants to expand it. Mrs. Reaksmei is requesting a loan to buy more coconuts to resell. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is a 27-year-old mother with a young child, who isn't able to work or study yet. Her husband is with her I. the picture.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to resell

loans.name: Abd Alftah

texts.en:
Abd Alftah A. is only 19. However, despite his age, he is already mature and started to worry about how he is going to provide a better standard of living for his family.

 Abd Alftah owns a small store where he sells a variety of goods such as rice, milk, and soft drinks and earns enough money for the family. But in order to increase his stock of goods, he is asking a loan of US$ 1000. He would appreciate your assistance very much.

loans.use: purchase more goods for his grocery store

loans.name: Fedelia

texts.en: Fedelia sells sarongs. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 35 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Uromi in Edo State, Nigeria. She needs a loan in the amount of N120000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell  .

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en: Mouhamad is 25 years old, and lives with his parents in Bit Jbeil, located in Southern Lebanon. Mouhamad has been working as a panel writer for five years. He is requesting a loan of $2000 to purchase a set of writing instruments and tools, to facilitate and increase the flow of his business. Mouhamad hopes that his loan will help increase his business and provide him with enough income to expand his clientele and outreach.

loans.use: To purchase new tools and instruments

loans.name: Alexa Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Eloísa Edelia O., Francis Yamileth Arias V. y  Vilma de los Angeles F. L..

 Este grupo tiene su domicilio en  la ciudad de Masaya, estas tres mujeres tienen actividades comerciales diferentes, se conocen desde hace muchos años y tienen una gran confianza una en la otra. 

Doña Eloísa es comerciante en el mercado vendiendo frutas, las compra al por mayor y ella vende al detalle durante el día, tiene un hijo de 4 años que va a la escuela, su esposo trabaja en una empresa textilera y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Doña Francis es la coordinadora del grupo, ella tiene un puesto de truchas en el mercado donde ofrece productos como: baterías, tijeras, hilos, calculadoras etc., además vende detergentes de forma ambulante dentro del mercado y en su casa sus hijos le ayudan a ver una pequeña pulpería. En el mercado le ayuda su esposo a ver el puesto y ella realiza las compras y hace los pedidos. Sueña con terminar la casa que están construyendo en terreno propio y muy pronto trasladarse a vivir ahí.

Expresan que en Adim le han enseñado a controlar mejor su negocio con las capacitaciones que reciben y también a mejorar de manera personal.
texts.en:
Photograph from Left to Right: Eloísa Edelia O., Francis Yamileth Arias V. and Vilma de los Angeles F. L.. This group is domiciled in the city of Masaya. These three women have different commercial enterprises, have known each other for many years, and have a great deal of confidence in each other. Eloísa is a merchant at the market selling fruits that she buys at wholesale. She works as a street vendor during the day, and has a 4-year-old son who is in school. Her husband works at a textile enterprise and helps with the household expenses. Francis is the group’s coordinator, and runs a stand at the market where she sells products such as batteries, scissors, thread, calculators, etc. In addition, she sells detergents at the market and from her house where her children help her tend to a small general store. She helps her husband tend to their stall in the market, making the purchases and orders. She dreams of finishing the house they are building on their own land, and hopes to move there soon to live. They comment that Adim has helped them learn how to better manage their businesses with the help provided, as well as helped improve their standards of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various products to offer to customers and increase their sales.  The products are various and for a number of uses, such as: nail clippers, calculators, threads, needles, clocks, decals, etc.

loans.name: Tsedenbyamba

texts.en:
Tserenbyamba S. is 28 and lives with her parents and three-year-old son in Uvurhanghay, one of Mongolia's southern provinces. Her parents receive a government pension, but her mother has been ill lately. Although Tserenbyamba has her own one-bedroom apartment in town, she has rented it out to pay for medicine for her sick mother. 

After she graduated from university in 2001, Tserenbyamba started a small retail business selling women and men's clothing. Early that year, she opened a small stall in the local market, and in December 2008, she rented another stall in a new shopping center that just opened. She usually buys clothing from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She hopes she can afford all the medicine her mother needs, and would eventually like to open her own clothing shop. Tserenbyamba is applying for this loan to buy more clothing from Ulaanbaatar to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ork's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is made up of three borrowers; all of them are people living in Phnom Penh City. Mr. Ork S., 38, has been recruited to be leader by the members. Ork S. currently works driving a trailer motor taxi (tuk tuk). Almost of his customers are local traders who work selling merchandise in the market. He starts providing his service in the early morning and finishes his work in the late evening and with much income. He is married with three children, while his wife is a homemaker. Recently, Ork S. can’t take on as many customers as before since his motor has problems frequently. Thus, he is applying for a loan on Kiva in order to repair his old motor taxi.  The other two borrowers are:
Mrs. S., who will be using the loan to purchase a motorbike for her family’s touring needs.
Mr. S., who is looking for a loan to buy a used motor in order to make his family’s transportation easier.

loans.use: To repair his old motor taxi

loans.name: Lawa

texts.en:
Lawa J. is currently in the business of selling bread and paste and is requesting a loan to open up a bakery.  Lawa is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a clerk in the Ministry of education, science and technology, government of southern Sudan. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a big shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a bakery.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos es una persona muy tranquila y responsable, tiene 45 años y vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres, junto a su esposa Carmen de 45 años, a quien desea dar una mejor vida. Con muchos ánimos de progresar Carlos comienza sus días en su puesto de venta de bicicletas que está ubicado en la Explanada Laguna temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), él es un vendedor muy hábil y siempre convence a sus clientes de comprarle una bicicleta. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para encargarse de su negocio y ser su propio jefe. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer todo el día bajo el inclemente sol, ya que esto lo cansa mucho. Para un futuro cercano, Carlos espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender bicicletas nuevas, ya que actualmente se dedica a vender las bicicletas que arregla. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y espera tener la misma puntualidad que tuvo en sus dos primeros créditos. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y solidario. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar más bicicletas para arreglarlas y así incrementar la cantidad que vende.
texts.en:
Carlos is an easy-going and responsible person. His is forty-five years old and lives in a house that he inherited from his parents. He lives with is wife Carmen, 45 years old, to whom he desires to provide a better life. With a lot of drive to succeed, Carlos begins his days at his business selling bicycles at the “Esplanada Laguna”. It is a temporary location in the city of Juliaca where they have fairs. He is a very able salesperson. He always convinces his customers to buy bicycles. What he likes the best about his business is the freedom to be own boss. He has been in business for five years. He finds that the most difficult part of his business is to remain all day in the sun as it tires you out a lot. In the near future, Carlos hopes to have a store where he can sell new bicycles or bicycles that he fixes up. This is his fifth loan with MFP and he hopes to have the same punctuality that he had with the first two loans. He is a responsible and joint member of the communal bank. With the 600 soles he has requested, he will buy more bicycles to fix up and increase the number that he sells.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his inventory

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 53 years old. She is married and has 6 children. She sells cooked foods like rice, beans, etc. She is hoping for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more food to cook and sell. She say "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food to cook and sell

loans.name: Litia

texts.en:
Litia T.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting taro for sale. She is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Fusi Saoluafata. She is married and has three small children. Litia has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 500 WST a month.

In 2009, Litia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Litia is requesting a loan for the first time from SPBD. She is requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Litia plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. (0)

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Salapateh Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu K., Aminata T., Memuna K., Rugiatu B. and Ramatu B.. They call their group Salapateh. They are local entrepreneurs in Waterloo small-town, about 22 miles from Freetown. This is the first loan this group of entrepreneurs is accessing from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone. With the help of a loan of LE 500,000 for each entrepreneur, they will be able to expand their businesses, make better profits and consequently improve the status and quality of their businesses.

Isatu K. (right and attached below left) is the leader of the group. She is 23 years old. She was born in a village called Masinra, in northern Sierra Leone. Isatu is a widow with one child who is four years old. Isatu sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), bananas, plantains, cucumbers, pineapples, and any other items she discovers to be in high demand in the market. With this loan, Isatu will buy gallons of palm-oil. Five gallons make a “barter” and a barter of palm-oil costs her LE 60,000, which she sells at LE 65,000 - 70,000. Isatu has been in business for a year now.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm-oil for resale

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou T. est une femme mariée de 59 ans. Elle s’active dans la vente de bétail comme mouton, chèvre. Elle projette de renforcer son activité pour mieux aider à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou T. is a 59-year-old married woman. She engages in the sale of livestock like sheep, goats. She plans to strengthen her business to help better improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of livestock

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: 43-year-old Gemma E. lives with her husband and their 2 children, which are both in school. She manages 1 hectare of rice field in her hometown in South Cotabato. She joined CEV in 2007 and is very thankful for the financial service she was able to avail because she said it is a big help in her business. Now she is requesting to loan Php12, 000. The loan will be used to purchase farm inputs. Hopefully, Gemma will have a good harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Tonya

texts.en:
Tonya never imagined she would end up running a plumbing company but, following a series of challenges, that’s exactly how Tonya and her husband, Ted, found a way to provide for their family.

At age 18, Tonya gave birth to their oldest son, and two more children followed soon thereafter. The family survived for years on her husband’s work as a plumber and Tonya’s career as a corporate executive assistant.

After suffering through a severe illness for a few years, Tonya was laid off from her job in 2008. Throughout Tonya’s illness and recovery, Ted was by her side to take care of her. He cut back his hours working as a plumber and eventually the family filed for bankruptcy as medical bills stacked up. “When all was said and done, we’d lost our home, lost everything and had to start over.” 

Tonya is now healthy and grateful for a new chance at life. She works side-by-side with her husband at Plumbwerx Plumbing, their family-run business. It’s a full service plumbing company specializing in all phases of residential and commercial plumbing, with one of their niches being tankless water heaters, an eco-friendly product that saves consumers money, energy and provides continuous hot water!

“Most people aren’t expecting to see a woman running a plumbing business when they come into the office,” said Tonya. But it’s clear she runs a tight ship and she puts her background as a corporate executive assistant to good use, deftly managing the accounting, marketing, sales, inventory, and dispatching her husband and team on jobs.

“I get calls everyday from referral partners who want us to provide all types of plumbing services but I have to turn them down because we don’t have the manpower to meet demand,” said Tonya. A $10,000 loan will allow Plumbwerx to hire an additional plumber and purchase another vehicle and new equipment.

loans.use: To hire an additional plumber and purchase another vehicle and new equipment

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 25 years old and married. She has two children; the eldest is three years old. Helen has dreams for her young family. Like any mother, she wants her kids to go to school and finish college and hopefully find a decent job. Helen’s business is rice farming and from her last harvest, she noticed a positive change to her income.

A member of CEVI for a more than a year, she applied to loan 10,000 PHP. She will use this loan to purchase farm supplies that she needs for her farm. Hopefully, she will have profits again and be able to save for her family’s future.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Monina

texts.en: Mrs. Monina D. is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old, is married, and is blessed with seven adult children.
